She has become a great example in the community and it is because of her that a group of women have joined with her to start businesses that will help them reach great success in life.

Her respective use for the loan is to buy soft drink merchandise to make it available to the people who want these beverage products. One of her greatest aspirations is to make a soda storeroom and buy more products that are still not sold in the community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ermo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ermo es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que por medio de la compra venta de artículos reciclado, viene luchando para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder tener un mayor stock de productos, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aluminio, cartón, plásticos y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Señor Ermo is a very hardworking, unselfish person, who by means of purchasing and selling recycled articles, has been fighting to be able to grow and to improve his living conditions. 

He says that he used his previous loan to be able to have a bigger stock of products, which was a great help to him.

Today he is requesting a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of aluminum, cardboard, plastic, and other items, so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials, such as plastics, bronze, cardboard, and others.

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL RENACER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yusvenia ella es soltera y tiene 23 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal El Renacer.
 
 otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the communal bank “El Renacer” (“The Rebirth”). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Yusvenia is one of the members. She is single and 23 years old. She works in her business, selling grains. She sells maize, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8:00a.m to 5:00p.m. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have premises from which she can sell her grains. She is requesting the loan in order to buy wheat, maize, and quinoa. 

The person who has a circle over his face does not belong to the communal bank “El Renacer” anymore. The other members make a living by selling ceramics, fruit, groceries, and food.

Yusvenia is grateful to those who become part of her dream through this platform and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Jóvenes  Emprendedores que lleva el nombre de San Francisco  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo, es un grupo muy responsable, solidario , se ayudan entre sí, y comentan que están formando este grupo para poder sentirse útil y ayudar a sus familias.
Jorge es parte de este grupo, es vendedor y pide este préstamo para comprar ropas, zapatos y demás, para poder venderlos y sentirse útil ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group of young entrepreneurs has the name of San Francisco and is in its first loan cycle. It is a very responsible, close-knit group, who help each other, and say that they are forming this group to be able to feel useful and help their families.

Jorge is part of this group. He is a vendor and asks for this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, and others, in order to be able to sell them and feel useful helping his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Limberth

texts.es: Limberth esta casado y tiene 1 hijo Limberth vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Palomar en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres, la casa tiene luz y agua Limberth se gana la vida como agricultor y quiere un credito para la compra de dos torillos A Limberth le ayuda su esposa con las actividades de agricultura Limberth tiene buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Limberth is married and has one child. He lives with his parents in the community of Palomar in a brick and cement house that his parents own. The house has electricity and water. 

Limberth earns his living in agriculture, and he wants a loan to purchase two young bulls. Limberth's wife helps him with his agricultural activities. He has good health and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La Sra. Silvina es la tesorera del grupo, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se destaca por sus ganas de salir adelante y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos varios, como verduras y frutas, con lo que podrá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Divino Niño is in its first women's committee cycle, in which everyone works and helps each other improve. Señora Silvina is the group treasurer. She is a merchant, who sells fruits and vegetables, and is a hardworking woman who is highlighted for her desire to more forward and grow.
She asks this loan to buy various products, such as vegetables and fruits, with which she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres al poder está dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudarse e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Ramona es una de las integrantes, quien se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante con el trabajo que está haciendo. Ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos y su posterior venta, si bien este es un trabajo humilde, le gusta ya que es una forma digna de ganarse la vida. Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus cerdos, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The group called "Women of Power" is within the women's committee program, where each one is doing her best to help herself and improve her living conditions. Ramona is one of the members who is struggling to be able to grow and get ahead in the work she is doing. She is in the business of raising hogs and later selling them. Though it's humble work, she likes it since it's a dignified way of earning a living. She is requesting this loan to purchase nutritionally balanced fodder for the pigs, which will be a great deal of help.

loans.use: to purchase balanced nutrition for pigs

loans.name: Yavana Martha

texts.es:
Yavana es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, inteligente, entusiasta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Ciudad Satelite de El Alto, este sitio se caracteriza por el clima frío durante todo el año que no llega a superar los 17ºC en verano. Las temperaturas bajo cero son comunes en días de invierno y además es atacada por fuertes vientos que provienen del altiplano cercano, debido a este ambiente, es común en las temporadas más frías del año encontrar parte de la ciudad cubierta por nieve.
Yavana es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada; ¡Aproveche el remate a dos bolivianos de las poleras! ¡Camisas dos en cinco! ¡Remate de ropa mixta en dos bolivianos!. Estas son algunas de las ofertas de ropa usada que comercializa a partir de las 07.00 horas en medio del frío que sopla en las alturas. Ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia refaccionando su vivienda.
Es por esos motivos que Yavana solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de construcción y refaccionar su vivienda para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Yavana is a 28 year old woman, married, mother of two children, who works selling used clothes. She is enterprising, tenacious, intelligent, enthusiastic, responsible and very hardworking. Her business is located in the area of the Satellite City of El Alto. This place is characterized by its cold weather during the whole year, that does not get over 17ºC in the summer. Temperatures below zero are common in winter days, and there are also strong winds coming from the nearby mountains. Because of this weather, it is common to find part of the city covered in snow during the coldest seasons of the year. Yavana is of dark skin, long black hair and medium height. Her native language is Aymara and she uses Spanish for commerce. Her business is selling used clothes: "Take advantage of the sale of skirts for two bolivianos (Bolivian currency)!",  "Two shirts for five!"  "Sale of mixed items for two bolivianos!" These are some of the sales in clothing that she offers starting at 7 in the morning in midst of the cold that blows from the mountains. She wants to improve the quality of life of her family by remodeling her house. This is the reason why Yavana is requesting a loan to buy building material and to remodel her house in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy building material and to remodel her house in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 58 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rustico, en una comunidad pequeña de 50 familias, Daniel mantiene respeto por su comunidad y el medio ambientes; se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su comunidad, es natural del Caserio El Frayle del Distrito Santo Tomas, de la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Daniel es la cria y comercializacion de animales menores(cuyes, patos, gallinas, pavos), los que cria en el corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad hace 35 años y hace 25 años cultiva tres has de maiz, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, sus animales los comercializa todos los jueves y domigos que es día de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, donde se reunen criadores, compradores de todo el distrito y sus caserios, aqui cliente oferta sus productos y animales. Él solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes, gallinas y otros animales menores, y asi tener una mayor cantidad y variedad de animales que ofrecer a sus clientes, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos, mejroes gaancias y por ende podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, 58, lives with his spouse and son in his own home made of modest materials in a small community of 50 families.  Daniel is respectful of his community and the environment.  He gets along well with the members of his community.  He's a native of the village of El Frayle in Santo Tomás District, in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Daniel's work is raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, ducks, hens, turkeys), which he raises in a pen located behind his house.  He has done this work for 35 years, and for 25 years he has farmed three hectares of corn.  He has a lot of experience in this line of work.  He sells his crops and animals on Thursday and Sunday, which is market day in the Santo Tomás de Cutervo district, where breeders and buyers from the whole district and its communities get together.

He's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and other small animals.  That way he'll have a greater number and variety of animals to sell to his customers.  As a result, he'll earn more income and better profits, and ultimately be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and other small animals

loans.name: Manos Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
Manos Laboriosas es un grupo muy unido, que a través del esfuerzo que cada hacen están logrando mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una. Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy, Directora General del Comité, quien se dedica al comercio, es decir a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Su esposo también trabaja y aporta al día a día de la casa.
La Sra. Nancy solicita este crédito para la compra de más productos para la venta, como ser aceites, jabones, suavizantes y demás. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manos Laboriosas" [laborious hands] is a very tight group who are managing to improve each member's life conditions.
This group is doing the survey to eliminate poverty, that will allow them to know at which state each one is, and according to the results, be able to improve their quality of life.
One of the members of the group is Nancy. She is the general director of the group and works selling basic needs products. Thanks to this activity, she can maintain her home and increase her income. Her husband also works and contributes to the daily household expenses.
Nancy is asking for a loan to purchase more products to sell, such as oils, soaps, softeners, etc. All the members of the group are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase oils, soaps, softeners, etc.

loans.name: Sandy Yuri

texts.es:
Sandy es una joven soltera, de 23 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad y actualmente está trabajando en un Estudio Contable, le va muy bien porque tiene un buen desempeño y sobre todo porque siempre aplica todos los valores con los cuales fue educada desde niña.
Sandy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado realizará algunos trámites, la regularización de sus documentos personales para que de esta manera no tenga inconvenientes en su trabajo. Gracias a esto ella seguirá laborando como lo viene haciendo y así más adelante espera poder abrir su propio estudio contable.
texts.en:
Sandy is an unmarried youth, 23 years old, and lives in Ica with her family.

Thanks to her parent’s support she studied for an accounting career and is currently working at an accounting firm. It is going very well for her because she performs well and above all because she always applies the values with which she was educated since childhood.

Sandy is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided she will submit some paperwork, the normalizing of her personal documents, so as to not have any problems at work. Thanks to this she will continue working as she has been and later on hopes to be able to open her own accounting firm.

loans.use: to process some personal documents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extend his cocoa plantation

loans.name: Elder Alonso

texts.es:
Elder Alonso tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz). Vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires a 20 minutos de Morropon. Natural de la zona, dicha comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y al comercio de platano; la misma que está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla el Elder Alonso es la siembra y comercialización de platano, su esposa es docente de un colegio en el sector el Bigote. Él solicita el crédito para la construccion del techo de su casa, y asi dar una mayor seguridad a su familia, mejorando de esta manera su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elder Alonso is a 33-year old man who lives with his partner. He has his own house and counts on public services, such as water and electricity. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires, 20 minutes away from Morropón. He was born in the area, where people work in cattle breeding, trading and banana sales. He is located in the province of Morropón, region of Piura, north coast of Perú. 

Elder Alonso sows and sells bananas. His wife is a teacher at a school in Bigote. He is requesting the loan to build the ceiling of his house and provide his family with more safety and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build the ceiling of his house.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en: Thamer is a 22 year-old, single young man living in Irbid-Jordan with his mother and three siblings. After his father was deceased, his family has faced financial crisis which pushed him to look for a job to help them. He worked as a cashier at a supermarket, and then he started working as a kindergarten bus driver. Thamer is also a university student majoring in Business Administration, and he is in his fourth year. He is seeking to find a job with a better income after he gets his Bachelors degree so that he will improve his living conditions. Now he is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felecien is 37 years old. He is married with five children aged between 18 and 3 years old, all of whom go to school. 

He has a shop and has been selling for the past 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cooking oil, sugar, pens, books, and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, pens, books, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 20 years old. He lives in Irbid-Jordan with his family. His father is a retired man who currently works at a construction materials shop. Eyad is a university student majoring in Medicine, and he is in his third year. He also works as a salesman. He is seeking to get his Bachelors' so that he will find a better job in his field. But his family is currently facing financial crisis which is not allowing him to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees.  For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz, age 38, is a married woman. She has a business selling embroidered cloth in her locality. Her husband is a labourer and earns a low-salary income  to bear their household expenses alone. Imtiaz has seven children. She is working hard to fulfill their basic necessities.

Imtiaz has 10 years of experience, and by this time she has retained a good number of customers. She always has a great selection to offer to her customers. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a variety of cloth for the new season. It’s her 4th loan cycle, and she has shown good repayment performance. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloth for the new season.

loans.name: Jervin Juan

texts.es:
Jervin tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y es padre de una niña de tres años, su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos, y nadie más depende de Jervin.

Jervin se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años, desde que estaba pequeño su padre lo llevaba a los terrenos donde cultivaba y poco a poco despertó su interés por esas actividades, anteriormente trabajaba como auxiliar de albañil pero a veces salía lejos a trabajar y les tocaba viajar todos los días a  su casa por eso ya no siguió en ese empleo. El lugar donde trabaja de jornalero  le queda a unos 10 minutos de su casa y se transporta a pie.


Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, comprará abono, herbicidas y pagará mano de obra, además pagará el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva.


Su sueño es encontrar un trabajo estable que le genere ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Jervin is 32 years old and studied until high school. He has a partner, and he is the father of a three-year-old girl. His partner works as a homemaker, and Jervin has no other dependants.

Jervin has worked growing bulk grains such as maize and beans for ten years. Since he was young, his father took him out to the fields where they grew crops, and bit by bit he developed an affinity for this work. He previously worked as a mason's assistant. However, he sometimes had to travel a long distance to work and he had to travel every day from home, which is why he didn't continue in that line of work. The place where he works as a day labourer is only ten minutes from his home and he gets there on foot.

Jervin is requesting this loan from CrediCampo in order to purchase agricultural inputs for his crops. He will buy fertilizer and herbicides and pay labourers. He will also pay the rent on the land that he cultivates.

His dream is to find a stable job that will generate enough income to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his crops.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga vive en concubinato y tiene 1 hijo, ella vive en la casa de los padres de su pareja que esta ubicada en Palomar, la casa es de ladrillo y cemento Olga se gana la vida como agricultora y necesita un credito para comprar semillas que le permitan cultivar maiz Olga es colaborada por su pareja en el negocio de la agricultura, la clienta tiene buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Olga lives in a common-law marriage and has one child. She lives in her husband's parents house, which is located in Palomar. The house is made of bricks and cement. 

Olga earns her living as a farmer and needs a loan to buy seeds that will enable her to grow corn. Olga's husband collaborates with her in their agricultural business. She is in good health and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy seeds that will enable her to grow corn

loans.name: José Isidro

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa es comerciante, es padre de dos hijas que están estudiando bachillerato.

José es vigilante en una empresa de desarrollo de las comunidades por medio de proyectos agrícolas y pecuarios, trabaja ahí desde hace 4 años, obtuvo este empleo por un amigo que le informó, José aplicó y luego lo capacitaron para ingresar a trabajar en dicha institución, además él cultiva granos básicos que le sirve como alimento para el hogar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar un tratamiento médico para su esposa porque en los últimos días ha estado muy mal de salud por una enfermedad, el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que su esposa podrá sanarse.

Su sueño es que su esposa se recupere, por otra parte quiere ampliar más su siembra para que la gente no tenga que viajar hasta los centros comerciales a buscar granos básicos, y además sueña con que sus hijos saquen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and studied until the ninth grade. He is married and his wife works as a merchant. He is the father or two daughters who are in their last years of high school.

José is a supervisor at a community development agency that specializes in agricultural and livestock projects. He has worked there for four years. José got the job after a friend let him know about it and he put in an application. He received training to work at the institution. He also grows bulk grains which help him to feed his household.

He needs this loan in order to pay for medical treatments for his wife, who has been in very poor health lately due to an illness. The loan will be of much help because his spouse will be able to get better.

José's dream is for his wife to recover. Apart from that, he wants to increase his planting so that people don't have to travel all the way to large shopping centres to find bulk grains. He also dreams of his children getting professional careers.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatments for his wife who has been very ill.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hello lenders,
Meet Judith. She is a 30 year-old smallholder farmer based in Nyamarambe division in Lake Victoria region of Kenya. She has been a farmer for only two years. For the short period of time she has been a farmer, she has come to develop a strong liking for milking.  It is the most enjoyable activity, from her perspective. Besides farming, Judith is also an entrepreneur engaged in other personal businesses. 
Judith is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This additional dairy cow will expand her asset base and increase the volume of milk she sells at the market. The cow will also help cushion shortages in case of diseases or when one cow is about to deliver. 
The extra money she will make from the loan will be dedicated to meeting business-related expenses. She believes that if she gives her business all the attention it requires, other aspects of her life will improve too. She has set her mind to improve her economic activity so that her family can enjoy a raised standard of living as a result of thriving business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Fifteen years ago Anne started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kapkoloi, a remote village in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Anne believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production.  She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Anne waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Zoila Etelvina

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 46 años de edad vive en el cantón Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar comunidad Camaron su estado civil es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 y 24 años. 
Se dedica al comercio de productos de la costa a la sierra como vegetales y frutas y utilizara el dinero del crédito para incrementar el negocio, las compras realiza en la ciudad de salinas y ambato. su sueño es tener un mejor estilo de vida para la familia, ella enfrentara los desafíos que se le presenten en la vida en su tiempo libre se dedica a la familia.
texts.en:
Zoila, 46 years old, lives in the community of Camaron,  canton Echenandia, in the Province of Bolivar.  She is in a civil marriage and lives with her husband and two children, 13 and 24 years old.

Zoila works at selling products like fruits and vegetables from the coast to the mountains.  She will use the loan money to increase her business, making her purchases in the cities of Salinas and Ambato.  Her dream is to have a better way of life for her family.  She will confront all the obstacles that present themselves to her in life.  Zoila spends her free time with her family.  
.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van and to buy new tires.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 47-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one child. 

Richard is involved in auto-spraying. He has a place where his customers are able to locate him and he enjoy working because he is able to satisfy his customers. As the income is not enough to take care of his family, he decided to seek additional income and requested a loan. The loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and ID-Ghana, enables him to get a loan so that he can continues this business. 

With the received credit, Richard will purchase paint which he will use to serve his customers. This will enable him to get additional income and improve the living conditions of his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase paint which he will use to serve his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy costumes for his clown character

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 21-year-old married lady living in Hashmiya, Jordan with her husband, who is a cars trader. 

She is a university student who is seeking to get her bachelor's degree so that she will find a job in her study field. This will let her start helping her husband in improving their living conditions. She is majoring in medical lab, and she is in her third year. 

Now Haneen is requesting a loan that will help her pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos y solo ellos con su pareja dependen de él.

Juan se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce y francés, realiza esta actividad desde hace  16 años, el trabajo lo aprendió cuando laboraba en una panadería, decidió dedicarse a esto debido que no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia, anteriormente era agricultor. El lugar donde elabora pan está a 5 cuadras de su casa y trabaja en un horario de 6 horas diarias.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para la elaboración del pan como harina, levadura azúcar, miel, entre otros.

Su sueño es tener un lugar propio para su negocio pues ahora está alquilando, para su familia sueña con que sus hijos estudien logren y  salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old, studied up to grade 6 and is married. His partner takes care of the household chores. He has 3 children and they and his partner depend on him.

Juan earns a living making French and sweet bread. He has done this work for 16 years, a job he learned while working at a bakery. He decided to dedicate himself to this since he could not find another way to help his family. He was previously a farmer. The place where he bakes bread is five blocks from his house and he works a schedule of 6 hours daily.

He needs the loan to buy ingredients to bake bread such as flour, yeast, sugar and honey, among others.

His dream is to have a space for his own business since he is renting now. His dream for his family is that his children study, achieve and succeed.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread such as flour, yeast, sugar and honey, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as soles, glue, thread, needles, sandpaper, leather and a sharpening stone.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 34-year-old man. He has been married for nine years. He has two chidlren. The eldest child is a 7-year-old boy who will go to the second class of school in September. The other child is 4 years old. Zaur and his wife are IDP's (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli City and now live in the Dilagarda village of the Fuzili region. 

Zaur is in the animal breeding business and his wife helps him with this business. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them at the local bazaar to earn money. 

He wants to repair a destroyed stall and needs a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN. 

Zaur expresses great thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for this help.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of a destroyed stall

loans.name: Marie Leine

texts.en:
Marie Leine is 28 years old. She is married with two children between the ages of 7 and 6 years old. Both children go to school. 

She sells food stuffs and has been selling for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, potatoes, and cassava for sale. 

The profit from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, potatoes, and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de golosinas.
Ella es emprendedora, responsable, independiente, solidaria, y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ que según el Instituto Nacional de Estadística el 72.9% de la población urbana vive en situación de pobreza, que representa la existencia de 58.822 familias sin acceso adecuado a servicios e insumos básicos, educación, salud y/o vivienda y de ella un 12% en indigencia, la pobreza de la población se expresa por medio de los insuficientes ingresos, riesgos de desnutrición infantil, bajo rendimiento escolar, abandono temprano de la escuela, enfermedades no atendidas, trabajo infantil, etc.
Victoria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello largo negro trenzado, viste de forma típica, su lengua materna es el aymara y aprendió el español al llegar a la ciudad por motivos de comercio. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos en un puesto de venta en la calle, soportando temperaturas frías características de su ciudad.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mercadería para una segunda actividad e incrementar su capital de trabajo para generar mejores ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas por mayor y con los beneficios realizar una segunda actividad económica.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her business is selling snack foods.

Victoria is enterprising, responsible, independent, supportive, and very hardworking. She runs her business in the "16 de Julio" area, where according to the Instituto Nacional de Estadística [National Statistics Institute], 72.9% of the urban population lives in poverty. That represents the existence of 58,822 families without adequate access to services and basic supplies, education, healthcare, and/or shelter. Of those, 12% are indigent. The poverty of the population is manifested through insufficient income, risks of infant malnutrition, low academic performance, early withdrawal from school, untreated illnesses, child labor, etc.

Victoria is dark-complected and of medium stature. She has long, black, braided hair and dresses in the traditional way. Her native language is Aymara and she learned Spanish after arriving in the city for its commerce. Her business is the sale of snacks and soft drinks from a stand on the street, enduring the cold temperatures that characterize her city.

Victoria would like to expand her business by making a purchase of merchandise for a second business, and to increase her working capital in order to generate greater income and improve her quality of life. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of snacks at wholesale. With the profits, she will start a second economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase snacks at wholesale and to start a second economic activity with the profits.

loans.name: Nyamagembe Daraja Group

texts.en:
Erasto is a father of five children, three sons and two daughters, who are grown. He is married and has been a businessman managing a general store selling dry food, drinks, and home items. He has been in this enterprise for three years now. Since then, Erasto has been able to realize a fair monthly profit. He works at his shop from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 pm daily.

This is his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy shop inventories. He dreams that one day he will be able to build a big business premise. 

Erasto will share this loan with his loan group, Nyamagembe, which has seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventories.

loans.name: J D Arc

texts.en:
J D Arc is 45 years old. She is married with six children aged between 17 years and 4 months. Five children go to school. 

She has been producing local drinks and has sold them for the past 18 years. With the loan, she would like to buy sorghum in order to produce more local drinks for sale. 

The profit from the business will be used for the welfare of her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy sorghum in order to produce more local drinks for sale.

loans.name: Los G Group

texts.es:
“Los G”  es un grupo conformado por 3 mujeres y un hombre. El nombre del grupo surgió porque un apellido de los integrantes comienza con dicha letra. Además, los miembros tienen en común la ubicación de su negocio: todos en la calle principal. Las ganas de trabajar y el deseo de superarse es lo que llevó a estas personas dedicadas a emprender una actividad económica productiva.

La localidad que habitan es cañera, algunas comunidades cercanas son productoras de algún cultivo alternativo, pero la mayoría de los habitantes trabajan en el campo. También se pueden encontrar otros negocios como tiendas de abarrotes, tortillerías, tiendas de ropa, panaderías, por mencionar algunos. Lo cierto es que todos los habitantes trabajan a diario para llevar el pan a casa.

Carolina es madre soltera de un pequeño de 6 años de edad llamado Sergio, su hijo es su principal motor, es quien le da la energía necesaria para levantarse día a día y enfrentarse a la vida con una sonrisa en los labios. Carolina se ha dedicado desde hace ya 8 años al servicio de estilista, al principio trabajaba como empleada para otra persona, por lo cual dependía de un sueldo, pero ahora con su negocio ella es su propio jefe y sabe cómo administrar su tiempo de mejor manera. “Estoy contenta con el gran regalo que Dios me dio (mi hijo) y por permitirme establecer mi local desde hace ya 6 años”. Con el préstamo otorgado comprará: tintes, peróxido, peines, pasadores, tubos, capas, tijeras, espejo, navajas para rasurar, talco, brochas y algunos otros materiales.

La atención al cliente y los servicios son la parte medular de cualquier actividad económica, debido a que  los mismos clientes recomiendan los lugares, cabe mencionar que si se satisface la necesidad del cliente este siempre regresará. Por esta razón, Carolina siempre se esfuerza por dar lo mejor a sus clientes. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Brigida - Venta De Abarrotes
Cesar - Servicio De Internet
Daniela - Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo.

"Gracias a VisionFund México por brindarnos su confianza y la oportunidad de entregarnos un préstamo". Son las palabras de los integrantes. 

*En la imagen: Carolina viste una blusa de tirantes color café.
texts.en:
“Los G” is a group made up of 3 women and one man. The name of the group came about because the last name of one of the members begins with that letter. All of the members have in common the location of their businesses—they are all on the main street. The desire to work and get ahead is what brought these dedicated people to start businesses.

The place where they live produces sugar cane. Some nearby communities produce alternative crops, but the majority of the people there work in the fields. Other types of businesses can also be found, such as grocery stores, tortilla stores, clothing stores, and bakeries, to name a few. Everyone there works daily to sustain their household.

Carolina is the single mother of a 6 year old boy named Sergio. Her son is her foremost motivation in life. It is he who gives her the necessary energy to get up each day and face life with a smile on her face. Carolina has been working as a stylist for 8 years. At first she worked as an employee for another person, and relied on a salary. But now, with her own business, she is her own boss and she knows how to manage her time better. “I am happy with the wonderful gift God gave me (my son) and for allowing me to establish my store 6 years ago.” With the loan she was granted, she will buy: hair dyes, hydrogen peroxide, combs, hair clips, rollers, capes, scissors, mirrors, shaving blades, talc, brushes, and some other materials.

Paying attention to the customer and customer service are fundamental for any business, since customers recommend places. It’s worth mentioning that if the client’s needs are met, they will always come back. For this reason, Carolina always works hard to give the best to her customers. 

The other members are:
Brigida – Grocery sales
Cesar – Internet service
Daniela – Catalog shoe sales

“Thank you to VisionFund México for trusting in us and providing us with the opportunity of a loan.” These are the words of the members.

* In the photo: Carolina is wearing a brown tank top.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, hydrogen peroxide, combs, hair clips, tubes, capes, scissors, mirrors, shaving blades, talc, brushes, and some other materials.

loans.name: Josselyn Lisbeth

texts.es: Josselyn, se le presenta la necesidad de solicitar un  nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la tienda, comprara aceite, huevos, granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, etc., de esta manera seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes. Con el capital que anteriormente se le otorgo logro mejorar el inventario de la tienda obteniendo mayores ventas, mejores ingresos, ha cancelado sus deudas y ofrece a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Josselyn needs another loan to invest in her shop to buy items such as oil, eggs, basic grains, carbonated soft drinks and juice, and in this way to continue to meet her clients' needs. With the capital she borrowed last time, she managed to improve the range of goods in her shop, thus increasing sales and improving her income. She has paid back her loan and she provides her family with a better style of living.

loans.use: to buy items such as oil, eggs, basic grains, carbonated soft drinks and juice, and in this way to continue to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos, reside en el municipio de San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara. Tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios. Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años en su casa. Ofrece maíz, frijoles, arroz, harina, aceite de cocina, productos lácteos, refrescos, carnes de pollo y res. Antes se dedicaba a la elaboración de pasteles y luego decidió por su negocio de pulpería. Esta solicitando el sexto ciclo de préstamo que es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos, refrescos y otros abarrotes, para surtir su negocio. su objetivo es mantener el negocio surtido para obtener mas ingresos y darle una mejor vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 38 years old, she lives in a common law partnership with her partner. She has two children and lives in the town of San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara. She has her own business, a grocery store where she sells food products. 

She has run this business from her house for five years. She offers corn, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil, dairy products, soft drinks, chicken and beef. Before this she earned a living making cakes before deciding to start her grocery business. 

Yesenia is asking for her sixth loan of 20,000 lempiras, with which she will buy staple grains, meats, dairy products, soft drinks and other groceries to stock her business.

Her aim is to keep the business stocked to obtain a greater income and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to stock her business with products like staple grains, meats, dairy products, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que no pudo continuar por su situación económica, está casado y su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, aún no tiene hijos y vive  junto a sus padres y hermanos.


José se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, en esta actividad lleva alrededor de 2 años, el aprendió el negocio porque su madre lo hacía antes, y cuando salió de estudiar bachillerato no pudo seguir en la universidad y decidió trabajar en el comercio de cerdos, el lugar donde sale a comprar los animales varía porque a veces se agotan cerca de donde él vive y por lo tanto debe caminar más lejos para negociar los cerdos.


Este crédito le servirá a José para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, el crédito le permitirá tener más capital para invertir y que su negocio crezca para ayudar económicamente a su familia.

Sus sueños son hacer su propia vivienda para tener más comodidad y privacidad con su familia, también sueña con ser un comerciante potencial con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias y salir adelante con todos sus proyectos.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old and has a high school education but could not continue due to his financial situation. He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They don't have any children yet and they live with his parents and siblings. 

Jose buys and sells pigs which he has been doing for about two years. He learned this business because his mother used to do it, and when he finished high school and was unable to continue to university, he decided to work at raising pigs too. The place where he buys the pigs can vary because sometimes they are sold out near where he lives, so then he must walk farther to negotiate the purchase. This loan will be used by Jose to buy pigs to fatten and then sell them, and will allow him to have more capital to invest so that his business can grow.  This will benefit his family financially. 

His dreams are to have his own house so his family can have more privacy and comfort. He also dreams of becoming a potential trader with the goal of increasing his earnings and to get ahead with all of his projects.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then sell them

loans.name: Sindi Marina

texts.es: Sindi de 41 años de edad habita junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad, en vivienda propia desde hace 41 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante junto a su familia gracias a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, además su esposo aporta a la economía familiar gracias a pequeño negocio de venta de medicamentos. Sindi desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sindi, 41, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 1 and 4, in their own home.  She is an enterprising woman who works every day so her family can get ahead.  She sells basic products from home and her husband contributes to the household economy thanks to his small business of medicine sales.

Sindi wants to change the roof over the porch of their house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams and nails to carry out the project.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams and nails to change the roof over her porch.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Jackline, who is in her late 30’s, is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling soft drinks since 2008.  She works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Jackline's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling at wholesale prices.  She also sold at retail prices, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profits to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy drinks to sell at retail and wholesale prices. She dreams of buying more and more drinks, especially take a way.

Jackline will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano," which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell at retail and wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ingrid Sarai

texts.es:
La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Ingrid de 45 años de edad casada, a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a vender medicina y poner sueros a los enfermos, ella tiene seis hijos 3 de ellos ya están casados y los tres son estudiantes destacados en una escuela de su comunidad donde viven.  
La actividad que ella realiza con todo empeño es la venta de medicina en la comunidad donde ella vive,	además de que la gente lo busca para sus medicinas, existen otras personas que lo buscan para que les haga alguna costura ya que también Ingrid es costurera y es agricultora en su bella comunidad  ella es un claro ejemplo de que si uno se propone realizar varias actividades en la vida una lo puede lograr.
Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para ampliar su negocio de venta de medicina que es su servicio para las personas.  Además que le gustaría seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que ellos se convierten en profesionales en el futuro y seguir sirviendo a su comunidad para que cada uno tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
The necessity to get ahead in life is what motivated Ingrid to learn several different trades. She is married and has six children, three of whom are married, and the other three are outstanding students at the local school. She is 45 years old and over the years she has worked at selling medicines and administering serums to the sick. 

The work that she dedicates herself to wholeheartedly is the sale of medicines in the community where she lives.  Besides the people who look to buy medicines from her, there are others who seek her out to sew clothes because she is a seamstress.  She is also a farmer in her beautiful community. She is a clear example that if someone wants to do a variety of things in life, it is possible to do so. 

Ingrid finds it necessary to apply for a loan to expand her business of medicine sales, which is a service she provides. She hopes to be able to continue to support her children so that they can become professionals in the future, and to continue to serve her community so that everyone might have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 45 years old. She is married with five children aged between 12 and 2 years, four of whom go to school. 

She sells food stuffs, and has been selling for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standards of her living.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mt Magoroto Group

texts.en:
James is aged in his late twenties and has got one daughter who is at school. He is not married and, since 2008, he has been managing a shop selling cosmetics. He works from 8 AM to 10 PM daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is James's first loan which he will use to replenish his shop with cosmetics. He will share this loan with his loan group, Mt Magoroto, a five-member group.The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

James dreams to build a better family house.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with cosmetics.

loans.name: Mbokomu Group

texts.en:
Salma is a mother of two kids, one small and another is at school. She is in her late 20’s and married. She has been a tailor for four years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Salma starts working at 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. daily.

This is her first credit from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy materials for making clothes. She dreams to build a house. Salma will share this loan with her loan group "MBOKOMU," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Muhokya Farmers Ass Group

texts.en:
Stella, a 62-year-old married mother of six, is a member of Muhokya Farmers Association living in Kasese, Uganda. In the tailoring business, she farms to earn additional income. Stella works hard to improve her family standard of living, but she is faced with the challenges of limited capital, debtors and competition. 

Stella intends to use the loan to buy materials for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding her enterprise and making more profits.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 40 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que sale todos los días a trabajar para apoyar económicamente a su madre. Douglas desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Douglas is 20 years old and lives in his own house with his 40-year-old mother and family. He is a hardworking young man who goes out every day to work so he can support his mother. 

Douglas wants to replace the roof of his house so he is asking FUSAI for a loan so he can buy galvanized roofing sheets and wood to do the job.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing sheets and wood to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Roset

texts.en:
Roset is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, living in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

She works hard to provide for her family so that they can attain a better life. She sells cassava flour and cocoa in the market to supplement her household income. She plans to rent a cassava garden although competition and weather  affect her business.

loans.use: to rent a cassava garden.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en: Yosam is age 44, and married with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of new clothes (textile shop) and has been in that business since 2009. He also has rentals and a transport business where he gets side income. He began the business to improve his standard of living. Yosam will use the loan facility to buy baby clothes to sell. Yosam is a hardworking man with a dream of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ansila

texts.en:
Ansila is 40 years old, and she is married with eight children, aged between 3 and 21.  Seven of them go to school. She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build a store for their production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana, who is 38 years old, is married with two children and living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He operates a mini-supermarket and has been in that business for six years. Yohana began the business to generate income for his family. He is a hardworking man with a dream of growing his business into a bigger supermarket. 

Yohana intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, cups, and plates to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, cups,  and plates to sell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Business administration, she is in her first year. She plans to enter the workforce after getting her Bachelors degree and to earn a good income to support her family. Her family is currently facing financial problems. 

She needs your help to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: José Salustino

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, estudió solo 2° grado, no continuó con sus estudios ya que sus padres no podían brindárselos, actualmente está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de antojitos en el centro de la ciudad, José procreó 4 hijos con su pareja anterior pero siempre es responsable en ayudarlos, y con la actual aún no tiene ninguno, 

Él se dedica a trabajar como barrendero en la ciudad, trabajo que con mucho orgullo ha desarrollado durante 9 años, el cual le ha servido de mucho para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, además se dedica a la agricultura esto lo hace por la tarde y los fines de semana. Para llegar al lugar donde trabaja de barrendero se va en bicicleta y tarda 10 minutos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para los antojitos que elabora su esposa como yuca, plátano, etc. 

Su sueño más grande es poder terminar la construcción de su casa ya que quiere hacerle dos cuartos mas, espera lograrlos con las ganancias adquiridas en los negocios.
texts.en:
José is 48 and has only studied up to 2nd grade. He wasn't able to continue with his schooling because his parents couldn't afford it. He is now in a long-term relationship, and his wife works selling "antojitos" (traditional snacks) in the centre of the city. José had 4 children with his previous partner, but always supports them responsibly, and he doesn't have any children as yet with his current partner.

He works as a sweeper in the city, a job he has carried out with great pride for 9 years. It takes him 10 minutes to cycle to his work. This job has really helped him to support his children with their schooling. He also works in agriculture, which he does during the afternoons and at weekends.

José needs a loan to buy ingredients such as cassava and plantain for the snacks his wife makes. His greatest dream is to be able to finish building his house, as he wants to create two more rooms. He hopes to achieve this with the profits earned through the businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cassava and plantains for the traditional snacks his wife makes.

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemia is a 27-year-old married man with one child.  They live in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

He works hard to sustain his family  and has a motor cycle (boda boda) transportation business. He also grows cocoa. Seasonal weather conditions and bad roads are the key challenges to his work. He has a vision to buy many motorcycles to start a transportation business. 

Nehemia will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 47, is a farmer from Gathihu which is located in Central Kenya. He has a wife and a 10 year-old son. 

John keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows tea and other crops. His primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, and tea. He also started a transportation service to move goods and passengers over short distances.

John is seeking a loan to begin pig farming. With your loan, he is going to purchase pig feed, set up pig pens and purchase farm tools. 
This move will help John to diversify the products he is offering to the market. This will not only increase his income but also help him to mitigate product-specific risks. 

With more income, he can afford labor costs, which has been his biggest challenge. He will also use the extra money to meet high costs.

loans.use: to pay for pig feed, repair a pig shed, and buy farm tools.

loans.name: Nyakasanga Women Group

texts.en:
Alfred, a 35-year-old male, is married with four children, three of whom attend school. He is a member of Nyakasanga Women Group. 

Alfred is a boda boda rider (motorcycle transport business) and works 10 hours a day, 6 days a week. He has been doing this since 1999. He also does farming as additional income. 

Alfred began the business to have a daily income to sustain his family, and buying more motorcycles is what Alfred dreams of. Alfred wants money to buy a motorcycle. He is hardworking, but competition and weather changes are challenges he encounters.

loans.use: to buy  a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement and iron to repair the dooor-frames of her house and to buy new doors, as they are currently made of wood.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in ceramic Inca replicas. He would like to invest in the purchase of equipment for his workshop including a kiln, a wheelbarrow, and a blender, as well as materials in bulk such as clays, paints, and brushes. Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "Our ancestors crafted beautiful and complex pieces with only their hands as tools, without the kind of technology we have nowadays. Through their work they expressed all that they saw and wondered about, their thoughts and beliefs. I feel that Peruvian ceramic art is a way to communicate with our ancestors and to keep them alive. Believe it or not, some archaeologists have been fooled by my work! That's because of the aging process I use with my pieces. "With this microcredit I would like to replace the equipment that's worn out with time, and I would also like to stock up on materials. Thank you so very much for being part of this microcredit - I am grateful for your appreciation of our art." Use the link below to view Walter's ceramic Inca replicas on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7284

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of equipment for his workshop, including a kiln, a wheelbarrow, and a blender, as well as materials in bulk such as clays, paints, and brushes

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es: José, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado, tiene 9 hijos, vive con su familia en un sector del municipio de Siguatepeque cerca de Taulabe. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de frijol, café y hortalizas. Actualmente su fuente de ingresos es la producción de café el que vende en pergamino en la misma zona. y sus cultivos los realiza es un terreno propio. Esta solicitando ya el tercer ciclo de préstamo en la institución y es por 5,300 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y siembra de café con el fin de mejorar sus cultivos y seguir trabajando. El piensa sembrar mas café y continuar con el cultivo de hortalizas.
texts.en:
José, 55, is married and has nine children.  He lives with his family in an area of the town of Siguatepeque, near Taulabe.

He has always worked in agriculture growing beans, coffee, and vegetables.  His current source of income is growing coffee, which he sells in parchment in the same area.  He grows his crops on his own plot of land.

José's requesting 5,300 lempiras [HNL] in the third loan cycle with the bank.  He's going to invest the loan in buying soil amendments and growing coffee so he can improve his crops and keep on working.

He plans to plant more coffee and continue to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and to grow coffee

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad tranquila donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo en la siembra, cuidado y cosecha de la caña de azúcar, limón y nanche se consolidó un grupo de préstamo llamado “Sol Naciente”. Se eligió el nombre pues para los integrantes es gracias al sol que nace día a día lo que logra darle vida a las cosechas.

Las integrantes del grupo son:
Maria –Venta De  Cosmeticos Por Catalogo 
Antonia - Servicio de Estilista
Norma -Venta De Zapatos Por Catalogo
Marcela - Venta De Limones 
Maria Nieves -Venta De Abarrotes
Dulce - Servicio De Estetica
Fidela -Servicio De Taxi
Jose Luis - Venta De Refrescos

Cada uno de los integrantes obtiene ganancias de su respectiva actividad, con ellas cubren algunos gastos y satisfacen sus necesidades. 

La señora Antonia tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 14 quien estudia en la telesecundaria. Doña Antonia se dedica desde hace más de 5 años al servicio de estilista. Comenta que antes no tenía un local establecido, “me siento dichosa con mi familia” ellos son el motor principal para que Antonia siga trabajando día a día.

Antonia comenta que fue su esposo quien la animó a acondicionar un local en casa pues de esta manera ya no tendría que invertir en el pago de la renta. Por supuesto, tampoco descuidaría a su familia al no tener que salir de casa. Ella pretende invertir el préstamo en tijeras, 1  máquina de rasurar, peines, tintes, tubos, huesos, spray, pasadores y peróxido para continuar con el servicio de estilista y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Platicar con doña Antonia es agradable, es interesante escucharla hablar de sus inicios como estilista después de acudir algunos cursos. Al principio practicaba con su hija a quien le hacía variedad de peinados y a su hijo, diferentes cortes de cabello. Afortunadamente, desempeña una actividad que le gusta mucho, obtiene ganancias y siempre puede seguir aprendiendo.

"VisionFund México nos brinda como grupo una gran oportunidad, es por eso que continuamos en los préstamos" con cada préstamo, los integrantes invierten y logran generar incrementos en sus ganancias.

*En la imagen: Antonia viste de blusa blanca y short amarillo.
texts.en:
In a quiet community where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture growing sugar, lemons, and  nanche (local fruit), the Sol Naciente communal bank can be found. The members chose this name because it is the sun that provides the harvest.

The members of the group are as follows:

Maria--sells cosmetics from a catalog
Antonia–beauty salon
Norma--sells shoes from a catalog
Marcela--sells lemons
Maria Nieves--sells groceries
Dulce--beauty salon
Fidela--taxi service
Jose Luis--sells soft drinks

Each person earns a living from these jobs, and the income pays for some expenses and covers the cost of necessities.

Sra. Antonia is 44 years old, married, and has a 14-year old daughter who studies distance education courses. For more than five years she has worked in a beauty salon. Before that she didn't have permanent premises. She notes, "I am blessed because of my family." They are the reason she works hard every day.

Antonia says it was her husband who encouraged her to set up a salon in the house so that she didn't have to pay rent. Nor does she have to neglect her family by leaving the home for work. She plans to use the loan money to buy scissors, an electric razor, combs, dyes, hairspray, barrettes, peroxide, and other supplies so that she can continue her work as a stylist and offer a better service to her clients.

Chatting with Antinia is pleasant. It is interesting to hear her talk about her early days as a stylist after taking various courses. She used to practice on her daughter and give her a range of different hairstyles, and on her son, giving him different haircuts. She is lucky in that she has a job which she really enjoys, provides an income, and always challenges her.

'VisionFund Mexico provides our group with a great opportunity, and that's why we continue as borrowers', she says. After investing in their businesses, the members are managing to generate more income.

Antonia can be seen in the photo wearing a white top and yellow shorts.

loans.use: Buy scissors, an electric razor, combs, and other hairdressing supplies

location.town: Las Maravillas,Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Emprendiendo Todos Group

texts.es:
Nemecia es una mujer de 40 años de edad, viuda, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la fabricación de muebles.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘El Abra’ caracterizada por sus calles amplias, empedradas y de ripio, ubicado en el lado oeste del municipio de Sacaba, en el sector donde se encuentra el recinto penitenciario homónimo. Las nuevas construcciones se levantan entre lo que antes fueron sembradíos, principalmente de maíz.
Nemecia es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, estatura mediana, su forma de vestir es típica y su lengua natal es el Quechua que combina con el español para el comercio. (a la izquierda con sueter blanco) La necesidad de realizar mejoras en su calidad de vida la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Su taller de carpintería realiza principalmente muebles de cocina como; mesas, sillas, estantes, etc. utilizando máquinas como la cortadora, taladradora, ingletadora, etc. y herramientas manuales como la sierra, las lijas, martillos, escuadras, etc. Tras realizar la preparación de piezas su hijos se encargan del montaje, mediante el encolado y posteriormente, realizan los ajustes necesarios para que no tengan imperfecciones, lijándolas y usando otras técnicas para mejorar dichas piezas o montajes.
Ella desea incrementar la producción de muebles realizando la compra de material de trabajo (madera) por mayor, para tener mayor stock y mejorar sus beneficios económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Nemecia solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera por mayor para su carpintería.
texts.en:
Nemecia is a 40-yer-old woman who is a widow and the mother of two children. Her business is furniture-making. She is enterprising, independent, strong, feisty, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the "El Abra" zone which is characterized by wide cobblestone and unpaved streets, located on the west side of the town of Sacaba, in the area where the prison compound of the same name is located. The new buildings have gone up among what were previously fields, mostly of corn.

Nemecia is dark complected, with long, dark, braided hair.  She is of medium height and dresses in typical clothing.  Her native tongue is Quechua which she mixes with Spanish when doing business. (on the left in a white sweater) 

The need to improve her quality of life inspired her to form a bank with people who have similar needs. Her carpentry shop produces mostly furniture for the kitchen such as tables, chairs, shelves, etc. using machines such as the saw, drill, miter, etc. and hand tools such as saws, sandpaper, hammers, squares, etc. Once the pieces are completed her children assemble them with glue and then fix any imperfections by sanding and using other techniques to improve the pieces. 

She wants to increase her production of furniture buy buying her work material (wood) at wholesale to increase her stock and improve her finances. This is why Nemecia is asking for a loan to buy wood at wholesale for her carpentry business.

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale for her carpentry business

loans.name: Elsy Damari

texts.es: Elsy, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque, cerca de Taulabe. Hace 9 años ella decidió cultivar plátanos y café. Anteriormente tenia una pulpería pero no era rentable. Ahora su fuente de ingresos es la producción y venta de café y plátanos. El café lo vende en pergamino en el mercado local. El préstamo es por 20,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y limpieza de la finca de café, con el fin de darle mejor mantenimiento a su finca. Su meta es seguir sembrando mas café para obtener mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Elsy, age 30, lives with her common-law husband and their two children.  They live in a village in the Siguatepeque municipality close to Taulabe.  She decided to grow bananas and coffee nine years ago.  She previously had a grocery store, but it was not profitable.

Producing and selling coffee and bananas is now her source of income.  She sells wet parchment coffee at the local market.

The loan for 20,000 lempiras is to buy fertilizers and to clear the coffee fields.  She will do this in order to provide better maintenance to her farm.  Her goal is to continue growing more coffee in order to get greater income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to clear the coffee fields.

loans.name: Abbey

texts.en: Abbey is a 50-year-old man, and is married with four children all attending school. He practices agriculture, growing crops such as maize, beans, and cotton for selling. He has been in that business for 10 years. He started the business to get a daily source of income to support his family. Abbey wants money to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, and to pay for labor. He is hardworking, however, weather changes and thieves are challenges.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ploy

texts.en:
Ploy is an artisan in Thailand who specializes in handcrafted jewelry and accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver in bulk for her designs. Ploy has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story: "Although silversmithing is my passion, I have not always been a silversmith. I have a medical condition, and I cannot sit for long periods of time, as is required in many workshops. I took up various jobs, including selling food and working as a housekeeper, but in the end silver called me back! Now, working for myself with great enthusiasm, I am able to set my own hours, so as not to tire to extremes. And this really makes me happy! "Thank you everyone for this microcredit, because it will help me purchase the silver I need to prepare for the upcoming holiday season." Use the link below to view Ploy's handcrafted sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2325

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver in bulk for her designs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Susan, a dedicated, determined and honest mother of four lovely children. She is based in Nandi hills, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions lending it the nickname of “tea region.” For the past 14 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops.  These ventures have allowed her earn a decent income. 

Susan passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said.  She mobilized other enterprising woman like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lender to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Susan will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 5, and 1 of them goes to school. Jacqueline has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for better rice production. The profit from the business will be used to buy a bicycle to carry her products.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for better rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and pay for labor to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, who is 50 years old, is a married male with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He operates a restaurant and has been in that business for thirty-three years. He began the business to get profits and earn a living. 

He also practices farming to get additional income. Despite weather challenges, Wilson is working hard to generate income for his family. He needs a loan to buy bananas and drinks to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and drinks to boost his business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 30 years old, and she is married with 1 child, age 5, who goes to school. She has been farming for 5 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to buy seeds of rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for better rice production.

loans.name: Roben

texts.en: Roben, 34 years old, is a married male with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a video hall, a business he has operated since 2013.
