He also does farming and timber business to get additional income. He began the businesses to increase his family income. He is a hardworking man with a dream of expanding his business to other areas. Roben wants money to buy a projector, speaker and amplifier.

loans.use: to buy a projector, speaker and amplifier.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es: María de 61 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella es una mujer tenaz que lucha cada día por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, frijol y maíz. Dicha venta la realiza en su vivienda desde hace 6 años por lo que es reconocida por ser una mujer honesta y cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. María desea construir un  baño con pila en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo posee un barril para recoger agua como se observa en la fotografía. Por lo anterior María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un baño con pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old. She lives in her own home together with her husband and son. She is a determined woman who struggles daily to improve life conditions for herself and her family. 

She earns a living selling basic grains such as rice, beans and corn.  She has been doing all sales from her home for six years now and is known for her honesty, with more clients asking every day for her products. 

Maria would like to build a washroom with a sink in her home since she currently has only a barrel to collect water,  as shown in the photo above, therefore Maria is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a washroom with a sink in her home.

loans.name: Mwanachi Group

texts.en:
Husna, the mother of two kids, is in her thirties. She has been a food cook for six years, cooking chapati early in the morning. It's a type of food normally taken with tea, soup or cooked beans. She has been taking care of her family with this business. She starts working from 6 am to midday and is able to realize a good return each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy cooking oil, baking flour and a big pot to put chapati in so that they can be hot all time. She dreams of becoming the mother of a good house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwanachi" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking flour and a big pot to put chapati in so that they can be hot all the time.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa as his main business. He is very hardworking and tries as much as possible to sustain his family. He faces a challenge of high competition and inadequate capital. He hopes to gain more sales, and he is making sure his children complete school. Steven intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is a married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has children and is very hardworking so as to look after these children. Her major business is buying and selling cocoa, and she hopes to develop her family through this business. Despite the cocoa business being seasonal, Penina has vowed to see her children reach the university level of education. She wants the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yenny Azucena

texts.es:
Yenny, continua progresando con los ingresos que genera con la venta de ropa y jugos naturales, con ayuda del préstamo anterior tuvo a su disposición la materia prima para mantener su negocio funcionando, como beneficio tiene nuevos clientes, mejores ventas y ganancias, su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual.
Nuevamente se decidió a solicitar más capital con el que comprara blusas, pantalones, chores, camisetas y otras prendas de vestir para renovar su inventario, tendrá oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio y espera seguir mejorando si situación económica.
texts.en:
Yenny, continues to progress with the income that is generated with the sale of clothing and natural juices. With the help of the last loan she obtained the raw materials she needed to keep her business functioning and as a benefit she got new clients, better sales and profits. Her family is the same.

Once again she has decided to request more capital with which she will buy blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts and other items of clothing to renovate her inventory. She will have the opportunity to continue to expand her business and hopes to continue to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy blouses.pants, shorts, t-shirts and other clothing to renew her inventory.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en: Joram is a 22-year-old, man married with one child, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells fish to earn a living. He is a very good client and he is hardworking. He faces a challenge of competition in the market, but nevertheless he tries to make his business survive. He hopes to build a good house and he wants the loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Guljemal

texts.ru: Гулжемал 51 год. Она фермер из района Джиликуль. Гулжемал имеет 0,50 га орошаемого участка земли,на которых она выращивает кукурузу, помидор, арбуз, дыню, тыкву и т.д.  Гулжемал теперь хочет параллельно начать еще один бизнес, да бы улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она выбрала для этого сферу животноводства. Гулжемал планирует выращивать крупнорогатый скот. Она при дворе дома имеет коровник, а также начальный капитал в размере 270 долларов США. Гулжемал за счет суммы кредит и своего сбережения хочет приобрести двух голов крупнорогатого скота и корм для скота. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку в начинании своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Guljemal is 51. She is a farmer from the Jilikul region and has 0.5 hectares of irrigated land where she plants corn, tomatoes, watermelon, melons, pumpkins, and so forth. Guljemal wants to start another parallel business to improve her family’s living conditions. She has chosen to go into animal husbandry and plans to raise cattle. She has a barn in her yard and $270 USD of startup capital. Guljemal wants to buy two head of cattle and feed with the loan and her savings. She hopes for financial support in starting her new business.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle and feed

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 39-year-old female, married, with five children living in Kasese,Uganda. Joice operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for seventeen years. She also owns a salt pan business where she gets additional income. Joice is a hard working woman who fights hard to see continuity in her business and stable incomes in her family despite being challenged by competition. Joice is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a thirty-nine-year-old man, married with eight children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa as his main business to ensure that he can look after his family very well. He is very hard working and he hopes to build a permanent house and increase his source of income. He faces a hardship of high competition in the market. He wants the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Yorm's Group

texts.en: Yorm’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yorm makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as garment laborer at factory to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en: Vun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work trading groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a very hard working man. He is 19 years old and single. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is a motorcycle cyclist and it is his main business. Poor roads are his major challenge but he continues to work hard to earn a living. He wishes to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 36-year-old man who is married with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Wilson used his previous loan to buy iron sheets, cement, bricks and nails to finish his house. He is a boda boda rider where he gets additional income. Wilson began farming to have a better standard of living. He is a hardworking man despite his challenge of low capital.

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor. He will use his loan to improve his productivity and have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Khet's Group

texts.en: Khet’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khet makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.en:
Iris is a 41 year old woman who lives in the Department of Atlantida. She is a loving Mother of four children, one of her children attend elementary school in the village. 
To earn a living, she and her husband manage and operate farmland of maize, beans and coffee  that are located near their home. Until now, they have been involved in this race for almost their entire life. With great effort and hard work, this couple is able to make 13 USD in a day. 
Iris is requesting a loan to buy of SOLUZ a solar electric system for herr home, she wants to have the home energy to a low monthly cost. She has requested a kiva loan through its partner, SOLUZ Honduras. After this initial investment, hopes to have the clean energy to boost its domestic lights, and save the cost of kerosene, batteries, candles and the cost of recharging your cell phone.  
This savings in these traditional energy expenditure will allow Iris recover the investment in the solar electric system. The solar panel has a warranty of 25 years. Soluz Honduras installs, ensures and maintains the system to ensure that your investment provides benefits for many years. An overall environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of emissions of carbon dioxide (0.25 tons of CO2 per annum) than it is for the elimination of the consumption of kerosene.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system energy for her home

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали водитель из города Куляб. Ему 47 лет. Он работает водителем в торговой фирме по трехчасовой смене, затем весь день предоставляет услуги такси. Урозали занимается перевозкой пассажиров уже 5 лет. За день он делает 10 рейсов. Урозали семейный человек. Его жена работает учительницей в школе. Старшей дочери 19 лет и она студентка второго курса. Средней дочери 13 лет и она еще учится в школе. А младшей дочери 6 лет, она пойдет в школу в следующем году. Единственному сыну Урозали 18 лет. Летом этого года он сдал свои документы в Таджикский Технический Университет на договорное отделение и успешно сдал экзамены. Скоро начнутся занятия и он должен оплатить за годовой контракт до начала занятий, иначе его не допустят к занятиям. У Урозали к сожалению нет сбережений, поэтому единственный выход он видит в получении кредита. Урозали благодаря кредиту сможет оплатить годовой контракт сына, а также купить ему учебные принадлежности. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Urozali is a driver from the town of Kulob. He is 47 years old. He works a three-hour shift as a driver at a retail company and then provides taxi services all day. Urozali has been involved in transporting passengers for 5 years already. He completes 10 trips per day. Urozali is a family man. His wife works as a school teacher. The oldest daughter is 19 years old, and she is a second-year student. The middle daughter is 13 years old and still attends school. And the youngest daughter is 6 years old, and she will start school next year. Urozali's only son is 18 years old. He submitted his application to the Tajikistan Technical University's contract division this summer and successfully passed the exams. The school year will be starting soon, and he has to pay for the annual tuition prior to the school start, otherwise he would not be allowed to start his studies. Urozali, unfortunately, does not have enough savings, and he sees obtaining a loan as the only solution. Urozali, thanks to the loan, would be able to pay for his son's tuition and also buy school supplies. He hopes for the support very much.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is 38 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 19 and 13. 

Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

In the future, Nura plans to raise the economic condition of her family. 
She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her business.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom an adult man who is married and has children. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He works buying and selling cocoa and he works very hard. Tom’s business challenge is seasonality but he still goes ahead to strive to earn a living. 

Tom is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa to sell. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 35 years old. She is married and has two children aged between 4 and 8, both of whom go to school. 
She has been farming for six years and will use this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from her farming business will be used to pay for the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Mayeali

texts.en:
This is 28 year old Mayeali. She is married and has three children, ages one, two and 10. All of her children go to school. In 2004, Mayeali established her dried fish business. She learned this business from her mother and she began with money from her husband to continue with the same work.  Mayeali works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and she earns about 800,000 SLL. 

Mayeali is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to purchase baskets of dried fish. In the future, she plans to complete her building project, buy another piece of land, and educate her children. Mayeali thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Eziron

texts.en:
Eziron is 29 years old and married. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. Eziron’s major business is motorcycle transport and he takes people to various places. He also deals in the cocoa business during the season to make ends meet. He works very hard and hopes to expand his business. 

Eziron is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, please meet Hellen. 
Hellen is a wife and mother of five. She lives in a small piece of land in Eldoret with her family (Eldoret is home to the most world-class Kenyan marathon runners). Maize and dairy farming are two of the most lucrative farming activities in the region. Hellen has been farming for most of her life. Her income sources are milk, eggs, maize, transportation services, job salary, employer pension, and other personal businesses.

Today, Hellen is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow. A typical cow would produce 10 liters of milk daily. From the sale proceed of the milk, she will earn enough money to repay the loan on-time with no issue. After the loan payment, she will realize a significant increase in her disposable income, which she will use to pay for her highest monthly expense; the farm input costs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 37-year-old single man with no children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Patrick is a social worker and has been in that service for seven years. He is in that service because he loves working with children.  

Patrick wants to improve his standard of living. He used his previous loan to buy goats and construct a house. At present, he wants money to buy land. Patrick is hardworking and he identifies limited income and a delay in salary payment as the main challenges he faces. 

He has a dream of getting married and producing children after planning for them.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Ramila is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 19, 15 and 10.  Many years ago, she established her business, raising cows.  She works seven days a week and four hours each day to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and she will use her most recent loan to buy a young dairy cow.  In the future, Ramila plans to improve her family’s economic condition.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breeds for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.60.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be maintained in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow.

loans.name: Hosa

texts.en:
Hosa is a 26-year-old married man who has three children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Hosa has a motorcycle transport business. This is a lucrative business that many youth have engaged in to earn an income. Hosa also owns a cocoa garden. He works very hard to earn a living and to provide basic necessities for the family.  

Hosa is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 38 years old and married with one 16-year-old child who attends school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans. He earns additional income from farming and showing videos. He desires to finish his boy’s quarters. 

He will use this loan to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 19, 13, and 12 years.  Many years ago, she established her poultry business.  By working seven days a week and four hours each day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy chicks for her business.  In the future, Maya plans to improve her family’s economic condition.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks.

loans.name: Erika Aracely

texts.en:
Erika Aracely is 33 years old, and married with three children. They all live in her parents' house. 

Erika has worked in retail for over eight years; she started selling candy and later opened a grocery store in her house. She is open from Monday to Sunday, from 8 AM to 10 PM. 

Erika is asking for a loan to invest in products for her grocery store. 

She says that her goals are growing the business, making some home improvements, and providing stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her early 30’s, is single and has two sons who attend school.  She has been a food vendor for seven years now.  She works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of food. She also sold charcoal on a small scale and was able to repay all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients to cook food and sell it to more customers.  She dreams of being able to build her own house one day.  

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, "Kimanga," which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook food and sell it to more customers.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is age 32, married and blessed with one child. He has owned and operated a motorcycle repair shop in their town for almost three years, and earns a net income of PHP 12,000 monthly. 

Due to insufficient funds, he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase spare parts/ accessories for motorcycles. 

He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable so that he can earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts/ accessories for motorcycles.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 45 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, spices, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell. Alma has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, spices, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and married with 10 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alma's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Alma is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

Alma has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her food vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. 

Alma is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Arsenia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Arsenia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 44 years old and married with six children. They live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the teaching service for fourteen years and loves his profession though facing a hardship of government underpayments.

George decided to seek a loan to buy land for a settlement of his family. George wishes to improve their standard of living and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy land for a settlement of his family

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Annabelle requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Annabelle has been in this business for three years now. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Concepcion is taking out a bridge loan to restart her coconut wine vending business.

Concepcion has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her coconut wine vending business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Concepcion is committed to rebuilding her business, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase towels, curtains, blankest, bed sheets, mosquito nets, kitchen utensils. rice cookers, bread toasters and durable boxes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Молодой житель района Джиликуль по имени Алижон начинает новый бизнес. Его интересует купля-продажа мелкорогатого скота. Алижон в настоящее время не женат, ему 23 года. Он у родителей старший сын. Еще у него есть двое младших сестер и один младший брат. Он и его отец работают на стройке, а остальные члены семьи занимаются растениеводством. Алижон целеустремленный человек. Он хочет начать собственный бизнес по овцеводству. Алижон запасся кормом для скотов, а на сумму кредита он хочет приобрести несколько овец и баранов. Он надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en: A young resident of the Jilikul district by the name of Alijon is starting a new business. He is interested in reselling small livestock. Alijon is currently 23 years old and not married. He is his parents' oldest son. He also has two younger sisters and one younger brother. He and his father work at a construction site, and the rest of the family members are involved in agriculture. Alijon is a goal-oriented person. He wants to start his own sheep husbandry business. Alijon stocked up on livestock feed and wants to use this loan to buy several ewes and rams. He relies on this loan.

loans.use: to buy several ewes and rams to start his own sheep husbandry business

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es:
Camisas de todos los estilos, vestidos y pantalones, cuelgan de las perchas que decoran la tienda de ropa usada de Neris, una señora de 44 años quien no deja de agradecer a MiCrédito, a KIVA y a todas las personas que le extendieron la mano cuando necesitaba invertir en su negocio. Ahora los clientes han aumentado y están satisfechos por la variedad de mercadería que ofrece gracias al préstamo anterior.
Actualmente, esta madre de cuatro hijos, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más ropa usada, juguetes y zapatos de segunda mano para invertir en la tienda nueva que considera abrir. Ella sabe que con este nuevo préstamo, más el apoyo de sus hijas, podrá seguir adelante profesional y personalmente, con un éxito seguro, hasta convertirse en la persona autosuficiente que algún día sueña ser.
texts.en:
Blouses in every style, dresses and pants too, hang from the racks that decorate Neris' used clothing store.  Neris, 44 years old, never stops thanking MiCrédito, Kiva and everyone who gave her a helping hand when she needed to invest in her business.  Now the customers have increased and are pleased with the variety of merchandise she offers thanks to her previous loan.

At this time, this mother of four children is asking for a new loan to buy more used clothing, toys and secondhand shoes to place in a new store she is thinking of opening.  Neris knows that with this new loan and the help of her daughters she can get  ahead professionally and personally, with sure success, to become the self-supporting person she dreams of being one day.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, toys and  secondhand shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is aged 52, married, and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily.  

Due to insufficient funds from her business she would like to take a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase coffee, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, noodles, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, noodles, bread, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 46 years old and comes from Camiling, Tarlac.  She is the only one supporting her daughter's schooling because her husband died.  Her daughter, Claudine, is taking up Hotel and Restaurant Services in St. Paul College of Technology.  She chose this course because cooking is her passion.  They struggle financially because she doesn’t have a father to work for them. So, for Claudine to be able to go to college, Clarita is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 from KIVA's lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 43 years old and comes from Camiling, Tarlac. She is married with seven children. One of them is Jericho, who is studying Food and Beverage Service at St. Paul College of Technology. He wants to finish college to help his family out of poverty and he chose this course because he enjoys it. To help them financially, Corazon wants to take a loan of PHP10,000 from the KIVA lenders for Jericho's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 36 years of age and comes from Camiling, Tarlac. She is married and blessed with four children. One of her children, Kimberly, is taking up Food and Beverage Service. 

Kimberly wants to finish college to help her family. She chose this course because she loves to cook. Sometimes they don’t have enough money for her schooling. So to help send Kimberly to school, Jesusa wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Jamaica

texts.en: Through patience and hard work, Jamaica believes that she will become successful and financially stable in the future. She is 21 years old, married but has no children yet. She owns and manages a small retail store in their community to support her husband in gaining income. She aims to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell but she hasn't enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of PHP8,000.00 to buy more stock of rice, soft drinks, frozen foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and laundry soap to resell. She is hoping that someday she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, soft drinks, frozen foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and laundry soaps to resell

loans.name: Wilna

texts.en:
Wilna is 22 years old and has one child. She owns and manages a small retail store within their village. 

Wilna aims to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy their necessities and save some money for future emergencies. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she does not have enough capital.

For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI amounting to PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of personal products, rice, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to improve her business further.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal products, rice, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Determination and hard work are what Elisa believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative recently, having faith in true service and assistance to needy people. Poverty drives her to earn. It urges her to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. 

Elisa requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC after joining up as a member, in order to buy fishing nets and floaters. Elisa’s aspiration is to send her children to school to obtain a degree, and provide a good quality life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and floaters

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 45 years old and a mother of two. She has owned and managed a small retail store within their town for almost three years. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Roselle needs to increase her income in order to meet their needs and finance the education of her children. 

Roselle planned to improve her business further but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase more canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beverages, sugar, eggs, rice, assorted candies, biscuits, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, Roselle believes that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beverages, sugar, eggs, rice, assorted candies, biscuits, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella is a hard working mother who was blessed with four children. They are living in a rural community managing a small retail store to generate income. Despite of being a widowed, she is determined to uplift the living status of her family. She aims to further improve her store but she has capital insufficiency. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of PHP11,000.00 to buy more dried fish, vegetables, snack foods, canned goods, beverages, cooking oil, soft drinks, laundry soap and seasonings to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish, vegetables, snack foods, canned goods, beverages, cooking oil, soft drinks, laundry soap and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
This is Jaime, 55, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He has children and he works hard to support his family through his business. He manages their own household while operating the business. He is determined to improve his income and he is also expecting a boost in profits this year.

Jaime operates a food store. He cooks breakfast meals like omelettes, noodles, pasta, sandwiches, chicken and other breakfast meals that he offers. He buys his ingredients early in the morning and prepares it for his customers upon order. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. He is thankful for this financial assistance in advance.

Jaime aspires to expand his business and he also hopes to be able to help more needy people. He dreams to give his children a better future. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como vendedora de refacciones en la escuela de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 42 años de edad mujer emprendedora y decidida a enfrentar la realidad de la vida, ella cuenta con tres hijos por los cuales ella tiene realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener  a su familia.
La actividad productiva que Silvia realiza es la venta de refacciones, ella decidió realizar esta actividad porque es rentable y hay pocas personas que realizan esta actividad en su comunidad, ella viene realizando dicha actividad desde hace cuatro años y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de insumos para la venta de refacciones tales como: Platos, vasos, pollo, panes y maíz, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia para poder desempeñar su actividad de cada día ya que es el medio en la que ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 
Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es ahorrar para un futuro construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada y dar estudio a sus hijos y que ellos se convierten en profesionales.
texts.en:
Life gave her the opportunity to work selling refreshments at the school in her community.  It was what she hoped.  It was not only the open door, but it was also what was behind this door.  What she found was something that defined what she wanted to be.  At 42 years of age, she is an enterprising woman, and she is determined to face the reality of life.  She has three children.  She has to make an enormous effort to be able to support her family.

Silvia’s business activity is selling refreshments.  She decided to engage in this business activity because it is profitable, and there are few people who are in this business in her community.  She has been in this business for four years.  It has left her with very good earnings to support her family.

She will use the loan to buy supplies for her refreshment sales.  She will buy things like plates, glasses, chicken, bread, and corn.  It is very important to her to be able to engage in her business activity every day.  It is through this work that she is able to have income to benefit her family.

One of her aspirations is to save for the future in order to build houses for her children.  She will do this so that they have adequate living conditions.  She also aspires to give her children an education and for them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for refreshments.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Edna requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc.

Edna has been in this business for 2 years now. With your help Edna will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Kuswanto

texts.en:
This is the story of Nur, son of Kuswanto:

I am the older son and I live in a modest family. My father works as a farm worker with uncertain income. Sometimes, he makes bricks to get some cash while my mother takes care of our house. 

Actually, I was supposed to have two younger siblings (a sister and a brother), but my little brother passed away. As the older child, I have a responsibility to help my parents. However, since I’m still a student, there isn’t much I can do. That’s why I want to continue my study so I’ll be able to make a better living for my family. 

In my current conditions, it seems impossible for me to do so. Continuing study in high school isn’t cheap after all. After having learned about KIVA, I hope I can get support for my study so I won’t give more burden to my parents.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ludjy

texts.en: This loan helps Ludjy get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Ludjy lives with her three children in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their brown house has no reliable access to electricity, so Ludjy is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With two of her children in school, she wishes they had better light for studying at night. A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Ludjy and her family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. She is looking forward to being connected because it will allow her to save money. Ludjy is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which she will repay through her payments for electricity. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: To connect her home to Haiti’s first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is thirty six years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Emalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emalyn's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emalyn is taking out a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to restart her food vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Emalyn is committed to rebuilding her business, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is a father in his early sixties. He is married and has nine children, two of whom are at school. Seven of his children are fully grown and independent. 

Mohamed has a store selling charcoal and this is the only project where the family bread comes from. He has been in this business for almost thirty years and thanks God, he has been working hard and now has improved to high level, selling up to one truck per week. He starts working from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to realize a good profit per month.

Mohamed has had a longtime relation with Kiva partner, Tujijenge and this is his fifth credit request. He used the previous credits, since repaid, to replenish his store with more sacks as needed. 

He now has a new business of motorbike for transportation, a business bought because of the charcoal store via Kiva loans. Mohamed received an extra income which he used to pay school fees for his children and to cover household expenses. He dreams of providing better for his family.
With his new loan request, Mohamed will replenish his charcoal store to meet demand. He will share this loan with his loan group, Actable The Best, totaling five members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his charcoal store to meet demand.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion  is a widow and lives at Aguada, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Her source of income comes from her store/food stall. She manages the store & her younger son is the cook.  
	
She joined Paglaum MPC for almost 3 years because of the benefits given to its members. She has applied for 16,000PHP to buy additional grocery items like basic commodities for sale and for the repair of their house. She looks forward to her food stall someday becoming a grocery store with a restaurant and videoke bar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall/store and to make house repairs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children, who are now school age. 

Ruth is engaged in selling snacks and seafood for 3 years. She earns approximately PHP800.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of snacks and seafood for retail.\

Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her snack and seafood vending business.

loans.use: purchase additional stock of snacks and seafood

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Искандар старательный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Искандар окончил успешно и с отличными оценками лицей и поступил в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он теперь является студентом 1 курса Экономического факультета. Искандар получил отличные оценки на вступительных экзаменах. Искандар холост. Он живет с родителями. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Iskandar, age 18, is a studious young man. He graduated from secondary school with excellent grades and he is now enrolled at the Technical Institute of the Technological University of Tajikistan.  He is a first-year student, taking classes from the Economics Department.  He received very good grades on his entrance exams.  Iskandar is still single and lives with his parents.  He is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to pay his tuition fees.  He is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Artidoro

texts.es:
Artidoro es un padre de familia amoroso, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en una mototaxi que tiene y le va muy bien porque es conocido por los clientes, se preocupa por su bienestar y respeta siempre las señales de tránsito.
Artidoro está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para poder brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos y poder más adelante verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Artidoro, 40, is a loving head of household, is married, and lives in San Martin with his family.  He is a person with a strong desire to get ahead.  For more than five years, he has been making a living offering transportation services in a mototaxi he owns and things go well for him because he is known to his customers, he is concerned about their well-being, and he always obeys the traffic signals.
Artidoro is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they offer to him he will be able to remodel his residence by painting the walls.  In this way, he will improve the quality of life of his family and will continue pushing himself to offer a better future to his children and be able to see them transformed into great professionals later on.

loans.use: to paint his residence.

loans.name: Vilma Evelin

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica, está acompañada desde hace 17 años y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, solo sus 5 hijos dependen de Vilma.


Ella se dedica a la venta de pan en su comunidad, ya tiene 4 años en este negocio el cual aprendió sola por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y en la alimentación de sus hijos, Vilma sale a vender todos los días en su comunidad, camina un aproximado de 7 kilómetros hasta vender completamente su producto pero además tiene una tienda en su casa, su hija mayor es quien se involucra en el trabajo, y lo hacen 5 horas al día. 


Vilma solicita este crédito para comprar más producto (pan)  para mejorar su tienda y tener la oportunidad de vender más, de esta manera podrá cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es que su familia esté bien y con las ganancias de su negocio espera ayudar a su esposo a comprar los fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 28 years old, has studied through second grade, and has been married for 17 years. Her husband works in agriculture and construction. Their 5 children depend on Vilma.

She sells bread in her community. She has been doing this work for 4 years, and she learned the job because she needed to help her husband with the expenses and in feeding their children. Vilma sells everyday in her community. She walks about 7 kilometers to sell all of her products, but she also has a store in her house. Her oldest daughter is involved, and they work 5 hours per day.

Vilma requests this loan to buy more bread to improve her store and to have the opportunity to sell more. In this way, she will be able to meet her clients’ needs and to improve her family’s quality of life. 

Her dream is that her family does well, and with the earnings from her business, she hopes to help her husband to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy more bread to improve her store and to have the opportunity to sell more.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es: Maria es una señora colombiana de carácter tranquilo, ella está separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad que asisten al colegio, María es empleada domestica, también se dedica al jornal y cría chanchos, dice que los días que están lluviosos se queda arreglando casas y lavando ropa de otras señoras y los demás días trabaja al jornal, comenta que juntamente con una amiga construyeron una chanchera para dedicarse a la crianza de chanchos, el crédito lo necesita para adquirir chanchos y crecer más con su negocio, lo que Maria aspira es  que cada día crezca su  negocio y le siga yendo bien para tener lo necesario para sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is a Colombian woman with a calm personality. She is separated from her husband, and she has 2 children, who are 14 and 15 years old and attend school. Maria is a domestic employee, and she also works as a day laborer and raises pigs. She says that on rainy days, she cleans houses and washes other women’s clothes; on other days, she works as a day laborer. She and a friend built a pigpen so that they can raise pigs. The loan is needed to buy pigs and grow the business more. Maria hopes that every day her business will grow and that it continues going well so that she has what she needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 35-year-old woman and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. She provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute to her husband to manage their household. 

Musarat needs a variety of supplies for her business, such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc., but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva  se dedica a la producción agrícola de verduras y flores que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente ella esta necesitando tener animales para su proyecto agricola. Ella vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Palomar. 
El crédito lo requiere para compra de ganado, ella quiere 4 torillos. Los padres de Eva la apoyan pero esta inversion requiere de ayuda externa
texts.en:
Eva has a farming business in which she grows vegetables and flowers, which are then sold at the market in the city of La Paz. She currently needs to have animals for her farming business. Eva lives with her parents in a house that is located in the community of Palomar.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cattle. She wants to acquire four young bulls. Eva’s parents support her, but this investment requires outside help.

loans.use: to buy four  young bulls.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru: Рукия вместе со своей мамой живет в отдаленном регионе. Ее отец умер несколько лет назад. Мать Рукии работает уборщицей в средней школе. Их 4 детей в семье. Двое ее старшие сестры замужем. Рукия окончила среднюю школу успешно. Теперь она хочет поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Она подала в Педагогический университет. Рукия хочет после окончания университета работать учительницей в средней школе своего района. Рукия запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rukiya lives with her mother in a remote area of Tajikistan.  Her father died a few years ago.  Rukiya's mother works as a cleaning lady in a secondary school and also raises four children.  Rukiya's two older sisters are married.  Rukiya herself successfully graduated from high school.  She now wants to enroll in university and get a higher education.  She would like to apply to the Pedagogical University and, after graduation, work as a teacher at the local secondary school. She is taking a loan to pay her university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 51 years old, married and has three children.

Loreta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Loreta requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yanira Del Tránsito

texts.es:
Yanira tenía 47 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado de educación básica, es viuda desde hace 9 años, con su esposo procrearon 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella y ya está casado, además con Yanira viven sus padres y son los únicos que dependen de ella.


Yanira siembra maíz, frijol, hortalizas y verduras, es un mujer muy luchadora porque se dedica a una actividad muy fuerte que es la agricultura y fue su padre quien se lo enseñó desde muy pequeña, además, tiene una tienda en su casa, en las diversas actividades le ayudan sus padres y su hijo, y trabajan 6 horas diarias.


El crédito lo necesita para alquilar una hectárea de terreno en el cual cultivará maíz y frijol, además comprará dos sacos de abono. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia para que se superen y salgan adelante,  sueña con mejorar la productividad de su negocio, es decir sembrar más terreno para tener más producto que ofrecer en su tienda para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Yanira, 47, was only able to study up to the ninth grade of basic education.  She has been a widow for nine years.  With her husband, they had three children of which only one lives with her and is already married.  Also, Yanira's parents live with her and are the only ones who depend on her.

Yanira plants corn, beans, vegetables, and greens.  She is a very hard-working woman because she makes a living in an a very hard activity which is agriculture, and it was her father who taught her this from a young age.  In addition, she has a shop in her house.  In these various activities, her parents and her son help her, and they work six hours every day.

She needs the loan to rent a hectare of land on which she will raise corn and beans, and also she will buy two sacks of fertilizer.

Her dreams are to continue working and helping her family so they can rise above and get ahead.  She dreams of improving the productivity of her business, meaning to cultivate more land in order to have more products to offer in her shop in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to rent a hectare of land on which she will cultivate corn and beans, and in addition she will buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is a responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Rubi's husband's taxi is currently not in a good condition and requires daily maintenance charges. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Rubi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Rubi's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Rubi also plans to save the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Rubi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi maintenance cost

loans.name: Virginia Malena

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, madre de una hija y su negocio es la artesanía en tela.
Ella es emprendedora, amable, soñadora, luchadora, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en Aygachi que se encuentra ubicado al Sudeste del Lago Menor o Wiñaymarka, en el Departamento de La Paz, Cuarta Sección de la Provincia Los Andes, con capital de sección en Puerto Pérez.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Desde que recuerda, con unos cuatro años, siempre ha estado haciendo manualidades de todo tipo. Empezó a tejer con dos agujas porque veía a su madre hacerlo y quería probar. Después, su abuela le enseñó a coser, lo más básico,  nada tienen que ver las labores que se hacen ahora con las que ella veía cuando era pequeña. Los colores cambian, los materiales, las técnicas se perfeccionan, Lo que antes le parecía antiguo, viejo, pasado de moda, ahora rodea toda su vida y quiere que siga así.
Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de venta. Ella desea realizar la compra de materia prima y una cortadora de tela para mejorar su producción.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cortadora de tela y con los beneficios pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Virginia is 49-year-old, and she is the single mother of one daughter. Virginia makes fabric for a living. She is an enterprising, friendly dreamer, and a strong fighter who is responsible and hardworking. Virginia makes cloth in Aygachi which is located southeast of Lago Menor or Wiñaymarka, in the department of La Paz in the Fourth Section of the Andes with the capital in Puerto Pérez. 

Virginia has a dark complexion, long black hair, and is of medium height. Her native language is Aymara, and she uses Spanish for business purposes. Since she can remember, when she was about four years old, Virginia has been doing crafts of all kinds. She started knitted with two needles because she saw her mother do it and wanted to try. Then Virginia's grandmother taught her the basics of how to sew, and the work she does now looks nothing like it did when she was little. The colors and materials are changing; her techniques have been perfected. What before seemed ancient, old, and out-of-style, is now what surrounds her life, and she wants it to stay that way. 

Virginia's dream is to have her own storefront. She hopes to purchase raw materials and a cloth cutter to improve her production. Virginia is requesting the loan to purchase the cloth cutter and with better earnings, pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: buy a cloth cutter and with better earnings, pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.name: Jorge Benedicto

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia amoroso, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y vive en Imperial junto a su familia.
Desde muy joven ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa siempre lo ha apoyado de manera incondicional y eso le ha dado fuerzas para seguir adelante. Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica al negocio de venta de refrescos y golosinas y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, honesto y entusiasta.
Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar golosinas para implementar su negocio, de esta sus ingresos mejorarán y así podrá brindarle estudios superiores a sus hijos quienes ya están culminando el colegio.
texts.en:
Jorge is a loving father. He is 61 years old, married, and lives with his family in Imperial. From a very young age, he has strived to help his family get ahead. His wife always provides him with unconditional support. For this reason, he gives his best effort to keep pushing forward. For more than eight years, Jorge has been managing his business of selling soft drinks and snack foods. He is doing very well because he is hardworking, honest, and enthusiastic.

Jorge is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have given. He will be able to buy snack foods to keep his business in operation. This will improve his earnings, which will allow him to provide for his children’s higher education since they are finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 31 years old and both of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a motorcyle spare parts retail business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of motorcycle spare parts to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 25 years old and single.

Rachel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rachel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rachel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es: Xiomara, utilizo el préstamo anterior para surtir la venta de accesorios de bisutería, con lo que pudo ampliar su local, aumento sus ventas y ganancias, cuanta con nuevos clientes, con el propósito de continuar teniendo una fuente de ingresos para subsistir y ampliar su negocio se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo con el que comprar piedras, alambre, hilos, dijes, etc., bebidas, golosinas, pan, boquitas y otros productos para elaborar los accesorios de bisutería y ofrecer nueva mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en: Xiomara used the previous loan to supply her sales of costume jewelry accessories with which she was able to expand her workspace and increase her sales and profits.  She has new customers.  With the aim of continuing to have a source of income to subsist on and expand her business, she decided to request a new loan with which to buy stones, wire, thread, pendants, etc., drinks, candy, snacks, and other products to make costume jewelry accessories and offer new merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stones, wire, thread, pendants, etc., drinks, candy, bread, snacks, etc. in order to offer new merchandise to her customers and make costume jewelry accessories.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo, tiene 49 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 5 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. El se dedica a la venta de golosinas en una escuela y venta de rosquillas de maíz, alcitrones (dulces), quesadilla, alborotos de maíz con dulce y otros. Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y vende en forma ambulante y enfrente a la escuela. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la actividad agrícola. Ha solicitado otro préstamo que es el séptimo ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de productos como rosquillas, quesadillas, alborotos, dulces, y otras golosinas para incrementar sus ventas. Su plan es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, age 49, is in a common-law relationship with his partner. They have five children. He resides in a neighborhood in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Gonzalo sells snack foods at a school. He sells cornmeal donuts, sweetened fruit bars, pound cakes, caramel corn, and other treats. This business has been in existence for 10 years and he sells as a street vendor in front of the school. Gonzalo previously worked in agriculture.

He is requesting another loan (his seventh one) in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The money will be invested in the purchase of products such as donuts, pound cakes, caramel corn, candy, and other snack foods so that he can increase his sales. His plan is to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy donuts, pound cakes, caramel corn, candy, and other snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es soltera, vive en la casa de sus papas donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y una cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la  ciudad del Alto, estudió en la universidad la carrera de bioquimica-farmaceutica, .
Actualmente trabaja en la farmacia de un centro de salud ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz,  Zulema trabaja todos los días de la semana y también  colabora en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para la refaccion de su dormitorio Zulema es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y ahora tiene un hijo, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Zulema is single and lives at her parents’ house, where she has a space that includes a bedroom and a kitchen. The house is made of adobe and has a cement floor. It is located in the city of El Alto. She studied at a university and earned her degree in Biochemistry and Pharmacology.

Zulema currently works at a pharmacy located in a health clinic in the city of La Paz. She works every day of the week and also contributes to the expenses such as utilities, food, and clothing. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her bedroom.

Zulema is the only one who is earning an income in her household. She now has one child, so she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to make repairs to her bedroom.

loans.name: Resort Group

texts.en:
Jeni, a woman in her late twenties, is single and deals in the food business. She has been a food vendor, called mamalishe, for four years now. She also sells cold drinks in the same place; soda, water and juices. Jeni starts working from 6am to 7pm per working day and is able to make a good return per month.

From Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe. She dreams of having a big hotel selling better food service. She will share this loan with her group, RESORT, which consists of five people. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado ya que donde él vivía no habían más grados, debía viajar hasta la ciudad pero le quedaba demasiado lejos, está acompañado desde muy joven y ha procreado 5 hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores han formado sus propios hogares, los tres menores viven con él y están estudiando.  


José es empleado de la alcaldía de su ciudad, un amigo suyo le ayudó a ingresar a este trabajo y se desempeña como personal administrativo, también trabaja en la agricultura la cual aprendió por medio de su papá. El trabajo le queda a 1 km de su casa, lo cual se desplaza a pie, el horario que cumple es de  8:00 am a 4:00 pm.
  

El préstamo será invertido para comprar medicamentos para una hija que tiene muy mal de salud.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y con esto llevar el sustento a su hogar, también que su hija mejore, espera también que sus demás hijos sean unas personas muy responsables.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old. He has a fourth grade education because where he lived, there were no higher grade levels. José would have had to travel to the city, but it was too far. He has had a companion since he was very young and has fathered five children. José's two older children have their own homes. The three younger children live with him, and they are in school.

José is employed by the mayor of his town. A friend helped him get this position, and he serves as administrative staff. He is also farming, a skill he learned from his father. José travels by foot to his job, which is located 1km from his home. He works from 8:00am to 4:00pm.

The loan will be invested in purchasing medicine for his daughter who is in very poor health. 

José's dream is to keep working and provide for his household. He also hopes his daughter will get better, and that the rest of his children will grow up to be very responsible people.

loans.use: buy medicine for his daughter who is in poor health.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene dos hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su hermano Rosario es propietaria de una movilidad que es usada para transporte publico, ella no maneja, ha contratado una persona para hacer eso. Rosario necesita un credito para la compra de un motor, de esta manera ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos: teniendo un vehiculo en optimas condiciones Rosario es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Rosario has two children and lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to her brother. Rosario is the owner of a vehicle that is used for public transport. She does not drive, she has hired someone to do this. Rosario needs a loan to buy an engine. In this way, she plans to improve her income by having a vehicle in optimal condition. Rosario is the only source of income in the home for which she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her vehicle.

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Amable Victoria, es socia del grupo "De la mano con Jesús", el cual está formado por cinco socios, todos ellos comerciantes, con el mismo fin, salir adelante mediante su negocio propio.
Amable Victoria, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diferentes marcas y paralelamente a su negocio brinda servicio de cuidado de una persona adulta por medio día.
En su negocio le va bien, poco a poco va creciendo,aumentando su clientela, y a la vez aumentando su stock de productos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para poder surtir su stock y algunas prendas de vestir para aprovechar la visita a sus clientes y ofrecerles y asi poder amplia su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the group "De la Mano con Jesús" [Hand-in-Hand with Jesus], which is formed by five members, all of which are business people with the same goal of advancing their businesses and getting ahead. She sells beauty products of different brands, while offering care services to an adult part-time. 

Victoria's business is going well, and it is increasing little by little. She has been growing her base of clients and increasing her stock of products at the same time. The loan she receives will be invested in the purchase of beauty products for her stock and to buy some clothing items she can offer her clients. In this way, Victoria will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of beauty products and clothing items.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 28-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past ten years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Saira's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items, for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore, Saira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of merchandise and other accessories for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Nafeesa

texts.en:
Nafeesa is a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband is a fruit seller in the local market. He is a guardian of his family and is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Nafeesa's husband wants to purchase different kinds of fruits in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources, her husband is unable to buy fruits for reselling. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can enable himself to fulfill his business needs.

For this financial support, Nafeesa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruits for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Nelmar

texts.en:
Nelmar is 50 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Nelmar works very hard to provide for them.

Nelmar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelmar has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Nelmar would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Joyce works hard to support her family.
