She has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joyce is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell for her gasoline sales business.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Carmnencita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Carmencita works hard to support her family.

She has an electronics repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Carmencita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop business.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 59-year-old woman and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her five children. Parveen provides sewing services and earns the income to contribute to her husband to manage the household.

Parveen needs a variety of supplies for her business, such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc., but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Datum

texts.en:
This is the story of Purwati, daughter of Datum: 

I am the second child. I live with my mother since my parents divorced. However, my mother has married for the second time with a farm worker and has a child who still needs to be raised. My father’s uncertain income can’t even meet our daily needs. After graduating from junior high school, I plan to enter a vocational school. Somehow, I realized that my parents don’t have much for that. That’s why I hope I can get KIVA’s support so I can continue my study without giving more trouble to my parents.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 36 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three children. Her husband has been running his own business of marble stone and polishing for many years. He is the sole person responsible for managing the household and fulfilling the demands of each family member.

Parveen's husband wants to increase his business by purchasing different kinds of accessories for his business use, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy these products. Therefore Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can buy business merchandise and fulfill his business needs.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband invest in his marble stone business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es: Serafín de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y 2 hijos de 19 y 28 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se ha ganado el respeto de sus vecinos, al demostrar que es un hombre trabajador, que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo cestas de mimbre, actividad que realiza desde su juventud por lo que gracias a su experiencia se ha logrado mantener en el gusto de sus clientes, manteniendo la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo. Serafín desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Serafín, age 50, lives in his own home along with his wife and two children, who are 19 and 28 years old.  He is a man who has earned the respect of his neighbors by proving himself to be a hard worker. He makes his living making wicker baskets, a trade he has practiced since he was young. Thanks to his experience he has managed to stay in favor with his customers and continue supporting his family through his work. Sarafín wants to replace the roof on his house, for which he is seeking a loan with FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 32 years old and married with two children whom are both in school.

Annie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Annie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and she also earns an income from selling root-crops.

Annie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 29 años de edad, su nivel académico es hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela, su pareja se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y a la pesca ya que cerca de donde viven existe una laguna.
 
Ella al igual que su esposo siempre han trabajado en la agricultura, labor que cada uno aprendió de sus padres ya que ese fue lo que sacó adelante sus respectivas familias, actualmente Roxana cultiva una hectárea de maíz y una de sorgo, su esposo es el que se dedica al trabajo más pesado pero ella siempre está ahí con él para apoyarlo y trabajar juntos hasta terminar la jornada laboral, el lugar donde cultivan está cerca de la vivienda a una distancia de 10 minutos.       

El crédito será utilizado para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultiva, también para comprar la semilla, herbicidas y fertilizantes  como sulfato todo esto para obtener una buena cosecha.

Sus planes a futuro son brindarle la mejor educación a sus dos hijos hasta que logren obtener una carrera universitaria, cumplir con el compromiso del crédito y si Dios les permite obtener una buena cosecha, ellos esperan instalar la energía eléctrica de las ganancias obtenidas y así mejorar los servicios básicos que necesita la familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is 29 years old and her academic level is until the seventh grade. She is married and has two children who study in the school. Her husband works in agriculture and in fishing since there is a lake near where they live.

She, like her husband, has always worked in agriculture, work that each one learned from their parents since this was what got their respective families ahead. Currently Roxana farms a hectare of corn and one of sorghum. Her husband does more of the heavy work, but she has always been there with him to support him and work together until finishing the day’s work. The place where they farm is near their home, a distance of ten minutes.

The loan will be utilized to pay the rent of the land where she farms, and also to buy seed, herbicide, and fertilizer like sulfate, all of this to obtain a good harvest.

Her plans for the future are to provide the best education to her two children until they achieve a university degree, fulfill the commitment of the loan, and if God allows them to obtain a good harvest, they wish to install electric energy from the obtained earnings and in that way improve the basic services that the family needs.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the land where she farms, and also to buy seed, herbicide, and fertilizer like sulfate, all of this in order to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a 24-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of 10 children. She lives with her husband in the lush hills of Nandi hills, in the rift valley region of Kenya. Rose passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past eight years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Rose has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk price in the recent past has been going up, so Rose, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learns that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Rose said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Rose hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her 10 school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married. She is managing a small retail store in their village to generate income. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and have a bright future. 

She wants to further improve her small store to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more magnolia chicken, rice, peanut butter, e-load, and more groceries to resell. 

She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request in order to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more magnolia chicken, rice, peanut butter, e-load, and more groceries to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a new member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative.  He wishes to avail himself of the various products and services of the Cooperative.  He and his wife have been full time tricycle operators for 10 years already. They have 5 children and 4 of them go to school. 

Now, he is applying for a loan to finance the repair of their motorcycle and the renewal of the annual registration. His plan after this loan is to change his motorcycle unit into a new and additional one in order for a long lasting operation which will lead them to a higher quality of life and for their children's future.

loans.use: To pay for his motorcycle repair and renewal of the registration

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Don Gregorio, tiene 70 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Se dedica al cultivo de café, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo de caña de azúcar. Este cultivo de café lo tiene en su propio terreno y la producción la vende en el mercado de la zona. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo siendo el quinto ciclo que es por 5,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá, en la compra de abono para mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, así mismo le ayudara para asegurar la producción de la siguiente temporada. Su plan es mejorar la plantación en una finca nueva.
texts.en: Gregorio, age 70, is single with four children and lives in a village in Taulabe, Comayagua. His livelihood is his coffee crop, which he has been cultivating for 15 years. Before that, he grew sugar cane. He grows his coffee on his own property and sells the beans at the local market. He has decided to take out another loan for 5,000 lempiras [HNL], which will be his fifth loan cycle. With this loan, he will invest in fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop, which will help to ensure a good crop next season. His plan is to improve his plantings into a new farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business. Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years. Cecilia earns additional income from meat vending.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 47-years-old and married.

Dolly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Dolly has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a welding shop.

Dolly aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 55-years-old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gleceria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gleceria requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell to customers.

Gleceria has been in this business for twenty-one years. In the future, Gleceria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, sardines, etc. to sell.

Jane has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending, farming sugarcane, and direct selling Avon products.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. Mildred is married and has a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of herbal medicine to sell.

Mildred has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, laminate, wood, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and to pay for the labor needed to build a sink and a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 44 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for giving her capital to support her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farming tools and fertilizers. In the future, Mabel wishes to have a productive harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farming tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like herself.  Caridad is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Chita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Chita has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and she is married with five children. Four of her children to school.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Chris is a 19-year-old entrepreneur from Frederick, Maryland who wishes to start a Moon Bounce rental business. He wishes to serve children’s birthday parties and other events in the Greater Washington area.  He needs a $5,000 loan to help him buy three bounce houses. He plans to rent these out hourly or for full days during the weekends. 

Chris currently works as a support clerk assistant, a position he’s held for two years. He will keep his job and work on his start-up during the weekend, until Jump It Up rentals becomes profitable and he will be able to dedicate full time to it.  He has been working with the Small Business Development department at Latino Economic Development Center for the past three months working on a business plan and acquiring business management skills to initiate his start-up.
 
Chris still lives with his parents who support him in his start-up project as they are entrepreneurs as well. They started a catering company that has been affiliated with LEDC since 2009. To learn more about his business, please visit: www.jumpituprentals.com.

loans.use: to buy three bounce houses

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Marlene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 52, a resident of Cavite, who is married to Manuel and has four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their daily needs. 
                            
Milagros operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store. She retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the main street. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy rice in sacks/cavans. This is a major item. Rice is a staple in the Philippines. This will definitely increase her business income as rice is regularly eaten in her country. 

Milagros hopes to grow her business to be able to give her children the best education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more cavans/sacks of rice

loans.name: Turdakan

texts.ru: Турдакан 58 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Турдакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Турдакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец, 4 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,96 ГА, на котором Турдакан ежегодно выращивает: картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Экологически чистую продукцию, а также домашнее молоко Турдукан реализует местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход Турдакан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турдакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшей перепродажи. Турдакан планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Turkadan is 58 years old, married, and the mother of an adult son. Turkadan has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows farm produce, having started this business 18 years ago by buying livestock for 50,000 KGS. Thanks to Turkadan's hard work, her farm at present includes three cows, 20 sheep, and four horses. She also has a 4.96 ha [12 acres] land plot, where she annually grows potatoes, grains and sainfoin [a plant used for animal forage] for own use as well as for sale. Turdukan sells her environmentally clean produce as well as farm milk locally. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Turdukan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS in order to buy livestock for later resale. Turdakan plans to save up for building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cows for increasing the volume of milk sales.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
42-летняя Замира живет в городе Душанбе. У нее высшее образование. В течение 5 лет она работала по своей специальности бухгалтером. Последние два года Замира занимается собственным швейным делом. Она научилась этому делу у одной мастерицы.
Замира замужем. Ее муж работает ревизором в одной частной фирме. У Замиры четверо детей в возрасте 17, 15, 14 и 1 года. Старший сын Замиры поступает на договорное отделение Таджикского Национального Университета. Он выбрал специальность бухгалтерский учет и успешно сдал экзамены. Теперь перед началом занятий его семья должна оплатить за учебный год. Для этой цели Замира просит кредит в размере 1700 долларов США. Из запрашиваемой суммы 1500 долларов США пойдут на оплату контракта сына, а на остальные 200 долларов будут куплены необходимые учебные принадлежности. Этот кредит важен семье Замиры.
texts.en:
42-year-old Zamira lives in the city of Dushanbe. She has a higher education and worked in her field as an accountant for five years. For the past two years she has been running her own sewing business, a skill she learned from another experienced seamstress.

Zamira is married and has four children aged 15, 15, 14 and 1. Her husband works as an inspector at a private firm. Her oldest son is going into Tajik National University. He has chosen accounting as a major and successfully passed his exams. Now, before classes begin, his family has to pay his tuition. For this reason Zamira is requesting a loan of $1,700 USD, which will cover $1,500 for her son's school fees and $200 for supplies. This loan is important to Zamira's family.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Nemia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Nemia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Patrick, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 55-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and three children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandi hills, in the Rift valley region of Kenya .For the past 21 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and tea selling .He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Patrick passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed of dairy cow. The chaff cutter will assist Patrick in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed his cow. Also, it will aid the animal’s digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food .Patrick also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan, he will be making a cool US $11 per day .

Before Patrick joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Patrick now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club” .With the loan, Patrick will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Patrick will achieve this .An increase in income will allow Patrick to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Patrick fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter and a dairy cow

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti and her husband live in Ciamis, a small city located about an hour from Bogor. Her husband works as a factory laborer. To support the family, she manages a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre que demuestra su tenacidad y empeño en cada uno de sus trabajos, ya que actualmente se desempeña como sastre, pero además tratando de darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa se dedica a la elaboración de cestas de mimbre, desde hace 10 años, y es gracias a esa amplia experiencia que sus clientes buscan y recomiendan sus productos, ya que son de muy buena calidad. Rigoberto desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 38 years old. He lives in his own home, along with his wife and children, aged 16, 13, 10, and 3. He is a man who demonstrates his tenacity and determination in all of his work. He is currently working as a tailor. In addition - trying to give his wife and children better living conditions - he has worked to make wicker baskets for the past 10 years; thanks to this ample amount of experience, his clients seek him out and recommend him, as his work is of very good quality. 

Rigoberto wants to change the roof of his home, as it is deteriorated. For this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal, wood, and nails to change the roof of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal, wood, and nails to change the roof of his home..

loans.name: Souy

texts.en:
Souy is 69 years old and a married man who has one dependent child. He lives in a rural area of Pursat Province. To earn a living, he and his wife manage a rice farming business which is their sole source of income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost forty years with an average income of USD $10 a day. 

Souy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by building a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Muwanguzi Group

texts.en: Rose, aged 35, a member of Muwanguzi Group Wakaliga, a mother of four, and three are school going children.  Rose began her business of selling clothes (kanzu and sharias) 15 years ago. According to Rose, sitting at home and waiting for her husband to provide everything was not possible.  Therefore, in 1999 she began a business of selling clothes which she believes is doing well.  She began her business with little money and slowly but slowly it is growing bigger. Rose approached UGAFODE for a loan of 500,000 UGX so as to add to her business. She is very hard working, trust worthy and calm.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
This is Elnora, 42, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a farmer, with four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elnora operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and also to the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more farm inputs and fertilizers for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elnora dreams of owning a vehicle and having her own place for her farm inputs. She aims to expand her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other farming supplies

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng is 34 years old, a garment-factory worker, and a married woman with two children living in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2007. Her husband is 29, also a garment-factory worker. One of her children is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $12.7 a day. 

Now Sreng would like to request a loan to buy zinc sheets, doors and windows to finish building her house. This loan will help her and her family have a new house of their own to live in. 

In the future, she is going to run a shop for designing clothes and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, doors and windows to finish building her house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 37-year-old male living in Kasese, Uganda, who is married with four children. Emmanuel is a farmer dealing in tomatoes, rice, cassava and maize. He also has a produce store where he sells dry maize, beans and others to get additional income. He began the farming business to cater to his family’s needs. Completing his residential house is his dream. Emmanuel wants money to buy fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Santos Rosibel

texts.es:
Santos, posee una venta de pupusas y tortillas, ya tiene su propia familia, vive con su esposo y un hijo; su negocio funciona desde que ella estaba soltera y en la actualidad es la manera de generar ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde. Con el paso del tiempo ha ampliado su negocio e incorporado la venta de ropa y calzado. En este momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Con el capital invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, para que sus clientes estén cómodos, de esta manera mejorara la imagen de su negocio y dará un buen servicio, espera tener nuevos clientes para que sus ventas mejoren y tener mayores ingresos con los que seguirá aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
Para la Sra. Santos es importante mantenerse trabajando para lograr pagar su deuda y cumplir el sueño de tener un chalet para variar más la mercancía que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santos sells pupusas and tortillas. She now has her own family; she lives with her husband and one son. Her business has been up and running since she was single, and now is a way to generate income with which she helps her husband with family expenses. She works from seven in the morning until two in the afternoon. As time has passed, she has grown her business to include the sale of clothing and shoes. 

At the moment she does not have any problems with the business. With the capital, she will invest in tables and chairs so that her clients are comfortable. With this, she will improve the look of her business and will provide good service. She hopes to have new clients so that her sales will improve, and to have better earnings with which to continue contributing to household expenses.

For Mrs. Santos, it is important to work to pay her debt and to achieve her dream of having a place of business where she can carry a variety of merchandise for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs so that her clients are comfortable.

loans.name: Putri

texts.en:
Putri, her husband, and their child live in Sukabumi, a small city located in West Java province. 

To support their family living, Putri and her husband manage a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payments. Putri joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Riyan

texts.en: Meet Riyan. Riyan is a hardworking man who runs a small stall called "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and includes a utility bill payment service. He lives with five of his family members in Bogor, a city located about an hour from Jakarta. He began working with Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business into selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, he can process from 40-79 transactions per day. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to process more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita lives in Buicaren. She has five children and most of her daily income is from selling chickens. She is now applying for a loan of $800. Rosita started to open her business in 2012 with her own working capital of $250. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to improve her business in the future.  She also has animals, and a garden in her place.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion has run a retail store in her village for more than four years in addition to farming. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing goods for sale. While she is earning well from her farm, she is now improving it and taking her new loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. She wants to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to retail,

Felly has been in this business for five years. Felly earns more income from her general store.

Felly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to retail

loans.name: Risil

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Risil works hard to support her family.

She has a hardware business in the Philippines and earns additional income from frozen foods. Risil is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of hardware to sell in her hardware business.

Risil has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hardware to sell.

loans.name: Celna

texts.en:
Celna works hard to support her family. Celna is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Celna has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Celna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Jonnah

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jonnah works hard to support her family.

Jonnah has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jonnah is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to dry for her business.

Jonnah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to dry for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell at her vegetable vending business.

Nancy has been in this business for five years. Nancy earns more income from vegetable farming.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dionesa

texts.en: Dionesa is 66 years old with five children. She lives in the Philippines with some members of her family. Her children had their own family and she was lucky to say that they already had their own way of living. Dionesa earns a living by providing transportation services to local community members. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for vehicle repair. Her tenant, which is her son, was able to rent the said motorcycle and she used this for her daily expenditures. Improving her business became easier with her access to GDMPC as a member. Recently, she took a new loan to buy new tires to replace the old and used tires. In the future Dionesa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old and used tires.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Dulag, Leyte. Corazon earns a living through her sari sari store. Corazon sells various goods to the people in her area. Corazon is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to augment her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Corazon has hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет дочь. Баходур занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он в основном выращивает виноград и арбуз. Баходур занимается выращиванием арбуза и винограда более 7 лет. Он постепенно год за годом развевает свою деятельность. Баходур очень заботиться об образовании своей дочери. Она в этом году поступила в университет. Баходур запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора дочери. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a kind and hardworking man who is married and currently has a young daughter at home.  He's a farmer by trade, growing primarily grapes and watermelons, and has done so for more than 7 years.  Year after year, he's seen his business grow slowly but surely.  

Bahodur's daughter has started college this year; he cares a lot about her, and wants to see that she gets a good education.  He's requesting a loan to help pay for his daughter's tuition, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice retailing. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Pshatavan village of Armavir region. She lives there with her husband as their only son works and lives in Russia. Tamara's husband is a craftsman and receives orders from local villagers for making different things from clay. Tamara herself is involved in farming. She runs a small farm where she raises 15 chickens and grows cherries, plums, apples and grapes. 

Tamara takes care of her farm with great pleasure and works hard to sustain it. The requested loan of $3,000 (USD) will be a big support to her farm. She plans to purchase land for expanding cultivation, construct a new barn and purchase a cow for developing a cattle breeding business. 

As this is Tamara's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for land, construct a barn and purchase a cow

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Hello Lenders! Meet Patience, a 32-year-old farmer from a remote village in Kimindi in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. She resides with her 34-year-old husband with whom she is blessed with two boys and a beautiful daughter. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 12 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nimfa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Nimfa has been raising pigs for 1 year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jhelyn

texts.en:
Jhelyn is 25 years old and has two children. Jhelyn is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Jhelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets to raise, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jhelyn has been pig fattening for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jhelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Welfreda

texts.en:
Welfreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Welfreda has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food-production business. Welfreda has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Welfreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food-production business

loans.name: Junry

texts.en: Junry is studying business administration at a university. As the first son, he has to be a role model to his three siblings. His father is a private employee and his mother takes care of the household. He always wants his parents to be proud of him so he works for it. He used his previous loan for his previous school year's education costs like tuition fees and is now taking a new loan to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current school year. He is planning to find a better job after he graduates, to earn a better income in order to support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current school year.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 62 years old and married with three children. The family earns an income from farming and a sari sari store. What they earn is just enough for their daily expenditures.  

Sending their daughter Kristel Joy to school is a struggle because studying is expensive. That’s why they want to ask for PHP 20,000 financial assistance from Kiva lenders. They are hopeful that lenders will approve this loan for this will be of big help to them.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
This is Vicente. He is so thankful for the previous 50,000 PHP loan that was granted to him for his piggery business. It really helped fund his personal, household and business needs.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan as additional capital to purchase additional hogs and feed and to recover his losses from the recent storm surge. He is able to sustain his family's daily needs through his earnings from his piggery business. 

Vicente aims to improve and grow his business to ensure his family a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for his business.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 49 years old, married and has children. As a way of generating income, he has had a tailoring business within his community in Cavite, Philippines for years now. Together with his wife he works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

He mainly offers lace, curtains, and other home decor. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are present all year round. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Danilo wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items like a sewing machine. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Danilo hopes that his business will continue to operate and help him to provide for his family's needs. In the future, he dreams of having a peaceful and sufficient life with his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric and thread and purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Linalyn

texts.en:
This is Linalyn She is 48 years old and currently resides with her husband, Junny, in Caloocan City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than seven years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Linalyn would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Linalyn hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She aims to expand her business and to provide her the best education, for her family to always be healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Effie

texts.en:
Effie is 38 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Effie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed. 

Effie has been pig fattening for nine years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children who all attend school, Romelie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling natural medicines in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Romelie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of medicines to sell to her customers.

Romelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Maria Aleen's business that she runs for many years has been doing well and it sustained their living. With her generated income, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She had finally used her savings for house improvement. To increase in sales, she took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell.
In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living situation of the entire family. Maria Aleen was taken photo with her vehicle used for transporting her goods and transportation services business. She acquired this vehicle through amortization and it was paid out from her revenue.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been helping her husband for many years in operating their own transportation services business to make a living. Aside from this, she also works in their own farm, their main source of income. With her generated revenue, her previous loans used for these activities were repaid successfully.   

Her dreams of having a retail store were realized by saving a portion of her income to put up a grocery retailing business. Currently this year, she started her business and she make a little retail store at home. To increase sales, she took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the near future, she plans to build a store for her to earn daily income. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Carlos Arnulfo

texts.es:
Carlos de 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, los dos mayores ya formaron sus propios hogares, solo 3 aún viven en casa de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando en la escuela.

Carlos es muy reconocido por todos los miembros de la comunidad, es agricultor, él siembra maíz y sorgo, además tiene ocho años dedicándose a la siembra de sandía durante la temporada, el lugar donde siembra está a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa y se va a pie, sus hijos mayores le ayudan con el trabajo en la agricultura, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 del mediodía.

El crédito lo utilizará para cancelar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrará maíz y sorgo, además comprará la semilla, fertilizantes y pagará la mano de obra que le ayudarán con la siembra. 

Sus planes a futuro son tener su propio terreno para cultivar y bajar de esta forma los costos de producción, 
que Dios le permita tener una buena cosecha para cubrir sus compromisos y además asegurar la alimentación para su familia y que sus hijos sigan el ejemplo y que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se puede salir a delante.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46 years old. He is married and has 5 children. The two oldest have their own homes; only 3 still live at home, and one of them is studying in school. 

Carlos is well recognized by all members of the community; he is a farmer who plants corn and sorghum. He also has spent the last eight years working to plant watermelon during the season. The place where he grows is 20 minutes from his home, and he arrives on foot. His older children help him with the farmwork, and he works from 6:00 in the morning until 12:00 midday.

He will use the loan to pay the rent on the land where he plants corn and sorghum. In addition, he will buy seeds, fertilizers, and will pay for the labor that will help with the planting. 

His future plans are to have his own land to cultivate and to lower production costs. God willing, he will have a good harvest to meet his commitments. He will also ensure that his family is fed and that his children follow this example, and, with a lot of work and effort, can move forward.

loans.use: to rent the land where he will plant corn and sorghum, and also to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the labor that will help him with the planting.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a 33-year-old mom of five, has been operating her transportation services business with her husband  to make a living. For over 10 years in running the business, she was able to maintain and sustain it. She always finds many ways just to augment their living. 

Though she earns a better income from this, she still has financial needs for their house repair. For this, she took a new loan to cover the costs for house renovation. A portion of this loan amount will also be used to buy new set of tires to replace the old and used tires. She has to maintain safety of the services in order to have more loyal costumers that make business with them.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the services as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to cover the costs for house renovation and new tires

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha signed up for her membership with PMPC to avail herself of the needed capital to start up a native bags business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to small time borrowers like her. Editha was able to turn the tide in her favor and makes good sales these days. She now wants to take advantage of the good fortune so she has availed herself of a loan to purchase materials to make more native bags to sell. In the future she hopes to create a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make more native bags to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She is thankful that she was granted a PHP 50,000 loan, which was used to renovate her apartment. Her income from her apartment helps meet their daily personal and household needs and in the education of her children.  

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy a new PC for her newly opened "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services, wherein customers can pay the services by inserting coins in the machine. There is an increased need for services like these in the Philippines, as not everyone has Personal Computers at home. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. There are also people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation, as well as people who just love to surf the net and social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

Letecia believes she will be more successful in her business and dreams of giving her family a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy an additional PC and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Bahtovar

texts.en: Bahtovar was born in 1996. He comes from a small village. Bahtovar lives with parents. He is not married. He graduated from school successfully and has applied to the university. Bahtovar studies in the faculty of Management. He reads a lot of books and often goes to the library. Bahtovar hopes that he becomes a highly qualified specialist in the future. He must pay for his first year of tuition and with this aim, he is asking for a loan of 700 USD. He awaits your mercy. This loan will help him to get a higher education.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is a hardworking man. He is divorced and does not have any children. Umedjon is a student of the 4th course. He studies at the Tajikistan State University Politic and Business school. He studies well. After graduating university, he wants to work in the low sector of Tajikistan. He will be a good specialist in the future because he is a smart man. Umedjon is asking for a loan of 1,400 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 40 years old, lives in Plaridel with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies a loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Biyinzika Group

texts.en:
Eva, aged 35, is a member of Biyinzika group Wakaliga. She is a single mother of two, school-going children. Eva is a tailor by profession, which is a job she has been doing for 10 years. According to Eva, tailoring did not bring in enough income for her family, so she saved some and began a boutique to complement the income from tailoring. She began the boutique 9 years ago. She believes it is doing well. She began her business with little money. Through getting loans from UGAFODE, her business has improved and she is doing well. Eva approached UGAFODE for a third loan, through the group, so as to add to her business. She is very hardworking, trustworthy, and focused.

She thanks the group members for standing by her.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothing

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
The “Blessing” Group is made up of three enterprising women, dedicated to working for their family’s well being. They are into grocery and fish. 

Comfort is the group representative. She is the mother of one child, who has been her inspiration for her success. She sells grocery and started this business seven years ago, with the help of a loan she got from her husband. Since then she has maintained her business, so she is asking for a loan to buy toffees, drinks, biscuits, sardines, noddles, etc. and sell to customers. One of her goals is to maintain her business.

Hannah is another one of the members. She is 52 years old, and has been selling fish. Elizabeth is 50 years old and sells grocery.

loans.use: to buy toffees, drinks, biscuits, sardines, noddles, etc. and sell to customers

loans.name: Saut

texts.en: Saut took this photo with her husband. She is a 62-year-old, married woman with five children and she is a grocer. She also makes Cambodian cakes for sale and she has done this selling since 2009. Her husband is 64 and a farmer. Two of her children are married and living at separate houses; two of them help their mother with selling and another is a worker. They all live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $23 per day. Now Saut would like to request a loan to buy more groceries to resell. This loan will help her earn more income to support her family. In the future, she is going to renovate her grocery and her house.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy is a 44-year-old married farmer with four children. She has been a farmer since 1990. Her husband is 43, also a farmer. Three of her children are garment-factory workers. They all live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $15 per day. Now Dy would like to request a loan to buy a motor for her children to ride to work. This loan will help her family reduce traveling expenses. In the future, she is going to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 23-year-old woman. She is married with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden and she buys and sells more cocoa in the market. She is very hardworking. She hopes to buy land to plant more cocoa. She wants the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ruth

texts.en:
Ma.Ruth is 52 years old and married with five children; three of her children are in school. Ma.Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma.Ruth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Ma.Ruth would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ruth has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sonia is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sonia has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more wood for her furniture making business.

Sonia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her furniture making business

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
In the photo, Voeun is with her husband. She is 53 years old, a farmer and also a married woman with five children living in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1979. Her husband is 58 and also a farmer. Three of her children are workers, and two others are students. Together, they can earn approximately $14 per day. 

Now Voeun would like to request a loan to buy wood, roof tiles and cement to finish her house building. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy wood, roof tiles and cement to finish her house building

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia Encarnación sigue dedicándose a elaborar tejidos y trabajando como empleada del hogar, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lana de diferentes colores entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete acumñp.lir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Encarnación continues to knit and work as a maid. She has spent a long time in this job and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She would like to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  

Encarnación has applied for a loan to buy different coloured wool and other items. She is grateful for the loan that has been granted to her and she promises to honour her repayments.

loans.use: to buy different coloured wool and other items

loans.name: Hearty

texts.en:
Hearty is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 53, she is married. In Plaridel, she runs a bakery that primarily supports her family. Every day she never gets tired tending her store.  

Hearty is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar and milk for her bakery business. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar and milk for her bakery business

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo is a 49-year-old man who is married with 10 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa plantation and works very hard to see that his family thrives. He hopes to have a more established family. He wants the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bundibugyo Youth Development Association Group

texts.en:
Ruth, whose hand is raised in the group, is a 40-year-old female who is married with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing that she needed an improved standard of living, she decided to join a group to get small loans to start small businesses. She deals in cassava flour and charcoal alongside with her rentals and cocoa selling, from which she has managed to meet her daily expenses. The challenge she has is a low capital base. 

She wants the loan to buy cassava flour and charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and chacoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 31-year-old man who is married with four children aged 16, 11, 8 and 7, all of whom go to school. He has a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business. He has a problem of limited capital, but hopes to complete his house. He needs a loan to buy solar panels to fix on his house.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to fix on his house.

loans.name: Sountou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il est composé femmes qui ont  après 06 cycles passés dans le programme assoir une bonne entente au sein du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même quartier et cela depuis plusieurs années. Elles font comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Sountou (assise à droite avec une main levée), l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme modèle de par son engagement. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, mariée 03 files âgées de 13 à 22 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires comme l’huile palme, la pâte d’arachide, l’ognon et divers autres produits qu’elle achète au marché international pour la revente dans sa boutique chez elle. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter 10 sacs de riz à 12 500 Fr CFA unité, 02 bidons d’huile de palme, 07 bidons huile végétale et divers autres produits alimentaires. 

Avec des bénéfices, elle assurer la dépense quotidienne d’une part et d’autre part augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was established December 12, 2011 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" loan association. It consists of women who went through six loan cycles and have reached a good agreement within the group. They have been living in the same neighborhood for several years. Their main activity is small retail commerce, along with farming during the rainy season.

Mrs. Sountou (seated on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower for the group. She is a model due to her commitment. She is 44 years old, married with three daughters aged 13 through 22 years.

She is active in the trade of food products such as oil palm, groundnut paste, onions and various other products she buys at the international market for resale in her home-based shop. 

She intends to use the new loan to buy ten bags of rice at 12,500 CFA francs each, two containers of palm oil, seven containers of vegetable oil, and various other food products. 

She will use the profits to handle daily expenditures on the one hand, and on the other hand increase her savings.

loans.use: buy 10 bags of rice at 12,500 CFA francs each, 2 containers of palm oil, 7 containers of vegetable oil, and various other food products.

loans.name: Aminata Demba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 13 décembre 2011 lors de son inauguration. Actuellement il est composé de  membres qui partagent un esprit de solidarité et d’entre aide sur tous les aspects de la vie en générale.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Aminata   (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de trois enfants dont deux filles et un garçon. Elle tient une table au village où elle vend du riz, de l’huile, du sucre, des sucreries pour enfants et divers bouillons culinaires. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des paquets de bouillons, 05 paquets de thé vert de 12 boîtes et du sucre pour la revente par détail. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales et d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was inaugurated on 13th December 2011.  It is now made up of members who are mutually very supportive in all areas of their lives.  The main business activity of all the members is commerce, accompanied by rain-fed agriculture.

Aminata (sitting on the far right, with her hand raised in the photo) is the representative borrower of the group.  She is married and has three children, two girls and a boy.  She has a stall in the village where she sells rice, oil, sugar, sweets for children and various culinary stocks.  She has a good amount of experience in her business.

Her new loan will be used to buy packets of stock, 5 packets of green tea and 12 boxes of sugar for resale.  Aminata's profits will help her husband provide for the expenses of their family and be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy packets of stock, 5 packets of green tea and 12 boxes of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le  20 avril 2010. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même village  et ceux des alentours. Les femmes entretiennent de bonnes relations et font du commerce comme activité.
Bousso debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants 6 filles  et 3 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire du commerce. Elle gère une boutique d’alimentation.
