Avec le prêt, elle va ravitailler sa boutique en riz, savon, huile, divers produits alimentaires dont sa clientèle a besoin.
Avec les bénéfices, elle épargne et s’investit dans l’embouche.
texts.en:
This group of 28 women are members of the 'Banc Villageois' which was created on 20th April 2010.  The members all live in the same village or surrounding areas.  The women all share a good relationship and work in commerce.

Bousso (standing on the right with her hand raised, in the photo) is 40 years old.  She is married and has nine children, six girls and three boys.  She plans to use her loan for her retail business, she runs a food shop.  The loan will be used to restock her shop with rice, soap, oil and various other food products, all the products that her customers need.  Bousso will save some of her profits and reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy various food products for resale.

loans.name: Marame's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé le 26/12/11, le groupe est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes le commerce. Maréme est la représentante du groupe, elle a 60 ans; divorcé et mère de 9 enfants dont 2 garçons. son aîné a 40 ans et son cadet a 19 ans. Elle fait de la transformation de produit halieutique.Ensuite elle vend du poisson fumé et séché auprès du quais de pèche de sa ville. Elle a une expérience de 30 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 50 caisses de poisson à 150000 f,10 sacs de sel à 12000 f, 10 rouleaux de tissu  à  250000 f.Ses bénéfices lui permettrons de se payer des sacs de ciment et de fer pour terminer la construction de sa maison.Elle aide aussi ses petits enfants en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
The 'Banc Villageois' was created on 26th December 2011, and is made up of eight women who all live in the same neighbourhood and work in commerce.

Maréme is the group representative.  She is 60 years old, divorced and mother to nine children, two of whom are boys.  Her eldest child is 40 years old and her youngest is 19 years old.  Maréme has been processing fish for a living for 30 years now.  She sells her smoked and dried fish at the quayside in her village.

Maréme will use her loan to buy 50 boxes of fish for 150,000 francs CFA, 10 sacks of salt for 12,000 francs CFA and 10 rolls of fabric for 250,000 francs CFA.  Her profits will enable her to buy sacks of cement and iron to complete the construction of her house.  She also helps pay the expenses of her grand children when necessary.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of fish, 10 sacks of salt and 10 rolls of fabric for her fish business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans résidente à  Lomé dans le quartier  Bè, Adjo  est  mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a optée pour la vente des  soutiens  gorge. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Hédzranawé une fois par mois et revend par vente  ambulante dans les environs de son quartier de résidence. Adjo sollicite un prêt  pour  faire prospérer  son activité afin de réaliser  plus de bénéfice
texts.en:
Adjo is 38 years old and lives in the Bè district of Lomé.  She is married and has three children.  Adjo decided to sell bras and she buys her supplies at the Hédzranawé market, once a month.  She then sells the underwear, on foot around her local neighbourhood.

Adjo has requested this loan in order to expand her business and make greater profits.

loans.use: to buy 87 bras for resale.

loans.name: Nkongoro Tukore Group

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 39-year-old, hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income; she earns additional income from farming. She started this business to boost her family's income. Her main challenge is price fluctuations. She has hopes of a stable business and educated children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Afiwoavi

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Amoutiévé, Afiwoavi   est âgée de 35ans,  elle est mariée  et  mère  de 2 enfants. Afiwoavi    vend des produits d'alimentation générale et  s’approvisionne 3 fois  par mois  au grand marché.  Elle  les revend à la devanture de son domicile.  Afiwoavi sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Afiwoavi lives in the Amoutiévé district of Lomé.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children.  Afiwoavi sells general food products, and buys her supplies from the main market, three times a month.

She sells her products from a stall in front of her house.

Afiwoavi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of spaghetti and other food products for resale.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans,  Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier de Casablanca, elle est  mariée  et  mère  d’un enfant. Ayawavi   vend  le charbon de bois  et  s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois chez les grossistes et  les revend à la devanture de son domicile.  Ayawavi  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et réaliser plus  de profit.
texts.en:
Ayawavi is 40 years old and lives in the Casablanca district of Lomé.  She is married and has one child.  Ayawavi sells charcoal, and buys her supplies twice a month from wholesalers.  She then retails the charcoal from the front of her house.

Ayawavi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 11 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier de Casablanca, Akouvi est âgée de 39ans,  elle est veuve avec  2 enfants. Akouvi  vend  les  fruits  et  s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois  à  abattoir au grand marché.  Elle  les revend  à côté d’une station d’essence.  Akouvi  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 39 years old, and lives in the Casablanca district of Lomé.  She is a widow and has two children.  Akouvi sells fruit and buys her supplies twice a month from the main market.  She then retails the fruit from a stall next to a petrol station.

Akouvi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and make bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy 4 baskets of bananas and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il est composé femmes qui ont  après 06 cycles passés dans le programme assoir une bonne entente au sein du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même quartier et cela depuis plusieurs années. Elles font comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Mariètou (en médaillon en bas et à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 40 et mère de 03 filles. Elle est vendeuse d’articles vestimentaires : tissus, chaussures particulièrement pour femme et enfant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la capitale pour la revente chez elle et dans son voisinage. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter exclusivement des chaussures pour 65 000  Fr CFA enfant et femme pour la revente.

Avec les profits réalisés, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (nourriture, santé), et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was established December 12, 2011 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" loan association. It consists of women who went through six loan cycles and have reached a good agreement within the group. They have been living in the same neighborhood for several years. Their main activity is small retail commerce, along with farming during the rainy season.

Mrs. Marietou (seen in the insert at the bottom right) is the featured borrower for the group. She is a 40-year-old married mother of three daughters.

She sells clothing fabrics and shoes (particularly for women and children) that she buys from wholesale merchants in the capital city, for resale at her home and in the surrounding area. She has acquired a solid experience in this domain.

She intends to use the new loan to buy exclusively 65,000 CFA francs' worth of children's and women's shoes, for resale.

She will use the profits to improve her family's living conditions (nourishment, health), and increase her savings.

loans.use: buy children's and women's shoes for 65,000 CFA francs, for resale

loans.name: Adzawa

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier de casablanca, Adzawa est  âgée de 40ans,  elle est mariée  et  mère  de 1 enfant. Adzawa vend  les  pagnes et  s’approvisionne une  fois  par mois  au grand marché.  Elle  les revend à  la maison  dans son atelier. Adzawa assinam  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et  faire plus de profit
texts.en:
Adzawa is 40 years old, and lives in the Casablanca district of Lomé.  She is married and has one child.  Adzawa sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), and buys her supplies once a month from the main market.  She then retails them from the workshop in her home.

Adzawa has requested this loan in order to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 24 pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell bread.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he makes jikos (metal cooking stoves). He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of materials to make jikos. His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more stock of materials to make jikos.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es un joven que por el momento se encuentra soltero, vive con una de sus tías, con la edad de 15 años el quedo al cuido de su tía, porque su madre tuvo que viajar a trabajar a la capital del país, a su corta edad aprendió a procesar semilla de marañón para luego salir a venderla de manera ambulante, es así como Julio genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar económicamente a su tía.
Utilizará el financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de semilla de marañón al mayoreo, aprovechara el buen precio de la materia prima para que su negocio se mantenga funcionando, pues el próximo mes los costos serán mayores, espera aumentar la productividad, ampliar sus recorridos y tener mejores ganancias con las que cancelará su deuda.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando para ser independiente y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is currently single and lives with one of his aunts. At the age of 15, Julio had to look after his aunt as his mother had to travel to the country's capital city for work. At a young age, Julio learned to process cashew seeds in order to go out and sell them as a street vendor. Through this work, Julio earns an income to cover personal costs and to help his aunt. 

This loan will be used to buy cashew seeds in bulk and take advantage of the low prices of materials for his business to remain active. Next month the costs of supplies will be higher. Julio hopes to increase productivity, expand his routes for selling, and earn higher profits in order to pay off his debt.

Julio's dreams are to continue working in order to be independent and to enjoy a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds in bulk and take advantage of the low prices of materials for his business to remain active.

loans.name: Zarifbek

texts.en:
Zarifbek is an 18-year-old boy. He is future specialist of economic systems because he has applied to the Polytechnic University of Tajikistan. He is a clever boy and ended school with excellence and good marks this year. His favorite subjects are maths, computers and English. He was one of the best pupils in his school and took part successfully in all competitions. He has a lot of friends and many of them are his classmates. All his friends love and support him. 

Zarifbek lives with parents. His parents are workers and have a small income. Their income is not enough to pay for Zarifbek’s studies at the university. He is asking for a loan of 1,150 USD to pay for his studies at the university. In this way he will study at the university and realize his dream.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four women who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They sell saucepans, plastic items, maize, foodstuff, fish and second hand clothing. 

Augustina was selected as the representative of the group. The lady standing on the far left is Augustina. 

Augustina is 51 years old, married, and living with her husband and three children. She has been involved in the sale of saucepans, cooking utensils and plastic items. She has been doing this job for six years. She needs this loan to purchase saucepans, cooking utensils and plastic items and sell to customers. This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education, to pay her children's tuition fee and to reinvest the rest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase saucepans, cooking utensils and plastic items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.en:
Dilbaroy is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Dilbaroy’s husband is a builder. Dilbaroy works hard to earn money to make a living. Her children don’t work as her daughter studies at the university and her son also has applied to the university. 

Her son is a student of a course at Tajikistan State University. Dilbaroy must to pay for her son’s tuition but her salary is small. She works in a food shop as a seller. She is asking for a loan to pay for her son’s tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her son.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy est une femme très brave qui évolue dans la commercialisation des friperies. Elle est à son 4ème prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des friperies dans un marché de la commune. Elle est célibataire et prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de ses parents et les frais médicaux de ses sœurs. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Avec ce montant elle va élargir le nombre de ses employés, payer les frais de scolarité pour ensuite épargner de l’argent à coté. Amy veut avoir une boutique de denrées alimentaires. De ce fait elle pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy is a very courageous young woman who sells second-hand clothing.  This will be her fourth loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy and sell second-hand clothing at a local market.  She is single and is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of her parents and the medical expenses of her sisters.

Amy starts work at nine in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening.  This loan will enable her to increase the number of employees that she has, pay for school fees and save some money.

In the future, Amy would like to have a food shop, this would allow her to improve the standard of food that her family eats.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Milton Eli

texts.es:
Milton es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes y estadero en zona rural del municipio de Valencia.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos y pasar un buen rato.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 4 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro económico y profesional.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, licor, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio para salir adelante y encontrar un buen progreso.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio y calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Milton is a very nice person and he always has a smile for his customers who come in to his grocery store in a rural part of Valencia municipality.

Thanks to his charisma and good humour, Milton has won the hearts and recognition of those in the area who always come to his shop before others in order to buy stock and spend some time.

Every day Milton works in order to provide his four children with a better quality of life. He aspires to provide his children with a great financial and working future.

Milton is applying for a loan in order to buy stock - such as groceries, grains, fizzy drinks, fried snacks, liquors, and other consumable goods - to give his business a push forward in order to get ahead and make good progress.

Milton hopes to continue with his business, making a positive impact on the lives of his customers with good service and good quality products.

loans.use: to buy stock - such as groceries, grains, fizzy drinks, fried snacks, liquors, and other consumable goods - to stock up his business and remain active.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mise en place le 12 Décembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il est composé femmes qui ont  après 06 cycles passés dans le programme assoir une bonne entente au sein du groupe. Elles vivent dans le même quartier et cela depuis plusieurs années. Elles font comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Kadiatou (debout à l’extrême droite)  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans, mariée  et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente friperie. Qu’elle achète dans les grandes villes surtout à la capitale pour la revente par pièce dans la commune et les environs. Cette activité est renouvelée au moins une fois dans le mois. 
 
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter une balle de friperie à 85 000 Fr CFA pour la revente par pièce.

Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille d’une part et d’autre par augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was established December 12, 2011 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" loan association. It consists of women who went through six loan cycles and have reached a good agreement within the group. They have been living in the same neighborhood for several years. Their main activity is small retail commerce, along with farming during the rainy season.

Mrs. Kadiatou (standing at the far right) is the group's featured borrower. She is a 34-year-old married mother of five children, two boys and three girls. She is active in selling used clothing.

She buys in large cities, especially the capital, and resells by the piece in her municipality and the surrounding area. This activity occurs at least once a month. 

Her new loan will enable her to buy a bale of used clothing at 85,000 CFA francs to be resold by the piece.

Profits will be used to help her husband in taking care of family needs on the one hand, and on the other to increase her savings.

loans.use: buy a bale of used clothes for 85,000 CFA francs, to be resold separately

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe junto a sus padres Marian tiene dos oficios: vende leche procesada a las tiendas pero la mayor parte del tiempo lo ocupa como costurera y necesita un credito para renovar maquinaria, necesita comprar una maquina para cocer Mariana es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Mariana is single and has no children. She lives in El Alto, in a house made with adobe bricks, with her parents. Mariana has two jobs: she sells processed milk to shops; and, mostly, she works as a dressmaker. Mariana needs a loan in order to replace equipment: she needs to buy a sewing machine. Mariana is the only one in her household who has an income and so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie Madeleine est une femme qui habite dans un quartier de la ville ou se situe le  guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui s’active dans la commercialisation de l’huile de palme. Elle est à son 8ème prêt et sollicite ce montant pour aller au sud de la Casamance pour acheter de l’huile de palme qu’elle revend à ses clients dans un marché de la commune. Marie aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence  sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite disposer de son propre magasin et agrandir son volume de vente. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus pour épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Madeleine is a woman who lives in the same district of town as the field partner's office.  She is married and has children.  Marie Madeleine buys and sells palm oil.  This will be her eighth loan from the field partner, and will enable her to travel to the south of Casamance to buy palm oil which she then retails at a local market.

Marie Madeleine helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and the school fees of their children.  She starts her working day at eight in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

In the future, Marie Madeleine would like to have her own shop and increase her sales volume.  In this way, she would be able to increase her revenue, save more money and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Merlin Hemelsi

texts.es:
Merlin de 22 años de edad, es una joven soltera que estudió hasta el bachillerato, y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos.

Merlin  apoya a su padre en la siembra de granos básicos  desde  muy pequeña, además, ella es empleada de una empresa atunera, de todo que busca los medios necesarios para trabajar y salir adelante.

Ella desea ayudar a su padre con la siembra, es por ello que necesita el crédito, para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos, comprará fertilizantes, foliares y abonos para obtener excelente cosecha.

Sus sueños son tener su propio negocio y ser siempre una buena ayuda para sus padres.
texts.en:
Merlin is 22 years old. She is single and completed high school. She lives with her parents and siblings.

Merlin has been helping her father to grow basic grains since a very young age. She also has a job at a tuna business. In doing all of this, Merlin is looking for the necessary means to work and get ahead in life.

Merlin wants to help her father with his farm work and so needs this loan in order to to buy farming supplies for growing basic grains; Merlin will buy fertilisers and manure in order to reap an excellent harvest.

Merlin's dreams are to have her own business and always to be of great help to her parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for growing basic grains; Merlin will buy fertilisers and manure in order to reap an excellent harvest.

loans.name: Rosalva Carmina

texts.es:
En el interior una institución Pública, los muebles y oficinas lucen muy limpias y brillantes, el piso reluce la imagen de los visitantes. La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una institución pública.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Ella tiene 34 años de edad soltera con 2 hijos, el primero tiene doce años y es estudiante de la escuela de la comunidad y el segundo tiene un año de edad y aun no estudia.
La actividad que Rosalva realiza con tanto esmero es enfermera y trabaja como salubrista en el puesto de salud de la comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, ella siempre ha soñado con ayudar a los demás que necesitan de una asistencia médica para mejorar las condiciones de su salud.
El motivo que ha llevado a Rosalva a realizar un préstamo es para la compra de un terreno que se le está ofreciendo, ella no piensa desaprovechar esta oportunidad ya que ella quiere dejar un bonito recuerdo para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada en el futuro.
Uno de los más grandes sueños de ella es ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Inside a public institution, the furniture and offices shine brightly and cleanly, and visitors can see their reflections in the floor.  Life has given Rosalva the opportunity to work as an employee in this public institution.  This opportunity was just what she had hoped for, not only an open door but also what lay behind it.  And what she found behind that door was something that defined who she wanted to be.  

Rosalva is a 34-year-old single mother of 2.  Her first child is 12 and is studying at the community school and the second is a year old and isn't studying yet.  The job that Rosalva does with such care is nursing, and she is a healthcare worker in the health facility of the community where she lives.  She has been doing this job for 10 years, and she has always dreamed of helping others who need medical assistance to improve their health.

The reason that Rosalva is asking for a loan is to buy land that is for sale.  She doesn't intend to waste this opportunity since she wants to leave good memories for her children so that they can have adequate living conditions in the future.  One of her biggest dreams is to see her children become professionals in different fields and to improve the quality of her own life and that of her family so that they can live in adequate conditions.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
El socio Yhury pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III,el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de depósito de cerveza, él es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cerveza.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yhury is a member of the community bank Comuzone III.  He continues to work in the beer warehouse business.  Since he is a responsible and perseverant person, he is able to move forwards with his family.  

He is asking for a loan to buy beer.  He feels very grateful for the loan and he is committed to to fulfilling his quotas.

loans.use: to buy beer

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU est tailleur de profession qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans le même quartier que le guichet. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter une machine à coudre afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients et respecter les délais de ses commandes. elle a une expérience de plus de 7ans et gère toutes les charges quotidiennes et médicales de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. elle démarre sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 21h. Elle voudrait avoir un autre atelier de broderie pour diversifier et augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou is a tailor by profession and has worked in this field for more than seven years.  She is married and has children.  Fatou lives in the district where the field partner's office is located.  She has requested this loan in order to buy a sewing machine to respond to the demands of her customers, and ensure that she can complete her orders on time.

Fatou is responsible for all the day-to-day expenses, school fees and medical expenses of her family.  She works from ten in the morning until nine in the evening.

In the future, Fatou would like to have another embroidery workshop to diversify her business, increase her revenue and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to respond to the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 40-year-old man married with 5 children aged 22, 18, 12, eight and one; three of them attend school. He is a mechanic in the market dealing in fridges, he also earns from farming on a small scale. He is faced with hardships of limited capital, besides that, he hopes to expand his business to new areas. 

Robert needs a loan to buy iron sheets in order to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Rosa de 56 años de edad, logró estudiar nada mas primer grado de educación básica debido a su situación económica, ella está  acompañada, tiene una hija pero ya formó su propio hogar.

Rosa tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, labor que aprendió por una  amiga suya, anteriormente tenía una pequeña tienda, pero pensó que era mejor la ganancia en la venta de ropa, ella no tiene horario específico para salir a vender.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa para vender, comprará camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas, etc y así poder cubrir la demanda de variedad de mercadería que sus clientes necesitan.

A futuro desea tener un local instalado para vender ropa, y además le gustaría mejorar un cuarto de  habitación en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and was only able to study through the first grade due to her economic situation.  She has a partner and a daughter, but her daughter has her own home. 

Rosa has been selling clothing for fifteen years, a job that she learned from a friend.  Prior to that she had a small shop, but she thought that there would be better income in clothing.  She does not have a specific schedule for her sales. 

She needs a loan in order to buy clothes to resell.  She will purchase shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc. and in this way meet the demand for varied merchandise from her customers. 

In the future she would like to open her own shop for selling clothes, and she would also like to improve a room in her home.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foamy paper, stones for jewelry, thread, hooks and charms, broaches, etc

loans.name: Mary Ousmane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 13 décembre 2011 lors de son inauguration. Actuellement il est composé de  membres qui partagent un esprit de solidarité et d’entre aide sur tous les aspects de la vie en générale.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mary (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de cinq enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Elle fréquente un marché hebdomadaire d’un pays frontalier où elle achète de l’huile de palme. Elle y vend aussi du sel et divers bouillons culinaires. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans et la maîtrise parfaitement.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 03 sacs de sel de 25 kg, de l’huile de palme par bidon de 20 litres pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’apporter son soutient à son mari pour une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan association was established December 13, 2011 when it was inaugurated. Currently it consists of members who share a spirit of solidarity and mutual aid in all aspects of life in general. Their main activity is small retail commerce, along with agriculture during the rainy season. 

Mrs. Mary (seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower for the group. She is married with five children, three girls and two boys.

She goes to a weekly market in a neighboring country where she buys palm oil. She also sells salt and various food stocks. She has been in this business for over five years and masters it perfectly. 

She plans to use the new loan to buy three 25-kilo bags of salt, palm oil in 20-liter containers, for retail sales. 

Profits from her business activities will enable her to assist her husband in taking better care of family needs.

loans.use: buy three 25-kilo bags of salt, palm oil in 20-liter containers, for retail sales.

loans.name: Wilda Maria

texts.es: Wilda, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Negrito, Yoro.  Ella trabajaba anteriormente en una biblioteca de la comunidad y hace 3 años decidió por tener su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como ropa de segunda mano para damas, caballeros y niños y también algunos cosméticos que le piden sus clientes. Este negocio lo tiene su casa. Con el préstamo que solicita por 15,000 Lempiras va comprar 3 fardos de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, blusas y camisetas, para surtir y obtener más ingresos. Su plan es generar mayores ingresos y crecer con el negocio.
texts.en: Wilda is 39 years old and married.  She lives with her husband in the village of Negrito, Yoro.  Before, she worked in a community library, and 3 years ago she decided to open her own business selling used clothing for men, women, and children and also some cosmetics that her customers ask for.  She operates the business out of her home.  With this loan of 15,000 Lempiras, she will buy 3 bundles of used clothing, such as pants, shirts, blouses, and T-shirts, to supply her business and make better profits.  Her plan is to generate better profits and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy 3 bundles of used clothing, such as pants, shirts, blouses, and T-shirts, to supply her business

loans.name: Zouréa

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier de  Bè, Zouréa est âgée de 37ans,  elle est mariée   et mère  de       2 enfants. Zouréa  vend  le charbon de bois et s’approvisionne une fois  par mois  chez les grossistes.  Elle  les revend à la devanture de son domicile.  Zouréa  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce et réaliser plus de profit.
texts.en:
Residing in the Bè neighborhood of Lomé, Zouréa is 37 years old, married and mother of two children.

She sells charcoal and resupplies once a month from wholesalers. She resells from the front of her home.

Zouréa is requesting a loan to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 30 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, rice flour, butter, sugar, and vitamins

loans.name: Fermín Arcides

texts.es:
Fermín  de 77 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, es viudo desde hace 12 años, actualmente  vive solo con un hijo ya que los demás formaron sus propios hogares.

Él es agricultor, toda su vida ha trabajado sembrando maíz y frijol, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre, el lugar donde trabaja está a 45 minutos de su casa y se va a pie o en ocasiones en carreta, su hijo se involucra cuando puede y trabaja 6 horas diarias.


Fermín invertirá el préstamo para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivará y para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, herbicidas, entre otros. Esto le ayudará a tener a tiempo los insumos agrícolas para cultivar y tendrá una mejor producción.


Sus sueños son  seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta, desea que su hijo se supere y seguir apoyando a los que ya no están con él.
texts.en:
Fermín is 77 years old.  Because of his economic situation, he didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  He has been a widower for 12 years, and presently he lives with only one of his sons because the others have made their own homes.

He is a farmer and he has planted corn and beans for his entire life.  His father taught him how to farm.  The place where he works is 45 minutes from his house and he walks there and occasionally gets a ride in a cart.  His son helps out when he can and he works 6 hours every day.  

Fermín will use this loan to pay the rent on the land where he will plant and to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and herbicide, among other things.  This will allow him to get the agricultural inputs in time to plant and produce a better harvest.

His dreams are to continue doing work that he likes, for his son to exceed, and to continue supporting those who don't live with him anymore.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will plant and to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and herbicide, among other things

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: NOGAYE est une femme qui habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet. Elle est à son 2ème et sollicite ce dernier pour achever ses travaux de construction de sa maison. Brave et travailleuse, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de légumes et a une expérience de plus de 6ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier et renforcer son fond de roulement  et cela grâce  à l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en: Nogaye lives a few kilometres from her place of work. This will be her second loan, which she wishes to use to finish construction work on her home. An intrepid and hard-working woman, she assists her husband with their family's expenses and their children's school fees. She works as a vegetable vendor and has over six years of experience. She starts her day at 8 AM and finishes at 6 PM. In the future, she would like to diversify her stock and increase her working capital. She owes all of this to the help she receives from this institution.

loans.use: to finish construction work on her home

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 28 novembre 2003, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices  revenus. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des valeurs de solidarité qu’elles sont sues renforcer au fur et à mesure qu’elles développent leurs activités. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Mariée et mère d’un garçon, madame Christine (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. C’est une vend très enthousiasme qui mène divers activité en passant par la collecte de noix de cajous auprès des villageois, la vente de miel, d’huile de palme pour la revente. Elle a une très grande expérience dans le commerce de produits locaux.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 bidons de miel de 20 litres et le reste pour de la semence pour aider sa famille pour l’hivernage.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices assister son mari dans les tâches quotidiennes et pour le reste renforcer son épargne pour de futurs investissements.
texts.en:
Created on 28th November 2003, this banc villageois is made up of women who are very committed to the development of revenue-generating activities. They all live in the same village and uphold the values of solidarity, which they have actively reinforced throughout the process of developing their businesses. Their main businesses involve small-scale retail and seasonal rain-fed agriculture.

A married mother to one son, Christine (the woman standing on the right with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a very enthusiastic vendor who carries out various activities, such as collecting cashew nuts from the villagers, as well as selling honey and palm oil. She has a great deal of experience in selling local produce.

This new loan will allow her to purchase 15 20-litre containers of honey, with the rest of the money going towards purchasing seeds to support her family during the winter period.

She plans on using the profits from this venture to assist her husband with their daily expenses, with anything left over going into her savings for future investments.

loans.use: to purchase 15 20-litre containers of honey, with the rest of the money going towards purchasing seeds to support her family during the winter period

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Elemina

texts.en: Elemina is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells green maize, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of green maize, sugar, flour and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier of green maize within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her third loan with SMEP microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of green maize, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
El socio Saul continua brindando servicio de transporte público, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio sigue participando en el banco comunal “Conzume III” de la Asociación Arariwa, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su carro.
El socio agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Member Saul continues to provide public transportation services and is a responsible, diligent person. He is still participates in Asociación Arariwa's “Conzume III” communal bank which has helped him to move his family forward.

Saul is asking for a loan so he can buy spare parts for his car.  He is grateful to the investors for the loan he has received and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps cows, which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area good for farming. He describes his biggest business challenge to be getting pasture during drought season. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another cow. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a 34-year-old married woman who has been running business selling animals with her husband for the past 8 years. She has four cows. She also sells milk, butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  Aziz has become famous among the people of her locality and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This money will allow her to purchase one more cow. Aziz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Siprosa

texts.en: Siprosa is a widowed woman with 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will earn more profits and have better living standards.. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to increase her shoe inventory.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in a fast growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chicks within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children with her business earnings. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: buy more chickens

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards.. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a big stall within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 51-years-old married woman and a mother of 8 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Presently, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran is a 44 year old vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of five children. She has been running a hand-embroidery business for the past 10 years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand for her work is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support the family. Naziran’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Akotobu and are from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They are into fish, materials and wax-prints.  They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities trading fish, materials and wax-prints.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the ID-Ghana loan program four years ago. They are on their eighth group loan. Rose, who is the group's representative, excels in selling smoke fish and this is her third loan with kiva. She will use her loan to buy seven cartons of fish, smoke and sell to customers.

She hopes to attain a good profit, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her fish business.

loans.use: To buy seven cartons of fish, smoke  and sell to customers.

loans.name: Millie

texts.en: Millie is a married woman with 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 11 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a cyber café where she offers internet browsing, printing and other computer services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business growth and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as a low number of computers. She will use this 60,000 KES loan to buy more computers. Her business goal is to have a big cyber café that can serve customers well within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve living standards of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use her anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, 44, is a married woman; she has been buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her five children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia Elena continua con su negocio de venta de llantas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
La socia continúa perteneciendo  al banco comunal “COMUZONE III” de la Asociación Arariwa y se compromete a  pagar sus cuotas puntuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Member Elena continues with her business of selling tires which she has been doing for some time. It  has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue with this work so she can continue to support her family.

Elena is asking for a loan so she can buy tires. She still belongs to Asociación Arariwa's communal bank “COMUZONE III” and promises to make her payments on time and in a very responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 28 novembre 2003, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices  revenus. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des valeurs de solidarité qu’elles sont sues renforcer au fur et à mesure qu’elles développent leurs activités. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame  Mariama (en médaillon à gauche vers le bas), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée de 65ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons. C’est une des femmes les plus dynamiques malgré son âge avancée.  Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits selon la saison : mangues, pomme de liane et autres. Elle envoie la marchandise à sa fille pour la revente dans la capitale.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter une vingtaine de sacs de pomme de liane à 5 000 Fr le sac pour l’envoyer à sa fille à la capitale. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari à la retraite pour la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en: Created on November 28, 2003, this "banc villageois" consists of women who are very active in the development of income generating businesses.They all live in the same village and hold the same values of solidarity that developed over time as they grew their businesses.  They run small businesses as well as farm during the rainy season.  Ms. Mariama (the woman featured in the circle at the bottom left) is the representative borrower of this group.  She is 65 years old, married, and mother of six children, including two boys.  She is one of the most dynamic women despite her advanced age.  She sells fruit in season: mangoes, passionfruit, etc. She sends merchandise to her daughter for resale in the capital.  Her new loan will enable her to buy about 20 bags of passionfruit for 5,000 FCFA per bag to send to her daughter in the capital.  With the profits, she expects to support her retired husband by taking care of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy about 20 bags of passionfruit.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
Maira es una joven campesina de 23 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, que desde niña aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de plátano y yuca, actividad que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Tierra Alta. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 

Maira, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Maira is a 23-year-old farmer who is hard-working and humble and who learned how to do all sorts of farm tasks from a young age thanks to the instruction of her parents. This has allowed her to progress, and today she has plantain and yucca crops. She tends to them every day, and the harvest is sold at the Tierra Alta market. 

With the help of the loan, she will buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (manure, pesticide, fertilizer, etc.) and continue to care for her crops, resulting in a better, more productive harvest. This will lead to better income when she sells her products.

Maira, with her entrepreneurial spirit, her drive and her tenacity, wants to continue to strive towards achieving her dream of owning her own farm where she will be able to grow a greater variety of crops. This will improve her business's profitability and guarantee financial stability leading to a better quality of life for her family which consists of her husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, irrigation, and items to prepare the land to raise her crops and improve production.

loans.name: Siroj

texts.ru: Сироч родился в 1996 году. Он молодой и энергичный человек. Сироч поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Теперь он студент 1 курса и чувствует себя очень счастливым, так как сбылась его детская мечта. Он всегда хотел поступить в университет. Он окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками. Он уверен, что и в университете он будет учиться успешно. Сироч хочет стать хорошим специалистом и служит своей родине после окончания университета. Она еще не женат, и живет с родителями. Сироч запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Siroj was born in 1996. He is an energetic young man. Siroj enrolled in Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He is now a first-year student and feels really glad that his childhood dream came true. He always wanted to go to university. He graduated from secondary school with high marks. He is sure that he will be able to successfully complete university. Siroj wants to become a talented specialist and serve his country after he graduates from university. He is not yet married and lives with his parents. Siroj is requesting a loan for 800 USD to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 28 novembre 2003, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices  revenus. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des valeurs de solidarité qu’elles sont sues renforcer au fur et à mesure qu’elles développent leurs activités. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Diénaba (assise à droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère sept enfants dont trois  garçons et quatre  filles, elle est âgée  de 53 ans. Elle est vendeuse de savon de fabrication traditionnelle et de l’huile de palme. Pour se faire elle achète le savon en gros auprès de femmes productrices de même que pour l’huile de palme. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter pour un premier lot de 10 sacs de savon à 6 000 Fr CFA et 02 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 1 000 Fr CFA pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider son mari dans les tâches régaliennes.
texts.en: Created on November 28, 2003, this "banc villageois" consists of women who are very active in the development of income generating businesses.They all live in the same village and hold the same values of solidarity that developed over time as they grew their businesses.  They run small businesses as well as farm during the rainy season.  Ms. Dienaba (sitting at the right with her hand raised) is the representative borrower of this group.  She is 53 years old, married, and mother of seven children, including three boys and four girls.  She sells traditionally-made soap and palm oil. To do this, she buys the soap wholesale from female producers and the same goes for the palm oil. With her new loan, she expects to buy a first batch of 10 bags of soap for 6,000 FCFA  and two canisters of 20-kg palm oil for 1000 FCFA for retail resale.  The profits earned will enable her to increase her savings and help her husband with managing their household.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of soap and 2 canisters of 20-kg palm oil.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been dealing in selling goats for a period of about seven years. She has four children. She needs to provide them with the basic necessities of life. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to allow them to lead a decent life. 

Irshad buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has three children aged 6, 3 and 1 year old. Two are school-going children. He has three additional dependents who live with him to be fostered and help with domestic work.  

In 2012, Idrissa established his soft and hard drinks business. He began his business when he stopped at G.C. O' Level. During his schooling he was assisting his father in his business.  After schooling he worked as a security officer, and the salary and benefits he accumulated were used to establish his own drinks and provisions shop.  Working 7 days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.

Idrissa requires a loan in order to purchase crates of assorted drinks, bundles of Pure Water, and cartons of tinned milk, sardines, luncheon meat, biscuits, etc.  In the future, Idrissa plans to develop his land and provide quality education for his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase crates of assorted drinks, bundles of Pure Water,  and cartons of tinned milk, sardines, luncheon meat, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a married woman of 30 years and is the mother of one school-going son. She is a permanent resident of the village of Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district. She is a housewife. Her son reads in grade 7. Nilima studied till grade 8, but her husband is a university graduate.

Nilima's husband, Shibucharan, earns for the family by giving private tuition to the local children. His income is not satisfactory and not sufficient to bear all the expenses of the family. So Nilima is engaged in cattle breeding. She has a dairy farm. She supplies milk to the local people and to the tea stalls of a nearby town. As the family expenses are increasing day by day, their income is barely enough to run the family well.

So, to earn an extra income for the smooth maintenance of the family, Nilima is requesting a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). She will use the loan to purchase a milking cow to enhance her business. She is a hardworking woman with positive thinking, who wants to give her family a better standard of living. She hopes that this investment will help her to gain additional income to fulfill her dream of giving higher education to her only son.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk supply business.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир родился 1996 года. В 2003 году поступил в школу и в 2014 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Тюменский Государственный Университет, в юридический факультет. Данное время он является студентом 1 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек. Тохир увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает классическую литературу. Его родители занимаются скотоводством и не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tohir was born in 1996. In 2003, he began primary school and in 2014, he successfully graduated from secondary school. After graduating from secondary school, he enrolled in Tyumen State University in the Law Department. He is currently a first-year student. He is a very talented young man. Tohir enjoys sports and in his spare time, he reads classic literature. His parents practice cattle breeding and are not in a condition to pay his tuition this year. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of cement, rolls of floor mats and cartons of  locks.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Doña Arelí, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada, vive sola con su esposo en el municipio de La Másica, Atlántida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y plásticos desde hace  20 años,  esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y por pedidos, vende ropa de niños, damas, caballeros y productos plásticos como picheles, vasos, panas y otros. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas y plásticos para la venta, y poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio como su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Arelí is 55 years old, married and lives alone with her husband in the municipality of La Masica, Atlantida. She has worked selling clothes and plastics for 20 years. She works as a street vendor and also by orders. She sells children, women and men clothing, and plastic products such as mugs, glasses, bowls, and others. She has requested a loan of 10,000 lempiras to invest in buying clothes such as blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and plastics for sale. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and her income. Her goal is to keep on growing with the business as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and plastics for sale.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда разведенная женщина в возрасте 42 лет. Она одна вырастила детей. У нее их четверо, которым сейчас с 15 по 22 лет. Мавчуда со своими детьми живет в городе Душанбе. Она по профессии швея и работает в швейном цехе. На протяжении 8 лет Мавчуда шьет женские платья на заказ. Недавно одну ее дочь сосватали и она в ближайшие дни выйдет замуж. К сожалению у Мавчуды нет сбережений, которые она могла бы потратить на свадьбу дочери. Единственный выход она видит в получении кредита. Мавчуда обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет свей швейной деятельности. Она нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a 42-year-old divorced woman. She raised her children by herself. She has four children who are now between the ages of 15 and 22 years old. Mavjuda and her children lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is a seamstress by occupation an works in a sewing shop. For the past 8 years, Mavjuda has been sewing custom-made women's dresses. Recently, one of her daughters found her match and will be getting married shortly. Unfortunately, Mavjuda does not have any savings which she can spend on her daughter's wedding. The only option she saw was taking out a loan. Mavjuda promises to pay back the loan on time with the earnings from her sewing business. She relies on this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, a 42-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Fozia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Fozia’s fourth  loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Santigie.  He is married, and has four children aged 19, 15, 8, and 6 years respectively. All are school-going children.  

Santigie owns a business; he earns about SLL 4,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,250,000. Santigie requires a loan in order to purchase rolls of assorted electrical cables. He has started his building project but is unable to complete it.  The previous loan increased his business greatly.  Inadequate capital is his main challenge.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of assorted electrical cables.

loans.name: Laura Angelica

texts.es: Laura de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora se esfuerza todos los días, para llevar el aporte económico necesario a su hogar, gracias a su negocio de venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza frente a su vivienda desde hace 3 años. Laura elabora  tortillas en una cocina artesanal improvisada, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una plancha para tortillas a gas, maíz y cal para elaborar tortillas de una manera más adecuada.
texts.en: Laura, who is 31 years old, lives in her own house with her two year old daughter. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works hard every day to provide the necessary economic support for her home thanks to her tortilla selling business. She has been doing this activity out in front of her home for the past three years. Laura makes tortillas in an improvised artisanal kitchen. This is why she is requesting this credit from FUSAI, to invest in a tortilla press that uses gas, corn and lime to make tortillas in a more adequate manner.

loans.use: to invest in a tortilla press that uses gas, corn and lime

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru: 45-летняя Шарифамо мать четверых детей. У нее двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Ее муж работает бухгалтером в строительной фирме. Шарифамо начала свою швейную деятельность два года назад. Она занимается этим делом у себя дома в районе Хамадони. Шарифамо любит свою профессию. Она хочет сейчас расширить его. Дело в том, что Шарифамо шьет на старой машинке и она хочет обновить ее. На сумму от кредита она купит новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: 45-year-old Sharifamo is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an accountant in a construction company. Sharifamo started her sewing business two years ago. She runs the business out of her home in the Hamadoni region. She loves her profession and wants to expand her business by replacing her old sewing machine with a new one. With the loan amount she will be able to buy a new, modern sewing machine. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinnamon, achiote, cloves, pepper, cumin, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de fabricación y venta de velas, la socia agradece a los inversionistas que le otorgaron el crédito y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas esteblcidas,la socia continua elaborando las velas en su casa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de parafina entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner is Mrs. Elizabeth, she continues to make a living through the manufacturing and sales of candles. She thanks the investors that granted her the credit and commits herself to meeting the established payment installments. 
She continues to produce the candles in her home and wishes to continue working in this manner in order to continue supporting her family. 
She is asking for a loan to purchase paraffin among other things.

loans.use: purchase paraffin among other things

loans.name: José Alonso

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues en aquella época los padres se interesaban mas por trabajar, está casada y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 4 hijos pero todos viven en el exterior, por lo tanto solo su esposa depende de José.


Desde la edad de 15 años, su padre le inculcó a José el negocio de compra y venta de ganado, lo cual ha sido su medio de supervivencia y para el de su familia también.

Este crédito lo necesita muchísimo para comprar ganado,  de esta forma podrá comercializarlos y obtener mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es tener siempre abiertas las puertas de CrediCampo, y darle lo necesario a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 68 years old, did not have the opportunity to study because during that times parents were more interested in being able to work. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have four children, but they all live abroad so only his wife is dependent on him.

Since he was 15, his father instilled in him the cattle trading business, which has been his means for survival as well as his family's.

He really needs this credit in order to purchase cattle, which will allow him to commercialize them and obtain better incomes. 

His dream is for CrediCampo's doors to remain always open and to be able to provide for his wife's necessities.

loans.use: purchase cattle, allowing him to commercialize them and obtain better incomes

loans.name: Hassanatu S.

texts.en: This is 20 year old Hassanatu S.  She is married and has no children.  Hassanatu S. owns a  business which earns about 900,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy a carton of touch lights batteries, black mints, butter, sweets, biscuits, Peak, milk and bundles of Pure Water. She was unable to achieve her future plans but there is great improvement in her business.  She still has plans to open a shop.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a carton of touch lights batteries, black mints, butter, sweets, biscuits, Peak, milk and bundles of Pure Water.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, age 40, is a married woman. 

She has been doing business selling fruit for many years. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling fruit and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother and is responsible for providing her family with food, health and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. 

She is in her 11th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas.

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
Anwari is a 52 year old, married woman. She has been providing cooking services from her home. 

Anwari enjoys making food and has become famous in her town for providing these facilities. She makes enough to lead a decent life. She takes orders from nearby hotels and people in her community. 

Anwari is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a stock of flour, rice, grains, oil and baking powder at lower rates from the market. It would enable her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more cash. 

Anwari wishes to utilize her earned profit for her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of flour, rice, grains, oil and baking powder.

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Momoh.  He is married, and has one child, age 3, a school-going child. He has one additional dependent, who lives with his younger brother, to be fostered.  

In 2012 Momoh established his drinks, milk, baby food, batteries, sardines, toothpaste, pure water, etc. business. He began his business because he worked on a contract basis and after his contract ended, he decided to open a shop with the salary he saved. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,080,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Momoh requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of hair cream, batteries, sweets, milk, crates of soft drinks and bundles of pure water. 

In the future, Momoh plans to expand the business, start his building project, and educate his child.  Inadequate capital is his main challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of hair cream, batteries, sweets, milk, crates of soft drinks and bundles of pure water.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru:
Рустамчон молодой мужчина в возрасте 30 лет, он женат и имеет двоих детей. Рустамчон является студентом Таджикского Государственного Университета и обучается на 4 курсе юридического факультета. Рустамчон говорить, что учиться сложно без компьютера так, как ему приходиться часто сталкиваться с работой в которой без компьютера не обойтись.  
Рустамчон обратился в "АРВАНД" за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы купить себе ноутбук, который ему так необходим в учебе. Благодаря купленному ноутбуку его учеба существенно изменится и ему станет намного проще учиться. Ведь он сможет находясь дома готовить и печатать рефераты, подготавливаться к экзаменам и многое другое. Рустамчон заранее благодарит организацию за предоставление таких кредитов которые помогают студентам и школьникам в учебе.
texts.en:
Rustamjon is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and has two children. Rustamjon is a student at Tajik State University and is in his fourth year of study in the Law Department. Rustamjon says that studying is difficult without a computer because he frequently runs into problems having to do work which cannot be done without a computer.

Rustamjon turned to "ARVAND" for financial support in order to buy himself a laptop which he needs for his studies. Thanks to the purchased laptop, his studies will completely change and it will become a lot easier for him to get his work done. In fact, he will be able to stay at home to prepare and type reports, study for exams and many other activities. Rustamjon thanks this organization in advance for offering these kinds of loans which help university and secondary school students with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add an M-pesa float for mobile phone money transfers.

loans.name: Akim

texts.en:
Akim is a new client to the organization and has secured a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. He is married with 6 children, with 4 attending school. He carries out cattle fattening as his major source of income, which he has done for a period of ten years. 

Akim depended on his business for all his financial needs but later he found out that his business alone could not meet all of his financial needs. Akim will use the loan to buy more cows. Akim praises Ugafode for the financial assistance which he hopes will enable him to educate his children and maintain his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 39-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for many years. At present, she has one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has seven children; she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her ninth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings, and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, age 35, is a married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.
