With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 55-year-old woman. She has two children; one of her sons (also shown in the photo) is running a butcher shop. He sells the meat of goats and hens to many of their neighbors and other community members.  

For the improvement of her son’s business, Nasreen has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase animals, along with some cutters. 

Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase animals along with some cutters.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.ru: Баходиру 22 года. Он студент 4 курса Российского Нового Университета. Он очень трудолюбивый и успешный студент. В свободное время он увлекается спортом и компьютерными играми. Его родители простые рабочие. Доход его родителей не позволяет оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу доброту. В будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Bahodir is 22 years old. He is a fourth-year student at the New Russian University. He is a very hardworking and successful student. In his free time, he enjoys sports and computer games. His parents are simple workers. His parent's income does not allow them to pay for his studies at university. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness. In the future, he dreams of becoming a renowned specialist.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Kadiatu Rackson

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Kadiatu Rackson.  She is married, and has 3 children ages 30, 26, and 23. She has three additional dependents who live with her to be fostered and domestic work.  

In 2011, Kadiatu Rackson established her provision - soft drinks, milk, tea leaves, mayonnaise, cigarettes, etc. business.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,954,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Kadiatu Rackson has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of assorted provisions. 

Her business did well, and she now sells on wholesale and retail sales to customers; she is also a supplier.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of assorted provisions.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Kadie.  She is married, and has 3 children, ages 13, 9 and an 11-month-old baby.  Two are school-going children. 

In 2005, Kadie established her food stuff business - rice, vegetable oil, salt.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,853,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Kadie requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of Maggi, milk, and other food stuff. 

In the future, Kadie’s main focus is to maintain and improve her existing business, and acquire a piece of land. Kadie's previous future plan was to improve her social status.  She bought a refrigerator and operate an additional business (snacks); her business has improved and has secured her financial status.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of Maggi, milk, and other food stuff.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, age 29, is a married woman. She always wanted to educate children in need. She and her husband have been running the school for four years. 

A year ago, they moved to a new, larger building. Asia feels her school's greatest strength is its focus on management, planning, and investing in teachers. 

Asia needs help for the completion of construction and repair of the new school building to provide a good learning environment for her students. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to complete the construction and repair of the new school building

loans.name: Xiomara De La Paz

texts.es:
Xiomara, posee un negocio de crianza de cerdos y ganado, así como también práctica el cultivo de granos básicos, es una actividad que heredo de sus padres, lo desempeña desde hace 6 años con apoyo de su esposo e hijos, en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. para tener una fuente de ingresos con la que subsiste su familia, la ventaja es que no invierte en pago de mano de obra. Xiomara es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad por sus diferentes actividades económicas que realiza; vive actualmente con su compañero de vida y tres hijos de 10, 8 y 5 años de edad.
Utilizará el capital para comprar concentrado para cerdos e insumos agrícolas, le será de ayuda para tener un negocio más rentable, ya que de esta manera alimentara bien a los cerdos y los venderá a mejor precio, podrá dar un mejor desarrollo a sus cultivos, los riesgos son las enfermedades que pueden contraer sus animales y los cambios de clima. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para cumplir con los compromisos que tiene.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando para tener un futuro con mejores condiciones de vida para su persona y su familia, así como también tener un negocio productivo que heredara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara has a business raising pigs and cattle and she also grows basic grains. This activity she inherited from her parents and she has done it for 6 years with the help of her husband and children. She works from 7 am until 3 pm so that she can have a source of income to support her family. The advantage is that she doesn't have to pay for labor.

Xiomara is a person well-known in her community for the different economic activities she does. She lives in company of her life companion and three children aged 5, 8 and 10 years old. She will use the capital to buy concentrated feed for pigs and agricultural supplies which will help the business to be more profitable. By dong this she can feed the pigs well and sell them at a higher price. She can also promote better development for her crops. Her risks are the sicknesses that can affect the animals and the changes in climate. She hopes to increase her profits to meet the compromises she has. Her dream is to be able to continue to work to have a future with better living conditions for herself and her family. She also wants to leave a productive business as inheritance for her children

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for pigs and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Alimamy M. Z.

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Alimamy M.Z.  He is married and has two children, age 7 and 4 years, and both are school-going children. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help in the business.  

In 2010, Alimamy M.Z. established his clothes business for men and women: jeans, lacoste, crepe, bags, and shoes. He began his business because he stopped school at secondary level, and after he left school, his mother gave him some money to start his own business by selling used clothes and trousers. This later changed to a boutique.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 3,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Alimamy M.Z. requires a loan in order to buy dozens of men's and women's wears such as trousers, blouses, shirts, coats, crepe, shoes, etc. 

In the future, Alimamy M.Z. plans to complete his building project, provide quality education for his children, reinvest and expand his business. The loan will help him achieve his dreams. His major challenge is lack of enough capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Alpha M.

texts.en: This is 28 year old Alpha M.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 5 who go to school. He has 2 additional dependants who live with him to help in the business.  In 2005, Alpha M. established his phones accessories, creams, perfume, Shelltox, soap, batteries, etc. business. He began his business because he stopped school at the primary level due to lack of financial support from his parents.  After dropping out of school, he started doing diamond work and the money he saved was used to start his own business of selling phone accessories, cosmetics and electronics.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month. He would like a loan in the amount 5,000,000 SLL in order to purchase dozens of phone changers, batteries, cartons of radios, extensions, torch light, cream, etc. In the future, Alpha M. plans to buy another motor bike, complete his building project, and reinvest and expand his business. Delay in payment from debtors and sometimes expired goods are his main challenges.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of phone changers, batteries, cartons of radios, extensions, torch lights, cream, etc.

loans.name: Umarr

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Umarr.  He is married, and has 1 child, age 5 years, who is a school-going child. 

In 2012, Umarr established his assorted sized tires (new and used) business. He began his business because he dropped at Senior Secondary level and joined his elder brother in his tire business.  He was doing it on commission, and the accumulated sum was used to start his business.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Umarr requires a loan in order to purchase different types of tires, both used and new ones. 

In the future, Umarr plans to purchase a piece of land, provide a quality education for his child, reinvest, and expand his business. His major challenge is inadequate capital.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of tires, both used and new ones.

loans.name: Runi

texts.en:
Runi, 26 years old, is a mother of three who lives in the remote village of Kathalbari in the Jalpaiguri district. Her family comprises her husband, Makbul, and three children (two sons and one daughter). Runi and her husband both were deprived of education because of their parental poverty, but they are providing education to their children who are in grade 1, grade 2 and grade 6, respectively.

Runi's husband is engaged as a fish vendor. He purchases fishes from the village fishermen and sells in the local market. His income is hardly sufficient for the family of five members. Due to lack of capital, he is unable to invest much money in his business.

To meet the school expenses of her children Runi has been rearing cattle for a few years. She rears milking cows and her primary income source comes from selling milk. She ventured into the dairy business because milk is very much in demand in her region. 

She wants to purchase another dairy cow, so she has taken a loan from BJS. With the additional cow, she will start a business making milk products like butter, curd, cottage cheese, etc. along with her milk selling business. 

She is really focused on her farm activities, and through the loan, she will be able to completely turn her life around and realize more income to pay her children's school fees as her children are her first priority. She wants to see them established with good education.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children and pensioner parents-in-law in Terjola district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have pigs and also they grow maize and nut trees on the family owned agricultural land. They sell the harvested products. Along the agricultural activities, Mzia trades clothes. She is a very hardworking woman and does her best to improve the living conditions of her family. 

Mzia decide to start a husbandry business and requested a loan for purchasing two milk cows. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,200 Gel. 

As the cows are purchased, Mzia will start producing dairy products to sell and increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Kadiatu A.

texts.en: This is 32 year old Kadiatu A.  She is married and has 2 children, one aged 5 who goes to school and 1 year old baby. She has 2 additional dependants who live with her to be fostered. Kadiatu A owns a  business where she earns about 2,800,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy a dozen set of pans, coolmans, drinking rubbers, bathing buckets, plates and spoons. From her previous loan's profits, she has started her building project and paid her children's school fees.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a dozen of set pans, coolmans, drinking rubbers, bathing buckets, plates and spoons.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 34 years old. She is divorced and lives with her school-aged daughter. Elza works at a local bakery and gets a small monthly income, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. 

She decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $600 to start a trading business. She will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and will resell them at higher prices to increase the family income. With increased income, she will provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to begin a clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a client in the institution who has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX. His major source of income is agriculture production and the sale of agro-inputs which he has done for fifteen years. His major challenge is limited capital which affects his production. Andrew joined UGAFODE to access financial support and expand his project and earn more income. He applied for this loan to buy more seedlings to expand his project. He also wants to set up another green house so as to meet the demand available in the area. Andrew’s dream is to become a model in the area. Andrew thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance it extends to him, which has enabled him to educate his children and start up this project which earns him income

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Kahramonjon

texts.ru: Кахрамончону 57 лет. Это жизнерадостный трудолюбивый мужчина , который на протяжении всей своей жизни работая не покладая рук старается создать хорошие жизненные условия для своей семьи. Сначала в родительской а потом создав свою семью.   Он женат имеет двоих детей.  На протяжении более 20 лет он занимается пчеловодством. Это его основной источник заработка. Применяя свой опыт по пчеловодству он достиг наилучших результатов. Для усовершенствования своей пасеки  Кахрамончон хочет взять кредит и так как раньше он брал кредит в "Арванде.  он обратился в Арванд  за советом и помощью. Получив кредит он хочет  обновить  старые улья и приобрести новые и тем самым увеличить производительность своей пасеки.
texts.en: Kahramonjon is 57 years old. He is a cheerful, hardworking man who has spent his entire life with his nose to the grindstone in order to create good living conditions for his family. He worked this hard first for his parents and then for his own family. He is married and has two children. For more than 20 years, he has been practicing beekeeping. This is his main source of income. Applying his beekeeping experience, he has accomplished the very best results. Kahramonjon wants to take out a loan to develop his beehives. He has taken out a loan from Arvand in the past. He turned to Arvand both for advice and for assistance. With the acquired loan, he wants to replace his old beehives and buy new ones. This, in turn, will increase the productivity of his beehives.

loans.use: to buy new beehives for his beekeeping business

loans.name: Sameshwari

texts.en:
Sameshwari is a 50-year-old hardworking entrepreneur from Maynaguri. She is married and a mother of two grown sons. She is an illiterate woman who can sign her name only. Her parents could not afford education for her due to poverty. She lives with her sons and husband, Damanshu, 55 years old, in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.

Sameshwari’s husband and sons are engaged in land cultivation. They grow seasonal vegetables on their farmland. Their earning is inadequate for the family expenses. Sameshwari is responsible, goal-driven and considerate. To help her husband to run the family well, she has been engaged in a milk-selling business. Initially, she started the business with the purchase of one cow. Then she started supplying milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients. Now this business is the main source of income for the family. She wants to develop her milk production business to cope with the financial situation since the price of everything is going up. She wants to purchase one more cow. Thus, she will be able to supply more milk to earn more profit,

With this aim, she has asked for financial help from BJS to purchase a cow. She hopes the earnings from the business will bring financial sustenance for her family to give them a smooth life.

Sameshwari thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a serger and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ganshanga

texts.en:
Ganshanga is a repeat client of the institution and he took a loan of UGX 5,000,000. He is married and blessed with five children, three of whom are attending school. He hails from a village in Western Rukungiri municipality. 

He has a stationery business in Rukungiri municipality. His main challenges have been limited capital and competition. He has a dream of expanding his business to greater heights. With this loan from UGAFODE, Ganshanga is hopeful that his business will improve, since it will give him enough capital to compete favorably in the market. He therefore appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance rendered to him.

loans.use: To buy stationery to sell.

loans.name: Sati

texts.en:
Sati is a 34-year-old housewife who is married to Akhil and lives in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district. She is blessed with one son and one daughter. Her son is a student of grade 12, and her daughter is in grade 10. They live in Khagrabari, Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She passed grade 4 and could not continue because of the poor economic resources of her family.

Her husband keeps himself busy in a stall selling "pani puri" — a popular street snack. It consists of a round hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with flavored water. In the Bengali language it is called "phuchka."

Sati works hard and manages the household work until night. She prepares "pani puri" at home and her husband sells it to different places in their villages. As their "phuchka" is in great demand in her area, Sati wishes to expand the business by purchasing different kinds of essential ingredients such as flour, tamarind, chilli, chat masala, peas, potatoes, etc., to prepare more "phuchka." She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more ingredients to increase their business, which will enable her to make the business run smoothly.

In the future, Sati wishes to get ahead with their existing business, as it is a profitable one. She also dreams of giving a better education to her children for a better future.

Sati is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to make pani puri for her husband's business.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат все еще не замужем, ей 51 год. Она проживает в районе Кубадиён. Адолат сейчас решила открыть собственное дело. Она хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Для этого у нее созданы все условия. Адолат просит кредит  размере 2000 долларов США для купли скотов. У нее имеется 20% сбережения из запрашиваемой суммы. Адолат планирует откармливать скот в течение 30-35 дней и затем продать на близлежащем скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. Этот кредит поможет ей осуществить планы и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Adolat is still unmarried. She is 51 years old. She lives in the Qubadiyon District. Adolat has now decided to open her own business. She wants to start a business in the sphere of livestock breeding. She has all of the necessary conditions for this. Adolat is requesting a loan for 2000 USD to buy cattle. She has 400 USD already in savings. Adolat plans to fatten up the cattle of the course of 30 - 35 days and then resell them at a nearby cattle market for a profitable price. This loan will allow her to realize her plans and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy several cows to start her business.

loans.name: Anselm

texts.en:
Anselm is a married man with five children, three of whom are attending school. He is an old client at the branch. 

He operates a retail shop as his major source of income. He has operated it for a period of five years. His major challenge is limited capital to purchase a variety of goods for his customers. He is therefore taking a loan of UGX.3,000,000 to overcome this challenge.

He decided to join UGAFODE and access financial assistance to boost his business and increase his earnings to be able to meet all his financial needs.

Anselm thanks UGAFODE for financial assistance, which has enabled him to expand his business and educate his children. Anselm also thanks UGAFODE for improving his status in the community.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, corn, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused, determined and self-disciplined. 

She operates a retail business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has 2 children, ages 7 and 5 years.  They both are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to assist in the business. 

Abdul owns a used clothing business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bales of used clothing and trousers.  

He was able to build a house for his family, but unfortunately during the loan process he lost a child.   

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing and trousers.

loans.name: Sandhyarani

texts.en:
Sandhyarani is a 46-year-old woman from Maynaguri. She lives in a small village in Maynaguri, in the Jalpaiguri district. She is uneducated and did not get the opportunity to study in her childhood. She is a responsible mother of three sons. Two of them are students and one is a fish vendor in a local market.

Her husband, Ramkrishna, (48 years old) is a cycle-van driver by profession. He has been driving a cycle-van for many years. It is a cycle operated transport to carry loads and people. It is widely used in rural areas of West Bengal, where people can't afford other vehicles. 

For many days now his cycle-van has not been working properly, even with regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. As this is the main source of income, he is unable to cover all the expenses for the family.

He wants to buy a new cycle-van to generate more income. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost.

Therefore, Sandhyarani has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to help her husband cover the cost of a new cycle-van. This will help him to continue his business and earn for the family's well being. She wants to save enough money to provide higher studies to her sons.

Sandhyarani is very thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a new cycle-van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati hails from Maynaguri. She is 22 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their only daughter in the remote village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Mithu, who is a 30-year-old farmer. Neither Saraswati nor her husband could complete secondary education. Their daughter is too young for school.

Here, where they live, the residents work in agriculture, producing mainly rice. The climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation.

Saraswati's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows rice. He plants and grows good quality paddy rice. He has many years of experience in this line of work. He has very good personal references for his moral character and behavior, and he sells good quality rice at a cheaper price compared to other sellers. That's why his customers like him. Saraswati, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities.

Saraswati wants this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in her husband's business. She wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers and grow good quality paddy rice so that her products will be the best quality, and therefore she can sell them to her valued customers. This will enable her to generate more income and better profits so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

She aspires to buy a tractor in the future with the additional profit to facilitate their cultivation process.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
En Suchitepéquez existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente. Josefina mujer de 55 años de edad  tiene tres hijos el primero ya tiene familia aparte y los dos últimos son estudiantes en la comunidad donde viven.
Ella  se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Josefina lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio. Ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 25 años y le ha generado muy buena ganancia para ella y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
El uso respectivo que ella dará al préstamo es para la compra de más mercadería para tener surtido su tiene de abarrotería para no perder la clientela ya que para ella es muy importante porque por medio de ello puede tener un ingreso económico par el sostenimiento de su familia.
Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos y es uno de los más grandes sueños de Josefina.
texts.en:
In Suchitepéquez there are a variety of businesses where the people can choose to buy their daily necessities. What is important is not the amount of consumption but the quality of service given to the client. Josefina is a 55 year old woman who has three children. The oldest already has his own family and the other two study in their community. She has been dedicated to serving the public with high quality service through her grocery store. You need a special calling for this and Josefina has it as as she is one of the most sought after businesses.

She has been running her business for 25 years and she has generated a good income for herself and her family to improve their living conditions. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her grocery store so as not to lose clients. This is important to her because this is the means for her to have economic income to sustain her family. Two things motivated her to request the loan: to expand her grocery store business by the quantity of clients who need it and her need to construct a house for her two children. This is one of Josefina's biggest dreams.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, bricks and wood to build a bathroom with a washbasin and toilet in her home.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: 44-летняя Фазилат повторно обратилась за кредитом на образование. Ее старшая дочь успешно окончила второй курс и  в этом году перешла на третий курс. Она будущий врач и учится в данный момент в Государственном Медицинском Университете. Фазилат снова берет кредит, чтобы оплатить контракт дочери. На этот раз она берет 1300 долларов США, которые пойдут на оплату контракта, а также частично для купли учебных принадлежностей. Фазилат благодарит кредиторов Kiva за то, что они профинансировали ее предыдущий кредит. Она и в этот раз надеется на их поддержку.
texts.en: Fazilat, who is 44 years old, is applying for the second time for a loan for education expenses. Her oldest daughter successfully completed her second year and is now in her third year of studies. She is a future doctor and is currently studying at the State Medical University. Fazilat is taking out a loan again to pay for her daughter's tuition. This time, she is taking out a 1300 USD loan which will cover her daughter's tuition. A part of the loan will also be used to buy materials for school.  Fazilat thanks Kiva lenders for financing her previous loan. She relies on your support again this time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson used his previous loan to buy land for farming. He wants a loan to buy tea seedlings to expand his farm. The 48 year old, hardworking man lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He still has challenges of unpredictable seasonal changes. His dream is to own at least forty acres of tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings to expand his farm.

loans.name: Godoberta

texts.en:
Godoberta is 60 years old. Godoberta personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 10,000 PHP for the purchase of new nets. As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chance of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard the fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Aphia

texts.en:
Aphia is a 34-year-old female, married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She used the previous loan to buy biscuits and sugar to sell. 

Aphia is a farmer dealing in tomatoes and rice, also does animal rearing as additional income. She began the farming business to supplement her income from the retail shop, which will enable her to get high profits. 

Aphia wants money to buy fertilizer to increase productivity, and also to pay for labor, hence boosting her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity and to pay for labor

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 23-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda who used the previous loan to pay workers who are helping him in harvesting tea to sell. 

He is a tea farmer, but faces challenges of price fluctuations and weather changes (drought); however he hopes to build a permanent house. 

Micheal needs a loan to rent tea plantations and improve the old ones.

loans.use: to rent a tea plantation and improve the old ones.

loans.name: Milena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milena, de 37 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a sacar adelante a su hijo de 3 años y darle una vida plena.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como cremas de manos, lociones, desodorantes, gel, entre otros. Productos que vende desde su propia casa con una pequeña vitrina para exhibirlos.


Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su hijo.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de lociones, cremas de manos y desodorantes y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Milena is 37 years old and is very clear about what she wants in life. This is getting her 3 year old daughter ahead and providing her with a full life. She works selling a variety of merchandise such as hand cream, lotions, deodorant, gels amongst others. She sells these from her own home where she has a small display to exhibit them. She started this business with the urge to find the necessary resources to sustain herself and her daughter.

She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman. She is requesting a loan to buy a substantial stock of lotions, hand cream and deodorant. By doing this she will have inventory on hand to sell to her clients and improve her income. She hopes to be able to progress as a businessperson and have more stable income so that her family does not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy stock like lotions, hand cream and deodorant to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 59 years old. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with her son and pensioner mother. Anzhela works as a hair stylist at a local beauty salon and gets a small monthly income. 

She decided to get additional income and rent out her flat, where nobody lives, but she needs money to renovate the flat. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $3,000 to renovate a flat. 

As the flat is renovated, she will rent it out and will get additional and stable income to improve her family's living conditions. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out to get additional income

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: Alicia de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que además de prestar sus servicios domésticos, se desempeña como empleada de atención al cliente en un mini súper, en donde se encarga de atender a las personas y proveerles de los productos que solicitan, además su esposo labora en una fábrica de textiles, y es gracias a ello que mantienen la economía familiar. Alicia desea cambiar las láminas del corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: láminas galvanizadas, para cambiar el techo del corredor.
texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 19-year-old daughter. She is a hard-working woman who as well as doing domestic work also works as a customer service assistant in a mini supermarket, where she is responsible for serving people and providing them with the products they are looking for. In addition, her husband works in a textile factory, and it is thanks to this that they are able to provide the family finances.

Alicia wants to replace the sheets on the corridor of her home, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheets, to change the corridor roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets to change the corridor roof.

loans.name: Joniel

texts.en:
Joniel believes education is a key to succeed in life. He wants to earn a degree and become a successful engineer. He wants to help his family and his siblings to finish their education also. 

With the loan of Php 5,000, he will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs. He is about to finish his course, but would need to fully pay the school fees. He has asked his father to support his much needed loan. 

Joniel sees himself to be in a position to help others, too, in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, 53, is married with three adult age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. 

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. 

She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already took loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from Usocan, Plaridel. She is 58 years of age. She and her partner have 3 school age kids. 

This year, 2014, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. In her desire to help the family, she engaged in selling fish in different barangays in Plaridel.  Her source of income has existed for 2 years now. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC for the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase and/or have more income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority in spite of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius age 36 years and is married with four children. He is dealing in general merchandise, especially the sale of corn flour. He supplies it to schools and companies, having started the business to have a clear source of income. In addition to the general merchandize business, Julius does coffee selling to supplement his income to cater to his family's needs. He does business from his rural area of Kyamuhunga, Bushenyi District, and his clients are all categories of people.  

Julius has applied for a loan of shs 5,000,000 (Five million shillings only) to buy a stock of corn flour in preparation for the back to school season so that he can have enough supply for his customers.  

He is a very hardworking man, working 12 hours a day and 6 days a week, which has helped him greatly to thrive in the market despite the stiff competition he faces from other business people of the same category. However, he hopes to make more profits after buying more merchandise for trade using the loan money, boost his business, and in the long run fulfill his dreams of being financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize flour

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is 62 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 9 children.

Hipolito owns a jeep for his transportation business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for renewal of his licenses and certificate of registration.

He has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Hipolito hopes to have an additional jeep someday.

loans.use: for renewal of licenses and certificate of registration

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married with 5 children. Lily is 59 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lily cares for pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested for additional working capital to buy additonal piglets and feed.

Lily has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lily hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: buy additonal piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом 24 летний молодой предприниматель из северного города Худжанд. Он женат и с женой живет у родителей, также с ними живет его младший брат. Илхом очень ответственный, трудолюбивый и честный человек. Его личные качества помогают ему в работе. Он около трех лет занимается изготовлением шашлыка. Данная деятельность помогает ему обеспечивать семью. Илхом видит много трудностей в процессе работы из-за отсутствия мясорубки и просит ему помочь купить мясорубку. Он накопил денег, но сбережений не хватает ему приобрести оборудование, он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ilhom is a 24-year-old entrepreneur from the northern town of Khujand. He is married and lives with his wife and his parents, and his younger brother. Ilhom is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person. His personality traits help him in his work. He has been involved in preparing kebabs for about three years. This business helps him to provide for his family. Ilhom experiences a lot of difficulties in his work process due to the lack of a meat grinder and is asking to help him purchase one. He saved money, but his savings are not enough to buy the equipment, and he hopes for Your support.

loans.use: to purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieto, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes que la buscan por la variedad de productos y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos para su tienda como: sopas, huevos, leche en polvo, granos básicos, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder continuar con su negocio que le genera buenos ingresos y tener junto con su nieto una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her grandson. For several years she has had a small shop in her home. She has a lot of customers who come to her because of her range of products and her good prices.  She is able to get on in life with what she makes from her sales.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy more products for her shop such as soups, eggs, powdered milk, basic grains etc., all wholesale, so she can continue with her business, which gives her a good income, and so she and her grandson can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, powdered milk, basic grains etc., all wholesale.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
From Plaridel, Agripina earns a living through her sewing machine business. 

She sees that she has enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase another sewing machine set. 

Agripina hopes to live comfortably with her children until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine set.

loans.name: Virgelia

texts.en:
Virgelia is married with 2 children. Virgelia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Virgelia is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. Virgelia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

In the future, Virgelia hopes to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Bakhtovar

texts.ru:
Бахтовар еще не женатый молодой житель района Хуросон, которому в этом году исполнилось 26 лет. Он студент Государственного коммерческого университета Таджикистана и в этом году он перешел на пятый курс. Бахтовар учится по специальности бухгалтерский учет и в будущем планирует сделать карьеру именно в этом направлении. Сейчас Бахтовар одновременно занимается собственным делом - животноводством.
Бахтовар в этом году еще не внес оплату за годовой контракт. Он нуждается в 800 долларах США и поэтому просит эту сумму в кредит. Бахтовар надеется, что ему окажут финансовую поддержку и он сможет продолжить учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Bakhtovar is a single young resident of the Khuroson district and turned 26 years old this year. He is a student of the Tajikistan State Commercial University and started his fifth year there. Bakhtovar is studying accounting and planning to make his career specifically in this field. Now Bakhtovar is concurrently involved in this own business - animal husbandry. Bakhtovar has not yet paid his annual tuition this year. He needs 800 US dollars and is requesting this amount as a loan. Bakhtovar hopes that he will be provided with financial support to enable him to continue his studies in the university.

loans.use: to pay for his annual university tuition

loans.name: Franklin Ronys

texts.es: Franklin, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 1 hijo, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro. El se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, cultivaba maíz y frijol para vender ahora tiene la siembra y producción de café como su fuente de ingresos. El café lo vende en grano en la misma zona. El  préstamo que solicita es de 5,000 lempiras para la compra de abonos para aplicarle a su finca y mejorar la cosecha. Su meta es crecer como productor, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia, y sembrar más café para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Franklin is 35 years old and lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has a son. He lives in a village in the district of Victoria, Yoro. He has worked in agriculture for 20 years. He used to grow corn and beans to sell but now that he grows coffee plants, coffee production is his source of income. He sells his coffee locally as beans.

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to buy manure to apply to his farm and so improve the harvest. His goal is to become a bigger producer, to improve his family's living conditions and to plant more coffee to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy manure to put on his coffee farm in order to increase the yield.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.ru:
Зарнигор жительница района Гиссар начинает новый бизнес. Она по профессии акушер и работает в этой должности в родильном доме на протяжении двух лет. Зарнигор в возрасте 28 лет хочет параллельно начать бизнес по животноводству. Для этого бизнеса у нее созданы все условия. Зарнигор планирует вместе с сестрой разводить крупнорогатый скот. На сумму кредита Зарнигор купит дойную корову вместе с теленком. Она будет ухаживать за ними и каждый день полученное молоко будет продавать соседям и близко расположенным жителям.
Зарнигор еще не замужняя девушка. Она живет вместе с сестрой в районе Гиссар. Зарнигор шустрая и целеустремленная девушка. Она хочет с помощью нового бизнеса открыть дополнительный источник дохода и улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en: Zarnigor is a resident of the Gissar district and starting a new business. She is an obstetrician by profession and has been working at a birthing center for two years. Zarnigor, at her age of 28, wants to concurrently start an animal husbandry business. She created all of the needed conditions for this business. Zarnigor and her sister plan to raise cattle. Zarnigor will use this loan to buy a dairy cow with a calf. She will take care of them and sell obtained milk to neighbors and nearby residents. Zarnigor is still single. She lives with her sister in the Gissar district. Zarnigor is a nimble and goal-oriented young woman. She wants to create an additional source of income with the help of the new business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with a calf in order to start her own business

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y por esa razón cosechas los mejores productos, cuando ya esta lista la cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Doña Milagro esta solicitando un crédito para la  compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y poder tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagro, 50, lives in her own home with her son.  She works in agriculture, growing corn, and has been in the trade for several years, therefore harvesting the best crops.  When harvest time comes the produce is stored in silos like those shown in the photograph.  Later Milagro goes out to sell it at different markets around where she lives.  

Milagro is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, insecticides, herbicides, etc. to continue her crop growing activity and lead a better quality lifestyle together with her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is from Usokan, Plaridel. She is 52 years of age. She and her partner have 3 school-age kids. This year, 2014, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. 

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in selling fish in different barangays (small villages) in the municipality of Plaridel. Only her motorcycle was used as her source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. This has been her source of income for 2 years now. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase and/or have more income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority in her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for selling

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida todos los días elaborando tortillas y almuerzos, además aprovechando la clientela vende pupusas y es gracias a ello que obtiene un ingreso extra, para la economía de su hogar. Felipa desea encementar un cuarto y comprar lamina para cambiar el techo un cuarto de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para encementar el piso y cambiar las laminas de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Felipa is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She is an entrepreneurial woman that earns a living making tortillas and lunches. She also sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) to earn an extra income for her family. Felipa wishes to cement the floor and buy sheets to change the ceiling in one of the rooms in her home. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheets, dimension lumber and pins.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheets, dimension lumber and pins to cement the floor and change the ceiling sheets in one of the rooms in her home.

loans.name: Santigie S.

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Santigie S.  He is married, and has four children aged 17, 13, 11 and 8 years. All are school-going children. 

In 2003, Santigie S. established his construction materials business, with roofing nails, wire nails, evostic, paint, staples, inches, paint brushes, etc. Working seven days a week and twleve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Santigie has already received and successfully repaid two loans , and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of roofing nails, wire nails, staple inches, lockers, and dozens of assorted-size paint brushes. In the future, Santigie plans to expand the business, acquire subsequent loans, and provide quality education for his children. Small capital is his main challenge.    He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of roofing nails, wire nails, staple inches, lockers, and dozens of assorted-size paint brushes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her baby. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dozens of jeans, polo shirts, body cream, vaseline, and cartons of form surf.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha de 30 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella.


 Martha se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote, ya tiene varios años realizando esta actividad, ella vende los tamales en una terminal de buses, dos de sus hijos le ayudan y su pareja también, de modo que se unen para salir adelante.

Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprará una mayor cantidad de elotes para elaborar tamales, ya que la demanda de sus clientes ha incrementado y por eso quiere incrementar la venta.

Su sueño es tener muchos clientes y tener fuerzas para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, 30, is married and her husband works as a bricklayer.  She has three dependent children and works selling corn tamales, having been in business for several years.  She sells her products at the bus station with the help of two of her children and her husband.  They work together to get ahead.

Martha is in need of a loan to invest in her business.  She wants to buy greater amounts of corn to attend to the increase in customer demand.

Her goal is to have many customers and to have the strength to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy greater amounts of corn to make tamales.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a Oaxacan artisan who specializes in traditional handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories. He would like to invest in hiring local artisans to help him, as well as in a bulk purchase of wool and wood.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I am the fourth generation in a family dedicated to Zapotec weavings. I remember as a child watching my father working on the loom while my mother and grandmother carded and dyed the wool. We shear the fleece, spin it and dye it with tints from the cochineal insect, pomegranate peel, bark from the huajal tree that thrives here, as well as oak and pecan bark. Stones, dried flowers, almost all the rocks and flowers here yield natural colors."

"Thanks to your support through this microcredit, my family and I can continue doing what we love to do, which is to weave in the traditional way."

Use the link below to view Alberto's traditional handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4559

loans.use: to invest in hiring local artisans to help him, as well as in a bulk purchase of wool and wood

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de mariscos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tienen mucha clientela porque el producto es fresco y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Milagro vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de mariscos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder junto con su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagro is 46 years old and has been selling seafood for several years. Her business is in the market close to her home. She has a lot of customers because the product is fresh and a good price. With the proceeds of her sales she is able to cover the household costs. Milagro lives in her own home with her family. 

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy seafood at wholesale in order to continue with her sales as that is her only source of work and in this way she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seafood at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad tiene desde hace varios años y con esfuerzo una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de habitación, donde vende una variedad de productos y a buenos precios por esa razón posee mucha clientela con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias puede solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, el cliente vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, sopas, azúcar huevos aceite, café, etc. para poder surtir la tienda y atender mejor a sus clientes para tener junto con su esposa una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This client is 24 years old and for the past few years, with great effort, he has run a small store out of his house. He sells a variety of products at good prices so he has many customers, and with his earnings he is able to pay his household expenses. He lives with his wife in the house of a relative.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy basic grains, soups, sugar, eggs, oil, coffee, etc. to stock his store and better meet the needs of his customers. This will allow him and his wife to have more financial stability without any limitations.

loans.use: buy basic grains, soup, sugar, eggs, oil, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Barbara Del Carmen

texts.es: Barbará de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo productos para limpieza como: detergente, legía, cloro, jabón, etc. Actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos. Barbará desea reparar la pila y un cuarto de su vivienda, además desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, ladrillo, de piso, arena, hierro y mano de obra necesaria para colocar ladrillo de piso y reparar la pila y un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Barbara, 33, lives in her own home with her common-law husband and their three children, ages 17, 15 and 8.  She is an enterprising woman who has earned a living selling cleaning products such as detergent, bleach, chlorine, soap, etc.  She has worked as a street vendor for seven years in nearby cantons.  

Barbara wants to fix a sink and a room in her house.  She also wants to lay down floor tile, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, bricks, tile, sand and iron, and to pay labor costs to lay the tile and fix the sink and the room.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, tile, sand, and iron, and pay labor costs to lay tile and repair a sink and a room in the house.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo is a Peruvian artist specializing in hand-woven tapestries and rugs. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and cotton for his designs.

Zosimo has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"I come from a family of weavers in Ayacucho, renowned for its handicrafts. Like my grandparents and brothers, I work on a traditional handloom. Forced to abandon Ayacucho due to turmoil and violence, my family and I moved to an urban center where we faced many obstacles. Nonetheless, my dedication has allowed me to succeed. My goal is to teach my children the textile art when they are old enough."

"I would like to express my gratitude for this timely microcredit. There are times when I'm unable to keep a stock of top products. With this microcredit, I can have the material I need to weave a good stock of products in time for the holiday season."

Use the link below to view Zosimo's hand-woven tapestries and rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3153

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and cotton for his designs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is very bright and intelligent and always dreamed of having her own business. An excellent cook, she has done a lot of research and feels well prepared to start her own pop-up food vendor, selling Mexican food at local markets. 

She has spent a lot of time educating herself and planning the business. Trying to cut her costs as much as possible, she designed her own logo and marketing material. She has also recruited the support of her boyfriend who works at a local farm to source organic products to the business.  

She first learned about microloans when attending a small business jumpstart event put on by local microlender Accion. She held onto the information for over a year while she planned, and now that she is finally ready to launch is looking for capital.  She will use her Kiva loan to pay for start-up costs and to purchase raw materials and inventory.

Angela wants to build a reputation selling at farmers’ markets, eventually moving on to doing parties and catering once her customer base is large enough to support this line of business. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Angela will bring the farm to table experience to the farmers’ markets of San Diego County in a way that is unique, sustainable and successful.

loans.use: to pay for start-up costs and to purchase raw materials and inventory

loans.name: Billy

texts.en: Billy is a 31-year-old married man with two children, ages four and two, and also has an additional dependent. He is a boda-boda (motorcycle) driver and also earns income from his retail shop and brick-laying. Limited capital is his challenge but hopes to expand his businesses. He needs a loan so as to add stock of beer and waragi to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of beer and waragi to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, a 54-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has been earning a living growing vegetables for 15 years now. A member of PMPC for four years, Corazon has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina, a married mother of five, is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She has been a farmer growing bananas to earn a living for 21 years. A member of PMPC for six years, Paulina has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es: José de 54 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura, el terreno  lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, José solicita un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía y continuar con sus siembras,  para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives with his life partner in his own house. He is a farmer and his land is located near where he lives.  With the earnings from his sales he is able to cover his household expenses.

José is asking for a loan so he can buy herbicides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. as shown in the photo, and continue with his crops so he can provide his family a better lifestyle without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has switched from selling snacks to selling dried fish. Her business is doing well, as she has perfected her own dried fish recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

Josephine has requested another loan from PMPC to buy more kilos of fish for her enterprise. Today, Josephine is able to help others in retailing her dried fish, and they as well are earning for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is driven by passion for selling. At the age of 59, she is married and lives in Upper langcangan, Oroquieta City. She runs a store that provides the primary support for their family. She never gets tired tending her store. Emerenciana is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Aside from her store she wants to have another source of income. Now, she borrowed another loan to buy ready-to-wear to sell. Emerenciana hopes that this business will be a big help and help them to survive.

loans.use: to buy assorted ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 52-year-old married lady. She has four children who are 30, 25, 20 and 13, and one of them attends school. She also has one dependent. She has a retail shop dealing in mattresses, shirts, dresses and bags among others. She also earns from farming on a low scale. She faces challenges of limited capital and high license fees. However, she hopes to construct a better residential house. 

Agnes needs a loan to buy bags and mattresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 37-year-old man married living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a two-point grass cutting machine he uses to generate income, and also earns income from running a bar and farming. He faces challenges of limited capital plus seasonal customers, but hopes to expand the business to new places. He needs a loan to buy a three-point grass cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a three grass cutting machine.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Marie. She is married and has one school-going child who is 13 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. 

Marie owns a business from which she earns about SLL 2,600,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Marie requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of set pans, dozens of drinking rubbers, bathing buckets, cups and spoons. 

She is currently involved in her building project, and she was unable to rent a shop because of the building project, but it is still in her plans to rent one. This loan will help her improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of set pans, dozens of drinking rubbers, bathing buckets, cups and spoons.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Dog dresses, dog neckties, pet harnesses and pet couture can all be custom made by Leslie, the proud owner of The Pooch House. Known around her neighborhood as the “crazy dog lady,” nothing makes her happier than when she’s dressing up a cute pup. She started out buying custom creations from other distributors in the puppy apparel business but was unsatisfied with the product. 

“As soon as I got my little Yorkie, Ruby, I wanted to dress her up,” Leslie said. “I was not happy with the styles I was receiving and they were not what I had in mind.” Just one and half years ago, Leslie started The Pooch House. She took a year’s worth of sewing classes and spent three years training to make clothing. Leslie started out just wanting to sell enough clothing to pay for Ruby’s outfits but the business grew from there.  

The Pooch House allows customers to customize their clothing and accessories special for their furry loved ones. “Our philosophy at The Pooch House is to provide high-quality items for your pet while being friendly to your wallet,” she said. Leslie picks up clients when she attends craft shows and pet adoption events. She attends at least one pet event each month to gain client traffic and drive business. She and her husband are currently working on converting a truck that will soon be a mobile boutique for The Pooch House brand.  

She came to Accion Texas Inc. to help fund the renovation of the truck. Because of the loan, the couple was able to purchase a generator and a new air condition for the truck. “In the future, I hope to put on private and corporate events where a percentage of the sales goes to local animal rescue centers in San Antonio,” Leslie said.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her truck that she is converting into a mobile boutique.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia had her own retail business a few years ago selling at the swap meet; however, after becoming pregnant, she decided not to continue with her business and to focus on raising her child instead. 

She eventually found a regular job as an accountant for a local community development organization; however, her natural instincts as a salesman never left her.  She would take any opportunity to share about the great jewelry or perfumes she was wearing and convince her friends and colleagues to try what she was trying. She realized that she could still do retail on the side, while working her regular job and raising her child.  

Dalia will use her Kiva loan to purchase a small inventory of perfumes and jewelry from suppliers in New York and Los Angeles so that she can restart her retail business. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Dalia hopes to slowly grow her business to the point where she can leave her current job, while also spending time with and providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a small inventory of perfumes and jewelry

loans.name: Cerilyn

texts.en:
Cerilyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business (a general store). She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Cerilyn has been able to maintain the turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to continue to take advantage of her good fortune, so recently she has taken out another loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 4 años, gracias a la venta de productos para la limpieza que realiza de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos, además sus 2 hijos mayores de edad le apoyan con la economía familiar. Marina desea reparar el techo de su vivienda y la pila de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, polines y pines para reparar el techo y la pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina, 46 years old, lives in her own home with her two children, who are 6 and 8 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who has for the last four years earned her living thanks to the sale of cleaning products.  She makes her sales as a street vendor in the nearby towns, and her two older children also help support the household finances.  

Marina wants to repair the roof of her home, and the sink of the same.  This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, poles and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, poles and wood to repair the roof and sink  of her home

loans.name: Brandi

texts.en:
Taking care of her family, going to school full-time and preparing to go into her pre-med program, Brandi wanted to find another way to support her family financially. When the opportunity presented itself, she jumped at the chance to invest into the franchise, CruiseONE.
                                                                                                
“I’ve always been interested in the travel business,” Brandi said. “There is something special about helping someone spend time with loved ones and friends.” Brandi is in the last stage of managing her own CruiseONE travel franchise and will begin training in the next two weeks.  The training will give Brandi web-based tools that will help her learn how to navigate through website as well as coach her through the booking process. 

“I just wanted something for myself,” she said. “Between school and taking care of four kids, I can’t afford to have a job outside of the home.” Brandi learned of CruiseONE when she picked up a Forbes Magazine and believes that was the last nudge she needed to push her into owning her own business. She believes it was fate. CruiseONE is recognized as one the top franchises to own worldwide and is ranked in the top 3 percent.  

“In two weeks I will be in business for myself, but I will not be by myself,” Brandi said. “The best thing about being a part of this franchise is that I have a support system within the brand.” Brandi came to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to help fund the franchise costs for owning her own travel agency. “I am grateful I have this chance to help support my family and I am grateful for Accion for supporting me,” Brandi said.

loans.use: to pay for franchise costs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Pacific North 23 is a family business that started six years ago on the Pacific Coast of Mexico by a father and son team both named Jorge. Both being former fishing boat captains, they always had a deep appreciation for fresh, high-quality seafood, which they funneled into starting Pacific North 23, a distributor of top-quality seafood.

After recently expanding to the US, Jorge and Jorge quickly realized that there were many added complexities in running a multinational corporation. This became especially apparent when they tried to seek US financing for their expansion and they realized that they had no US credit history. 

They eventually found Accion San Diego and Kiva to help them with a microloan to start building credit. Their Kiva loan will be used to purchase more product and pay operating costs, but more than anything else its primary purpose will be to establish Pacific North 23 as a trustworthy business in the United States.

Their creation of a transnational supply chain will ensure that they will be able to provide better prices for seafood that exist in the US. With the help of Kiva lenders, Pacific North 23 is an established business that is poised to grow.

Visit their website: http://north23.com

loans.use: to purchase more product, pay operating costs, and establish a credit history
